POSITION

* FULL Time, long-term, remote

* US-based ecommerce brand using a high-volume testing model (CaniCol v2.2)



Compesnation

First month at 1USD per hour for trial period with conditional bonuses

50 Dollar Bonus per winning Ad



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

* Own the brand visual identity across website, ads,
, social, packaging, and content.

* Lead creative strategy for launches, promos, and campaigns.

* Direct photo shoots, video, UGC, and ad creatives.

* Work closely with performance marketing (PPC, paid social) to test and optimize creatives.

* Ensure creatives align with conversion goals (CTR, CVR, AOV).

* Set creative briefs, timelines, and quality standards for designers, editors, and creators.



QUALIFICATIONS

* Prior experience working with content creators, brands, or marketing teams is a plus.

* You must have experience editing short-form vertical videos for platforms such as TikTok, Instagram Reels, or YouTube Shorts.

* You must be able to edit using at least one of the following: CapCut, Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or DaVinci Resolve.

* You must understand pacing and hooks. You know that the first 1 to 3 seconds d
 whether people keep watching or scroll.

* You must be comfortable working completely from existing footage and from AI tools. This is an editing and repurposing role, not a filming role.

* You must be able to create clean subtitles and on-screen text in clear English.

* You must have a reliable computer and stable internet connection that can handle video editing work.

* You must have a strong sense of storytelling and visual flow, even in short-form content.

* You must be familiar with social media trends and understand what performs well on short-form platforms.

* You must be detail-oriented and able to follow brand guidelines and creative directions.

* You must be able to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines consistently.

* You must be open to feedback and able to revise edits efficiently.

* You must have basic knowledge of copyright rules and appropriate content usage.



WORK SCHEDULE AND SETUP

* You can set your own schedule as long as you consistently deliver your weekly output and can overlap at least 2 to 3 hours with US Eastern Time on agreed days for feedback calls or messages.

* You will use Slack for communication, Google Drive for assets and exports, and ClickUp or Notion for tasks. You will use your own editing software.



HOW TO APPLY

* OnlineJobs.ph subject line requirement:

Use this exact subject line when you apply:

CREATE - CREATIVE DIRECTOR



To apply for the Creative Director position, please include the following in the body of your application in plain text:

1. Short Introduction

Write a 3–5 sentence introduction about yourself. Include your experience with short-form video ads, creative strategy, and why a high-volume, repurposing-focused role is a good fit for you.



2. Portfolio / Work Samples

Provide 3–6 links to your best work. These should be vertical short-form videos (TikTok, Instagram Reels, or YouTube Shorts).

Ad-style edits are strongly preferred. If any of these achieved strong performance (views, engagement, or sales), please mention it.



3. Answer the Following Questions:

What editing software do you use daily?

How many 15–30 second ads can you realistically produce in one full working day while maintaining quality?

Have you worked with ecommerce, dropshipping, or DTC brands? If yes, briefly explain your role.

Have you used the TikTok Ad Library or Meta Ad Library to research or repurpose ads?

Are you comfortable with $150/month base pay + $50 USD per validated product, with an expected output of 80–100 ads per month?



4. Work Setup

Describe your computer setup, including CPU, RAM, and GPU (if applicable), and your internet speed. You may include a Speedtest result.



5. Optional (Strong Plus)

Submit a 1–2 minute Loom or unlisted YouTube video where you walk us through one ad you edited and explain your hook, pacing, and call to action.



Only applications that follow these instructions will be reviewed.

title: COO / Operations Integrator for High-Volume Dropshipping System
description:
Compensation & Incentives first month probationary period. (100 dollar increase to base everymonth thereafter)

This role is designed for someone who wants to prove themselves and earn based on performance.



Apply here: 



Base Retainer: $50 USD / week (Guaranteed for meeting minimum responsibilities).



Performance Bonus: $200 USD for every store that validates.





The Opportunity

I am building a data-driven, high-volume product validation machine, and I am looking for a COO-style Operations Integrator to own the execution.



We run a lean, volume-first testing model. We don’t test 3–5 products a month; we test 40–50. We use a structured multi-phase framework (P1 ? P2 ? P3) with clear gates, risk caps, and kill rules.



The machine is built. We need someone to fly it.



You will be the bridge between the founder and the specialist pods (research, creatives, media buying, sourcing). Your job is simple to define but hard to execute: Turn a proven validation model into a predictable, weekly execution rhythm.



Who You Are

You are NOT a VA ticking boxes. You are an operator.



You are an "Integrator": You are the calm operations brain that turns strategy into checklists, timelines, and ownership.



You think in systems: You naturally map how work moves from A ? B ? C and lock in that path.



You are data-literate: You don’t need to be a data scientist, but you can look at a report and instantly say, “We should kill this” or “We should keep testing this.”



You love upside: You prefer a role where your income scales with your results, rather than a flat hourly rate.



Core Responsibilities

You will own the day-to-day orchestration of the entire validation machine.



1. Pipeline & Capacity Management



Maintain a clear product pipeline: Idea ? Ready to Test ? P1 ? P2 ? P3 ? Scale.



Ensure we always have enough products in staging to hit our 40–50/month target.



Balance team capacity so researchers, creatives, and media buyers are never idle but never overloaded.



2. Process & SOP Execution



Enforce the 3-phase gate system. Ensure every product has the required assets before launch.



Confirm kill rules and budgets are respected (prevent emotional overspend).



Create and refine SOPs: Research handoffs, creative briefs, and media buying logging.



3. Cross-Team Coordination



Run regular check-ins with Research, Creative, and Media Buying pods.



Remove bottlenecks fast: If creatives are delayed, you escalate. If a buyer hasn’t launched, you chase. If quality drops, you reset expectations.



4. Systems & Data Hygiene



Create and own the Notion / ClickUp / Sheets structure as the single source of truth.



Maintain clean data for Products, Creatives, and Adsets so we can track validation rates and calculate bonuses accurately.



5. Continuous Improvement



Spot inefficiencies (e.g., "We need a better creative brief") and implement fixes.



Refine the validation model over time based on real results, not theory.



Requirements

2+ Years Experience: Operations, Project Management, or Integrator roles (ideally in E-commerce/Dropshipping).



Remote Team Management: Experience coordinating different pods (researchers, editors, media buyers).



Tech Stack: Strong proficiency in Notion, ClickUp/Asana, Google Sheets, and Slack.



Marketing Knowledge: Familiarity with ROAS, CPA, and AOV (you don’t need to be a media buyer, but you must speak the language).



Communication: Strong written English and relentless follow-through.



Definition: A store validates when it passes our internal criteria and moves into proper scaling.



The Upside: Since we test 40–50 products a month, the validation volume is significantly higher than low-volume models. If you run the system well, multiple validations per month are realistic, meaning your bonus will quickly outgrow the base.



Growth: As the system proves itself, we are open to discussing higher base pay and deeper profit-share arrangements.



How to Apply

Read this carefully. Applications that do not follow these instructions will be ignored.



Step 1: Review the full application details here:



Join 
 Application Channel



View Role Details on Notion



Step 2: Submit your proposal with the following:



Attention to Detail: Include the word “Integrator” somewhere in the first sentence of your proposal.



Experience: Share 1–2 specific examples where you acted as an integrator/ops manager in e-commerce. What was the monthly product or campaign volume?



Systems: Describe one system or workflow you built that made a tea
aningfully more efficient. What tools did you use? How did you measure improvement?



Scenario: If you joined tomorrow and we needed to reliably test 40–50 products per month, how would you structure the pipeline, communication, and weekly check-ins?



Confirmation: Confirm you understand and accept the compensation structure (Base + Performance Bonus).

title: Product Researcher & Lister - Full-Time Position
description:
Full application here





Overview







We’re an e-commerce / dropshipping brand looking for a data-driven product researcher & sourcing specialist who lives for finding winners.







This role is 90 percent performance-based to start, with very strong upside for the right person, plus the opportunity to move into profit share and a fixed base after a successful trial period.







If you’re already using spy tools daily, know how to spot a scalable product from the data (not just gut feeling), and you enjoy working with AI tools like ChatGPT / Claude / Gemini, keep reading.







Compensation Structure







$5 per product that is approved by our Head Researcher for rapid validation testing (target: 30–40 products per batch).







$200 per winning product that passes our internal validation and is scaled profitably (exact criteria shared once hired).







Potential for profit share + base retainer after a successful trial (consistent delivery of qualified products and at least a few validated winners).







Please only apply if you are comfortable with a performance-based structure initially.







What You’ll Be Doing







You will own the front half of our product pipeline, from research to brief handoff:







Product Research Using Our 180-Point Workflow Matrix







Use our internal 180-point scoring system (training provided) to evaluate potential products.







Identify products with strong signals across demand, margins, creative potential, competition, and scalability.







Rapid Sourcing of Testable Products (30–40 per batch)







Generate a steady stream of 30–40 products for rapid validation.







Pre-filter low-quality or obviously unviable products before they reach the Head Researcher.







Spy Tool & Competitor Analysis







Use ad / product spy tools to:







Find competitor ad creatives and angles (Meta/TikTok/YouTube/etc.).







Analyze engagement, freshness, saturation, and positioning.







You must already be proficient with spy tools and have paid access to at least one, such as:







Winning Hunter







Kalodata







PiPAds







Minea







PPSpy







Zik (or similar)







Structured Brief Handoffs to Lead Researcher

For each product that passes your initial filter, prepare a concise product brief, including:







Product summary & main benefit.







Links to product pages and key competitor ads.







Basic metrics (pricing, estimated margins, shipping, etc.).







Suggested creative angles & hooks (e.g., main pain point, desire, demo angle, UGC angle).







Prompt-Engineered Briefs for Creative / Copy







After the Lead Researcher approves a product, turn the brief into prompt-engineered templates for:







Ad copy concepts.







UGC scripts / hooks.







Landing page angles.







Use Claude, ChatGPT, and/or Gemini to accelerate research and brief creation while maintaining structure and quality.







Product Sourcing & Supplier Negotiation







Find reliable suppliers (platforms, private agents, or manufacturers).







Compare pricing, shipping times, and policies.







Negotiate better rates, terms, and sample/test orders when needed.







Flag potential issues (IP, quality risk, logistics constraints) early.







Basic Analytics & Feedback Loop







Track which of your sourced products get:







Approved for testing.







Validated and scaled.







Iterate your research criteria based on what actually wins.







Must-Have Skills & Experience







Please do not apply unless you strongly meet most of these:







Proven experience in ecom / dropshipping product research







You’ve previously found actual winning products (please be ready to show examples and results).







Expert-level usage of product/ad spy tools, including at least one paid account:







(Winning Hunter, Kalodata, PiPAds, Minea, PPSpy, Zik, or comparable tools).







Strong understanding of performance metrics used in testing & scaling:







CTR, CVR, CPA, AOV, ROAS, etc.







Comfortable working within a structured scoring system (we’ll train you on our 180-point matrix).







High proficiency with AI tools:







ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini (or similar) for research, summarization, and creating structured briefs / prompts.







Good written English and the ability to write clear, concise briefs and prompt templates.







Practical experience with product sourcing & supplier negotiation (not just theory).







Highly organized, reliable, and comfortable working under performance incentives rather than hourly pay.







Nice-to-Haves







Experience working directly with media buyers / creative teams.







Familiarity with TikTok/Meta ad ecosystems and the kind of creatives that perform.







Experience with any analytics dashboards, pixel data, or event tracking (even basic level).







What We Offer







Clear framework (180-point matrix) and SOPs so you’re not guessing.







Steady pipeline of validation tests – if you’re good, you’ll have a lot of shots on goal.







High upside: $200 per winning product can stack quickly if you consistently find strong offers.







After proving yourself:







Profit share on certain product lines, and







Transition to a base + performance bonus structure.







How to Apply (Follow These Steps)







To filter for people who actually read the post, please start your proposal with the word “MATRIX”



Full application here

title: Full Time UGC Dropshipping Video Editor
description:
Full application here







SALARY



2USD per Video Approved

50USD per winning Ad



POSITION



FULL Time, long-term, remote

US-based ecommerce brand using a high-volume testing model (CaniCol v2.2)



ABOUT THE ROLE



We are building a creative engine where volume and speed matter. Our CaniCol model tests many products every month using strict rules and lean budgets. Creatives are the main fuel.



We are hiring one dedicated video editor to turn existing assets into short-form ads for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.





You will work only with existing footage, b-roll, product clips, images, reviews, ad library downloads, and AI tools. Your goal is to produce 100 ads per month that give us enough shots on goal to find winning products.



This role is ideal if you like high-output work, clear targets, and long-term stability.



ABOUT US AND THE CANICOL MODEL



We run a lean, volume-based dropshipping system. We test many products each month and make decisions fast based on data.



Our model focuses on:

Fast product testing with controlled budgets

High volume of creatives per product

Clear kill, pass, and scale rules

Accepting some false negatives in exchange for more total tests



Your edits plug directly into this engine. Your ads are what we run in Phase 1 and Phase 2 tests. When a product reaches validated status using your creatives, you earn a bonus. This aligns your work with our real goal: validated products and profitable campaigns.



We work with Slack, ClickUp or Notion, and Google Drive. You will receive clear briefs and assets, and we will give feedback based on real ad performance such as hook rate and click through rate.



MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES



You will edit 100 short-form video ads per month. Each video is usually 15 to 35 seconds, vertical 9:16 format, for TikTok, Reels, and Shorts.



You will work only from existing assets. Examples include competitor ads from TikTok and Meta Ad Libraries, supplier or manufacturer videos, product b-roll, product photos, customer reviews, screenshots, stock clips, and AI generated or AI assisted clips.



You will create multiple variations from the same base assets. This means trying different hooks in the first 1 to 3 seconds, different scene order and pacing, and different angles and calls to action.



You will add strong direct response elements. This includes clear on screen text, readable subtitles, benefit driven captions, problem and solution framing, social proof, and urgency when appropriate.



You will export files correctly and keep all files named and organized following our structure in Google Drive.



You will make fast revisions when we see what is working and what is not. When a product shows good signals, we will ask you for more variations quickly so we can push it through the CaniCol gates.



REQUIRED SKILLS



You must have experience editing short-form vertical videos for platforms such as TikTok, Instagram Reels, or YouTube Shorts.



You must be able to edit using at least one of the following: CapCut, Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or DaVinci Resolve.



You must understand pacing and hooks. You know that the first 1 to 3 seconds d
 whether people keep watching or scroll.



You must be comfortable working completely from existing footage and from AI tools. This is an editing and repurposing role, not a filming role.



You must be able to create clean subtitles and on-screen text in clear English.



You must have a reliable computer and stable internet connection that can handle video editing work.



SOFT SKILLS WE VALUE



You follow instructions very carefully and care about details such as file names and structure.



You hit deadlines and weekly output targets without needing to be chased.



You are open to direct feedback and can adjust your style based on performance data and comments.



You ask questions when something is unclear instead of guessing and wasting time.



You want a long-term, stable role and are not just looking for a quick project.



COMPENSATION AND GROWTH



Pay is 150USD per month retainer in exchange for 80 edited short-form ads for the first month. After proven, retainer will increase.



You also receive a 50 USD bonus for each validated product. A product is considered validated when campaigns using your creatives hit our internal performance targets over several days at proper ad spend. We will share these rules clearly in writing so you know exactly what has to happen for a product to count as validated.



As your creatives help us find more winning products, we will review your base pay and bonus structure. There is potential for higher pay and for you to become a lead editor in the future.



We pay on time and review performance regularly.



WORK SCHEDULE AND SETUP



This is a part-time, long-term, remote role.



You can set your own schedule as long as you consistently deliver your weekly output and can overlap at least 2 to 3 hours with US Eastern Time on agreed days for feedback calls or messages.



You will use Slack for communication, Google Drive for assets and exports, and ClickUp or Notion for tasks. You will use your own editing software.



HOW TO APPLY



OnlineJobs.ph subject line requirement:



Use this exact subject line when you apply:

BLUE – Short-Form Ads Video Editor



In the body of your application, include the following in plain text:



First, a short introduction of 3 to 5 sentences. Tell us who you are, your experience with short-form ads, and why a high volume, repurposing focused role like this fits you.



Second, links to 3 to 6 examples of your work. These should be vertical short-form videos. Ad style edits are preferred. You can send Google Drive links, TikTok or Instagram profiles, or YouTube links. If any of these performed well in terms of views or sales, mention that.



Third, answer these questions in simple text:

What editing software do you use every day?

How many 15 to 30 second ads can you realistically edit in a full working day at good quality?

Have you worked with ecommerce, dropshipping, or DTC brands before? If yes, what did you do?

Have you used TikTok or Meta Ad Library before to study or repurpose ads?

Are you comfortable with 150$ per month base pay plus 50 USD per validated product and an output of 80-100 ads per month?



Fourth, describe your setup. Write your computer specs including CPU, RAM, and GPU if you have one. Also tell us your internet speed. You can paste your speedtest result if you want.



Fifth, optional but a big plus. You may send a 1 to 2 minute Loom or unlisted YouTube video where you show one ad you edited and explain how you built the hook, the middle, and the call to action.



HIRING PROCESS



We will first review applications that follow all instructions and use the correct subject line.



We will then shortlist candidates based on portfolio, clarity of answers, and fit for a high-volume testing environment.



Shortlisted candidates will be invited to a paid test project using our assets.



After the test project, we will choose one editor for a one month paid trial. If both sides are happy after the trial, we will continue on a long-term basis.



If you want a long-term, data driven editing role where your work is directly tied to validated products and bonuses, we invite you to apply.

title: Shopify and Landing Page Builder for Dropshipping
description:
Full application here







About the role:

We’re looking for a landing page builder to help us quickly create and optimize conversion-focused pages for new e-commerce products.

We run a high-volume product testing model, typically testing 40–50 products. That means you’ll have many chances for “wins” and the associated $100 validation bonuses when your pages perform.

If you’re strong in Shopify/landing page builders, basic UX, and persuasive layout, this is a great opportunity for steady weekly income plus upside.



SOP







Compensation:



$20 USD per landing page built and approved (fixed weekly payment)



$100 USD bonus for every store that validates (details below)



Historically
a month retainer based on past validation numbers







Responsibilities:



Build simple, high-converting landing pages for single-product or small catalog e-commerce “stores”



Use our product briefs, angles, and references to structure pages that sell



Handle layout and structure (hero, benefits, social proof, FAQ, CTA sections, etc.)



Implement pages using no-code tools (for example: Shopify page builders like GemPages, PageFly, Shogun, or Webflow/other similar tools)



Collaborate with our team on iterations once we see early data



Ensure pages are mobile-first, fast-loading, and clean

Note: You will not be responsible for running ads or managing traffic. Your focus is building and refining landing pages/stores.

What “validation” means (how you earn the $100 bonus):



A store/landing page is considered validated when it hits both of the following during our testing window (usually the first 7–14 days after launch with paid traffic):



Sales threshold:



At least $1000 in tracked sales from cold traffic (excluding refunds and test orders)



Customer threshold:



At least 20 unique paying customers

When a store that you built meets these criteria during one of our test cycles, you earn a $100 USD bonus for that store, paid on top of your weekly $50.



Because we test 40–50 products, and you’ll be building for multiple products over time, there is a real opportunity to stack bonuses as more stores validate.



What we provide:



Clear product briefs (features, benefits, audience)



Reference sites and examples when available



Guidance on brand voice and style



A consistent pipeline of products to work on



Fast feedback based on performance data (what’s working / what isn’t)

Requirements (must-haves):



Proven experience building conversion-focused landing pages or e-commerce storefronts



Familiarity with at least one landing page or store builder (Shopify + GemPages/PageFly/Shogun, Webflow, or similar)



Strong grasp of layout, hierarchy, and clarity (you understand what makes a page easy to scan and buy from)



Ability to work from a brief and move quickly with minimal hand-holding



Reliable communication and consistent weekly delivery

Nice-to-haves:



Experience with DTC brands, dropshipping, or product testing environments



Basic understanding of CRO (A/B tests, above-the-fold design, scarcity, social proof)



Light copy-editing skills (comfortable polishing headlines and section text)

Time commitment and workflow:



Ongoing role with weekly work



Expect a few landing pages/stores per week, depending on product volume and your speed



We will start with a short test task (one landing page) to ensure mutual fit

Compensation summary:



Base: $50/week guaranteed, paid through Upwork



Bonus: $100 for each validated store you build (as defined above)



Upside: With 40–50 products in our testing pipeline, strong builders have many chances to hit multiple validations and bonuses over time

How to apply:

Please apply via these qustions and include:



A short introduction (1–2 paragraphs) about your landing page/e-commerce experience



3–5 examples of landing pages or stores you’ve built (links/portfolio)



What tools/page builders you are most comfortable with



Your approximate weekly availability (in hours) and your time zone



Compensation confirmation: Our structure is $50 USD per week base pay, plus a $100 USD bonus for every store you build that validates. Do you fully understand and agree to this compensation model?



Portfolio: Please share 3–5 links to landing pages or e-commerce stores you have personally built, and briefly describe your role in each.



Tools and stack: Which platforms and page builders are you most experienced with plus use of shrine (e.g., Shopify, GemPages, PageFly, Shogun, Webflow, etc.)? Please list them and indicate your proficiency level for each



Availability and speed: How many hours per week can you reliably commit, and how many simple product landing pages can you usually complete in a week?



Experience with testing and performance: Have you worked in a product testing or high-iteration environment before (e.g., testing many products or variations quickly)? If yes, describe your experience and how you used performance data to improve pages.



Deliverables

Build and optimize Shopify store

Design high-converting landing pages

Integrate payment gateways

Ensure mobile responsiveness

Optimize for SEO



If you do not answer these questions your application will not be considered.

title: UX/UI & Graphic Designer (Framer Portfolio Site)
description:
Full application here







Job Overview

I’m looking for a designer-first person (not just a page builder) to design and build a premium portfolio + brand site in Framer and a simple “HQ shell” page for my internal OS.

This role is heavily focused on UX, UI, and visual/graphic design. Framer is the tool you’ll use to ship the final site.

Type: Project-based to start (with potential ongoing work)

Hours: Flexible, with some overlap with US Eastern time preferred

Location: Remote (Philippines only, via OnlineJobs.ph)



About Me / Brand

My name is Loong. I’m building DriveOn – a systems-focused brand combining:

E-commerce / dropshipping operations (SOPs, dashboards, workflows)

High-end performance, wellness, and golf

I already have internal HTML dashboards and OS-style workflows. I now need a strong designer to create a clean, premium public face and a visual HQ entry page.

What You Will Work On

1. Portfolio / Marketing Site (Framer)

Design and build a single-page (or lean multi-page) site that:

Clearly presents:

Who I am (Loong)

What DriveOn / DriveOn OS / DriveOn Commerce are

Includes:

Strong hero section (headline, subheadline, clear CTA)

Sections for “What I Build” (short descriptions + cards)

Visuals / mockups of dashboards and systems

About / story section

2. DriveOn HQ Shell (Framer)

Each pod shown as clean cards/sections that will link to separate tools/dashboards

Main Responsibilities

Internal tea
mbers (HQ entry page)

Buttons, chips, tags, cards

Build the final site in Framer:

Minimum Qualifications (Must-Haves)

Please only apply if you meet all of these:

Strong portfolio in UX/UI design

Visual / graphic design skills

You can create clean hero sections, sections, and simple custom graphics (not just use templates)



Framer experience

Dark/light, clean typography, no clutter, no “loud” or cheap gradients

Work Setup & Compensation

Fixed project rate based of 2USD per hour with bonus based on results





How to Apply (Read Carefully)

To help me filter for people who read the full post (a common best practice on OnlineJobs.ph), please follow these instructions exactly.

Please include, in order:

Links to 3–5 of your best design works:

Bonus filter (optional but appreciated):

title: Dropshipping/Ecommerce Short-Form Ads Video Editor (TikTok / Reels / Shorts) – Long-Term
description:
Full application here







SALARY



150 USD per month base retainer

Plus 50 USD bonus per validated product



POSITION



FULL Time, long-term, remote

US-based ecommerce brand using a high-volume testing model (CaniCol v2.2)



ABOUT THE ROLE



We are building a creative engine where volume and speed matter. Our CaniCol model tests many products every month using strict rules and lean budgets. Creatives are the main fuel.



We are hiring one dedicated video editor to turn existing assets into short-form ads for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.





You will work only with existing footage, b-roll, product clips, images, reviews, ad library downloads, and AI tools. Your goal is to produce 100 ads per month that give us enough shots on goal to find winning products.



This role is ideal if you like high-output work, clear targets, and long-term stability.



ABOUT US AND THE CANICOL MODEL



We run a lean, volume-based dropshipping system. We test many products each month and make decisions fast based on data.



Our model focuses on:

Fast product testing with controlled budgets

High volume of creatives per product

Clear kill, pass, and scale rules

Accepting some false negatives in exchange for more total tests



Your edits plug directly into this engine. Your ads are what we run in Phase 1 and Phase 2 tests. When a product reaches validated status using your creatives, you earn a bonus. This aligns your work with our real goal: validated products and profitable campaigns.



We work with Slack, ClickUp or Notion, and Google Drive. You will receive clear briefs and assets, and we will give feedback based on real ad performance such as hook rate and click through rate.



MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES



You will edit 100 short-form video ads per month. Each video is usually 15 to 35 seconds, vertical 9:16 format, for TikTok, Reels, and Shorts.



You will work only from existing assets. Examples include competitor ads from TikTok and Meta Ad Libraries, supplier or manufacturer videos, product b-roll, product photos, customer reviews, screenshots, stock clips, and AI generated or AI assisted clips.



You will create multiple variations from the same base assets. This means trying different hooks in the first 1 to 3 seconds, different scene order and pacing, and different angles and calls to action.



You will add strong direct response elements. This includes clear on screen text, readable subtitles, benefit driven captions, problem and solution framing, social proof, and urgency when appropriate.



You will export files correctly and keep all files named and organized following our structure in Google Drive.



You will make fast revisions when we see what is working and what is not. When a product shows good signals, we will ask you for more variations quickly so we can push it through the CaniCol gates.



REQUIRED SKILLS



You must have experience editing short-form vertical videos for platforms such as TikTok, Instagram Reels, or YouTube Shorts.



You must be able to edit using at least one of the following: CapCut, Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or DaVinci Resolve.



You must understand pacing and hooks. You know that the first 1 to 3 seconds d
 whether people keep watching or scroll.



You must be comfortable working completely from existing footage and from AI tools. This is an editing and repurposing role, not a filming role.



You must be able to create clean subtitles and on-screen text in clear English.



You must have a reliable computer and stable internet connection that can handle video editing work.



SOFT SKILLS WE VALUE



You follow instructions very carefully and care about details such as file names and structure.



You hit deadlines and weekly output targets without needing to be chased.



You are open to direct feedback and can adjust your style based on performance data and comments.



You ask questions when something is unclear instead of guessing and wasting time.



You want a long-term, stable role and are not just looking for a quick project.



COMPENSATION AND GROWTH



Base pay is 150 USD per month in exchange for 80 edited short-form ads.



You also receive a 50 USD bonus for each validated product. A product is considered validated when campaigns using your creatives hit our internal performance targets over several days at proper ad spend. We will share these rules clearly in writing so you know exactly what has to happen for a product to count as validated.



As your creatives help us find more winning products, we will review your base pay and bonus structure. There is potential for higher pay and for you to become a lead editor in the future.



We pay on time and review performance regularly.



WORK SCHEDULE AND SETUP



This is a part-time, long-term, remote role.



You can set your own schedule as long as you consistently deliver your weekly output and can overlap at least 2 to 3 hours with US Eastern Time on agreed days for feedback calls or messages.



You will use Slack for communication, Google Drive for assets and exports, and ClickUp or Notion for tasks. You will use your own editing software.



HOW TO APPLY



OnlineJobs.ph subject line requirement:



Use this exact subject line when you apply:

BLUE – Short-Form Ads Video Editor



In the body of your application, include the following in plain text:



First, a short introduction of 3 to 5 sentences. Tell us who you are, your experience with short-form ads, and why a high volume, repurposing focused role like this fits you.



Second, links to 3 to 6 examples of your work. These should be vertical short-form videos. Ad style edits are preferred. You can send Google Drive links, TikTok or Instagram profiles, or YouTube links. If any of these performed well in terms of views or sales, mention that.



Third, answer these questions in simple text:

What editing software do you use every day?

How many 15 to 30 second ads can you realistically edit in a full working day at good quality?

Have you worked with ecommerce, dropshipping, or DTC brands before? If yes, what did you do?

Have you used TikTok or Meta Ad Library before to study or repurpose ads?

Are you comfortable with 150 USD per month base pay plus 50 USD per validated product and an output of 80-100 ads per month?



Fourth, describe your setup. Write your computer specs including CPU, RAM, and GPU if you have one. Also tell us your internet speed. You can paste your speedtest result if you want.



Fifth, optional but a big plus. You may send a 1 to 2 minute Loom or unlisted YouTube video where you show one ad you edited and explain how you built the hook, the middle, and the call to action.



HIRING PROCESS



We will first review applications that follow all instructions and use the correct subject line.



We will then shortlist candidates based on portfolio, clarity of answers, and fit for a high-volume testing environment.



Shortlisted candidates will be invited to a paid test project using our assets.



After the test project, we will choose one editor for a one month paid trial. If both sides are happy after the trial, we will continue on a long-term basis.



If you want a long-term, data driven editing role where your work is directly tied to validated products and bonuses, we invite you to apply.

title: Senior E-Commerce Operations Manager + Strategic Executive AssistantLocation: Remote (Philippines strongly preferred)
description:
Full application here





Dropshipping Project Manager (PH) — $4/hr + Performance Bonuses



Platform: OnlineJobs.ph • Type: Full-time (preferred) or Part-time • Shift: PH night shift with US (EST) overlap



Real Talk (No BS)



I’m not hiring a “VA with a buzzword resume.” I’m looking for someone who’s actually built a dropshipping store—win or lose. You’ve stayed up watching Verum/Biaheza/Jordan Welch/Arie Scherson, burned ad spend, handled angry customers, and learned by doing. If that’s you, keep reading.



What We’re Building



A real, systemized dropshipping business (not chaos). I’ve already built the SOPs, handbooks, frameworks, and dashboards. I need a hands-on Project Manager who’s been in the trenches to run operations and make calls.



Your Core Responsibilities

Day-to-Day Ops



Own the pipeline: product research ? creatives ? ads ? fulfillment ? customer support



Manage the team (VAs/designers/media buyers/CS) and hit daily/weekly deliverables



Track metrics, call out issues early, and fix problems before they blow up



Report daily in Slack + update tasks in ClickUp/Trello



Product & Store Management



Find/validate products (ad spy tools, TikTok, competitor checks, margins, test orders)



Build high-converting product pages in Shopify (offers, bundles, reviews, urgency properly done)



Manage stock/fulfillment rules to avoid oversell/run-outs



Kill losers fast, scale winners hard



Marketing & Ads



Coordinate with media buyers (or run tests yourself if you can)



Know what good creatives look like (UGC, 
s, testimonials, hooks)



Read the numbers (CPM, CTR, CPC, ATC, IC, CVR, CPA, MER/ROAS) and optimize



Scale profitably—no vanity spend



Supplier & Fulfillment



Source reliable suppliers (AliExpress, CJ, Zendrop, etc.)



Negotiate shipping times and rates; ensure tracking updates on time



Handle lost packages, delays, and QC issues without hurting CX



Keep refunds/chargebacks under control



Must-Haves (Non-Negotiable)



You’ve built your own store(s) (one-product or GSB/general store brand). Success or failure—both count.



You stay current on YouTube (Verum, Biaheza, Jordan Welch, Arie Scherson, etc.).



Full-stack understanding of the process end-to-end (product ? creative ? ads ? fulfillment ? CS).



You’ve run Meta/TikTok ads and actually understand CPM/CTR/CPC/ROAS and what “good” looks like.



Supplier experience (placed test orders, handled delays, dealt with platforms mentioned above).



Analytical (lives in spreadsheets, makes decisions with data).



People management (you’ve led VAs/freelancers and held them accountable).



Real Requirements (What you’ll show me)



Links/screenshots of stores you’ve built (even failed ones)



Your process to launch a product from scratch (step-by-step)



Understanding of GSB vs one-product store models



What “good” ad creatives look like in 2024/2025



Comfortable in Shopify,
 Ads Manager, basic analytics



Available for daily check-ins and ongoing ops



Bonus Points



Hit $10k+/mo with your own store; scaled profitably past $50k/mo



TikTok organic + paid experience



Built high-converting product pages (proof)



You get customer psychology and know how to minimize refunds/chargebacks



Why This Role Rocks



Not chaos: SOPs/handbooks/templates are ready.



Real authority: You make decisions and own outcomes.



Performance pay: Hit KPIs ? earn more.



Serious scale: Goal is 6–7 figures with systems.



Roadmap



Month 1 – Setup & Foundation



Learn the systems, finalize tool stack, set up tracking dashboards



Start product research + validation, draft launch calendar



Define team roles & SLAs



Months 2–3 – Launch & Test



Launch products, commission UGC, start ad tests



Fulfillment + CS humming, daily metric reviews



Kill/iterate fast



Month 4+ – Scale



Double down on winners, expand catalog, add new channels



Tighten ops, increase velocity, push toward $50k–$100k+/mo



Compensation & Schedule



Rate: $4/hr to start (PH)



Bonuses: Performance-based (revenue/profit/milestones)



Hours: 40 hrs/wk preferred (part-time possible)



Shift: PH night shift with 2–4 hours EST overlap for check-ins



Type: Long-term, stable role for the right person



Tools: Shopify, Meta/TikTok Ads, Google Sheets, Slack, ClickUp/Trello, Gorgias/Zendesk, CJ/Zendrop/Ali, Drive



Extras (when targets are met): internet allowance, paid test tasks, performance bonuses



How to Apply (Follow Exactly)



/Message Subject (via OnlineJobs.ph):

Dropship PM – $4/hr – [Your Name] – OJPH ID: [Your ID]



Include everything below in one message:



Your Stores – Links or screenshots (if offline), what worked/didn’t, key lessons.



Your Numbers – Best month, AOV, CVR, ROAS/MER for winners, ad spend.



Your Process – How you’d launch a product tomorrow (source ? validate ? offer ? page ? creatives ? ads ? fulfillment ? CS).



YouTube Gurus – Who you follow and the strategies you’ve tested.



Best Win – Product, creative angle/hook, why it worked.



Worst Loss – What went wrong + what you changed after.



Team Experience – How you manage VAs/designers/editors/media buyers.



Availability – Hours per week, PH timezone, internet speed (screenshot), start date.



Quick Questions (Answer Briefly)



Have you personally built and launched a dropshipping store? (Yes/No; if Yes, give 2–3 lines.)



What product would you launch right now and why?



Your go-to ad spy tool and why?



Describe a strong 2024/
 ad creative for 
 (hook, format, length, CTA).



What’s a good ROAS target for a new test vs a scaled winner?



How do you handle a supplier who keeps delaying orders?



Top YouTube channels you watch to stay current?



One-product vs GSB—when do you use each?



Don’t Apply If



You’ve never built your own store (only worked for others)



You don’t know GSB or one-product store models



You’ve never run ads with your own money



You only learned from one $997 course and never tested



You avoid ownership/decision-making



You’ve never worked with suppliers/handled fulfillment



You don’t know current creative trends



What I’m Looking For



 Real experience •  Hustle •  Data-driven •  Ownership

 Fast learner • Fluent in “dropship” •  Team player •  Honest



If you’ve been in the trenches and you’re hungry to build something real, apply with your story—not a generic resume.



What This Role Actually Is

title: Luxury Shopify Store Builder for Branded Wellness E-Commerce (DriveOn)
description:
Full application here







Long-Term Project | $50USD paid upon completion of each store | Filipino Applicants Only



ABOUT THE BRAND



DriveOn is a high-end wellness and performance brand focused on:



Recovery equipment



Mobility tools



Fitness and home gym accessories



Golf performance and biomechanics



Premium protocols and systems



Our standard is simple:

We operate like a luxury DTC brand, not a typical dropshipping store.

Everything must look and feel at the same level as Therabody, Hyperice, and Peloton.



We are building a full-scale Shopify website that reflects this brand identity and presents DriveOn as a premium authority in wellness and athletic performance.



ROLE OVERVIEW



We are hiring one highly skilled Shopify Store Builder who can execute a complete, premium, branded e-commerce build.



This role requires:



Strong Shopify implementation skills



Clear understanding of branded niche stores (not general stores)



Ability to follow a detailed specification document



High attention to detail



Professional, polished UI/UX standards



Strong communication and daily reporting



This is a project-based role with the potential for long-term work.



COMPENSATION



Rate: $3 per hour (fixed)

Hours: 90–120 hours total

Duration: 3–6 weeks

Work Setup: Remote (PH only)

Payment Frequency: Weekly via Wise or PayPal

Time Tracking Required: Yes (Toggl or Clockify)



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Shopify Theme & UX Implementation

Homepage & Site Architecture

Product & Bundle Build-Out

Documentation

DriveOn Shopify Build Specification (Google Doc):

title: Inbound Buyer Leads VA – Speed-to-Lead (Real Estate / Mortgage)
description:
Inbound Buyer Leads Virtual Assistant – Speed-to-Lead (Real Estate / Mortgage)



Overview:

We are hiring a reliable, performance-driven Virtual Assistant to handle inbound buyer leads for a mortgage-first real estate team.



This role is focused on speed, consistency, and execution.

You will work with real buyer inquiries (MLS access registrations, buyer forms).

This is NOT cold calling and NOT a sales role.



Your success in this role is measured primarily by how fast you respond to new lead activity.



What You’ll Be Doing:

- Immediately contacting new inbound buyer leads (calls + CRM follow-up)

- Asking one required qualification question:

  “Will you be financing the purchase, or paying cash?”

- Routing leads into the correct workflow:

  - Financing buyers ? application + Loan Officer call

  - Cash buyers ? confirmed live call

- Monitoring CRM activity 
 opens, link clicks, replies)

- Re-engaging leads when new activity appears

- Updating lead status and notes inside the CRM



You will NOT:

- Quote rates

- Discuss loan terms

- Analyze income or credit

- Provide financial advice



Speed-to-Lead Requirement (CRITICAL):

- New leads must be contacted within 1–3 minutes

- Activity-based follow-up also creates a new 1–3 minute response window

- This is the #1 KPI for this role



If you cannot consistently respond within this window, this role is not a fit.



CRM & Tools:

- Experience with BoldTrail (KV Core) is strongly preferred

- You must be comfortable:

  - Initiating outbound calls

  - Updating lead status

  - Logging notes

  - Working independently



Existing Leads:

In addition to new inbound leads, there is an existing pool of buyer leads in the CRM with ongoing activity (home views, replies, messages).

Strong performers can generate additional bonuses by re-engaging these leads.



Schedule & Availability:

- Coverage required: 7 days per week

- Primary activity window:

  7:00 AM – 9:00 PM Pacific Time (Seattle)

- This is an on-call responsiveness role, not hourly tracking



US Phone Requirement (Non-Negotiable):

- You must have access to a US-based phone number

- International numbers are not accepted



Compensation:

- Base pay: $300/month (paid monthly)

  Base pay is for availability and immediate responsiveness



Performance Bonuses (Primary Earnings):

- $15 per completed mortgage application

- $15 per showed-up scheduled Loan Officer call

- $25 per confirmed cash buyer (live call completed)



One lead can generate multiple bonuses.



Performance & Trial:

- KPI-driven role

- Performance reviewed daily during the first week

- Continued engagement depends on speed, execution, and follow-through



How to Apply:

Please apply through this platform and clearly answer:

1. Do you have access to a US-based phone number?

2. Describe your experience with speed-to-lead or appointment setting.

3. Confirm that you understand this is a performance-based role (not hourly).



Applications without US phone confirmation will not be considered.

title: Admin Assistant (Finance industry)
description:
Role Summary



We’re hiring an Admin Assistant who owns process, systems, and operational flow across finance, product, and client communication, with experience in the finance industry.



This role sits at the center of:



* finance workflows

* AI/product outputs

* client-facing operations



You’ll work hands-on with Notion, Slack, and Google Workspace to reduce manual friction, improve response times, and ensure nothing falls through the cracks.



This is not a passive admin role.

It’s a builder role for someone who thinks in workflows, structure, and execution.



Core Responsibilities



1. Systems & Workflow Ownership (Primary Focus)



* Design, build, and maintain clear operational workflows

* Connect processes across:



* Notion (databases, task tracking, SOPs)

* Slack (alerts, handovers, internal updates)

* Google Workspace (Forms, Docs, Sheets, Drive)

* Own workflows for:



* client intake and data collection

* task creation and assignments

* status updates and internal visibility

* handovers between ops, finance, and product

* Monitor workflows to ensure reliability and clarity



Success = fewer manual errors and smoother execution every month.



2. Client Operations & Communication



* Act as the ops point-of-contact for client questions and requests

* Confidently acknowledge client queries even when validation is needed

* Use systems and tracking to ensure follow-ups happen on time

* Translate finance outputs into clear, client-friendly updates



3. Finance Workflow Coordination



* Ensure finance teams receive complete, clean inputs

* Reduce back-and-forth through structured forms and clear processes

* Track deadlines and dependencies across teams

* Flag bottlenecks before they become client issues



4. Process Documentation & Improvement



* Maintain SOPs in Notion

* Ensure documentation reflects live workflows, not outdated processes

* Continuously improve systems as the product evolves



Tools You’ll Work With Daily



* Notion (databases, SOPs, workflow tracking)

* Slack (internal coordination)

* Google Workspace (Forms, Sheets, Docs, Drive)

* CRM / finance tools (training provided)



Requirements



* 2–4 years experience in operations, systems, or workflow-heavy roles

* Strong understanding of process design and operational logic

* Confident written communicator

* Highly organised and proactive

* Comfortable working with finance and product teams (without needing to be the expert)



Nice to Have



* Experience supporting SaaS or finance operations

* Prior use of Notion as an operational system (not just notes)

* Startup or scale-up experience

* Remote-first team experience



What Success Looks Like



* Fewer operational errors

* Faster client response times

* Clear, predictable workflows

* Finance teams protected from chaos

* Clients who feel informed and supported

title: Volleyball Club Assistant
description:

This role is essential to keeping our games organized, our players informed, and our community engaged.

?

?



Skills & Qualifications

title: TikTok Creator Scout / Outreach

Part-time

General Criteria

title: SENIOR FB ADS + Google ADS specialist 5+ Years experience
description:
About the Companies

Legend Sports and Razzaque Paradise Properties are growth-driven companies operating in competitive real estate markets. We are focused on lead generation and acquisition, not vanity metrics. Our goal is simple: consistent, high-quality real estate leads that convert into deals.



We are looking for a top-tier Paid Ads Specialist with deep, hands-on experience in real estate
 Ads and Google Ads to take ownership of our acquisition funnel.



The Role

We are hiring an experienced Real Estate
 & Google Ads Specialist with at least 5 years of proven experience running paid acquisition campaigns in real estate.



This role is for someone who understands real estate buyer and seller psychology, knows how to build funnels that convert, and can optimize campaigns for cost per lead, cost per acquisition, and deal quality.



This is not an entry-level role. We want a strategic operator, not just an ad launcher.



Key Responsibilities

• Plan, launch, and scale
 Ads and Google Ads for real estate acquisition

• Build and optimize full-funnel campaigns (cold traffic ? retargeting ? conversion)

• Generate qualified buyer and seller leads, not junk traffic

• Continuously optimize for CPL, CPA, ROAS, and lead quality

• Write and test high-converting ad creatives, copy, and audiences

• Set up and manage tracking (Meta Pixel, Google Tags, conversions, events)

• Analyze performance data and make data-driven decisions

• Identify and fix funnel bottlenecks quickly

• Collaborate with internal teams to improve lead follow-up and conversion



What We’re Looking For

• Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience running
 & Google Ads for real estate

• Proven track record in real estate lead generation and acquisition

• Strong understanding of buyer/seller funnels and local market targeting

• Experience with high-spend accounts and scaling winning campaigns

• Ability to manage budgets responsibly and profitably

• Highly analytical, results-driven, and detail-oriented

• Self-starter who takes ownership and accountability



What Success Looks Like

• Consistent flow of high-quality real estate leads

• Stable and scalable acquisition systems

• Improved CPL and CPA over time

• Clear reporting and transparency on performance

• Direct contribution to closed deals and revenue growth



Why Work With Us

• Serious brands with real budgets and clear acquisition goals

• Long-term opportunity for the right performer

• Full ownership of the paid ads channel

• Results-focused environment (no micromanagement, no fluff)



If you are a real estate paid ads expert who knows how to drive acquisition—not just clicks—we want to hear from you.

title: Principal Java BackEnd Developer (Long term Remote job)
description:
(Please do not apply if you don't meet the requirements. Thank you.)



Job Description: Principal Java Developer

 

About LoveAdmin:

LoveAdmin is an established, energetic, fast-growing SaaS company, delivering advanced management software to over 1,000 sports clubs, course providers and membership organisations across the UK.

We provide smart online services that take the pain and hassle out of admin and payments - in short, we help make our customers’ lives easier and their organisations more profitable.

Our vision is to work together to support and care for all our customers at all times, and we achieve this by inviting the smartest, kindest, and most driven people to join our team. Because of this we have a genuine, connected culture of support and teamwork.

 

The Role:

As a Principal Java Engineer, you'll join a talented and professional engineering team, collectively responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining backend systems and services for our SaaS web applications. Working across multiple applications that serve the needs of our business customers, their users and our internal support teams, you will liaise with all parties as needed to deliver stable, secure and scalable product enhancements.

 

You will be a high performing team player, a master of your trade, able to overcome obstacles on your own, but also add value to the team by bringing knowledge, passion and support to those around you. Comfortable to make decisions when needed and able to communicate with business departments and stakeholders to understand requirements, provide updates and identify resolutions.

 

Responsibilities:

Work with our UK based Lead Java Developer and wider team to design, build, test and implement new features using Java/Spring Boot and PostgreSQL/Mongo

Communicate daily with the UK based product and development teams. Discuss the detail of technical issues and comprehend product definitions to ensure reduced errors caused by miscommunication

Produce high quality, maintainable code

Own your own projects, working with the wider product function to deliver solutions that meet the business goals, whilst maintaining and improving the tech stack as we go

Participate in peer reviewing for quality of the code and knowledge sharing/gathering

Provide support to your peers and mentor the more junior members of the backend team.

Ensure unit testing as standard to ensure high quality of the code being produced

Create documentation for future reference and support

Work to an Agile methodology to deliver new features and maintain the existing codebase

Potential to progress to a team management role if it supports your ability to lead on best practice and influence team learning

 

Required Skills:

Expert-level knowledge of Java 21 and a solid grasp of JVM fundamentals.

Familiarity with both synchronous and asynchronous Java processes

Deep level, hands-on experience with Spring Boot 3.x, including foundational frameworks such as Hibernate and Spring Security

Ability to configure, optimize and upgrade components across the Spring ecosystem

Proven track record of analysing and optimizing complex queries in Postgres

Knowledge of Postgres schema design and best practices for high-performance data access

Familiarity with containerization best practices, including creating and managing Docker containers

Passionate advocator for implementing  automated testing using JUnit and Mockito

Experience implementing testing strategies that ensure maintainability and reliability of the codebase

Clear and concise communicator (fluent English) with the ability to collaborate across diverse teams, working with on and offshore teams to achieve team goals

Comfortable translating technical details to various stakeholders, including non-technical colleagues.

 

Additional Requirements:

Proficiency with build tools (e.g., Maven) and their optimization

Experience with coding standards and best practices to ensure a clean, maintainable codebase

Knowledge of static code analysis tools and participating in rigorous code reviews

Hands-on experience with Spring Security configurations, JWT

Ability to integrate secure coding principles and tools throughout the development lifecycle

Proven experience designing, building, and documenting RESTful APIs.

Familiarity with API design best practices, versioning strategies, and documentation

Understanding of how to streamline development and deployment via container technologies

Ability to integrate and troubleshoot with external systems and services

Strong track record in troubleshooting complex issues in large, monolithic applications

Experience in systematically breaking down and isolating root causes in tightly coupled systems.

title: Interior Designer – 2D, 3D & Rendering Specialist (Senior)
description:
We are looking for a mid-level Interior Designer with expertise in 2D drafting, 3D modelling, and high-quality rendering to support design development and documentation for residential and commercial projects. The ideal candidate can translate design concepts into accurate 2D drawings, detailed 3D models, and visually compelling renderings, delivering work independently with precision and accountability.



Key Responsibilities



2D Design Documentation:

-Develop detailed 2D drawings, including floor plans, space planning, elevations, sections, furniture layouts, and joinery details

-Produce cabinetry, interior construction, and finish details

-Ensure drawings are clear, accurate, and ready for construction

-Update and coordinate drawings throughout different design phases

-Maintain consistency and accuracy across all documentation



3D Modelling & Rendering:

-Build and maintain accurate 3D models to support design development

-Create high-quality renderings for client presentations and internal reviews

-Apply materials, textures, lighting, and camera settings effectively

-Revise models and renderings to reflect design updates and coordination changes



Design Development & Coordination:



-Collaborate with senior designers to refine design intent

-Identify and flag inconsistencies or constructability issues in drawings and models

-Ensure alignment between 2D documentation, 3D models, and rendered visuals

-Assist in preparing client presentations and submission materials



Software & Technical Skills (Mandatory)



-AutoCAD – advanced proficiency

-SketchUp – advanced proficiency

-3D rendering software (Enscape, V-Ray, Lumion, Twinmotion) – proficient

-Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, InDesign) – working knowledge



Experience & Qualifications

-Diploma or Degree in Interior Design or equivalent

-3–6 years of relevant interior design experience

-Proven track record in producing technical drawings, 3D models, and renderings

-Strong understanding of interior detailing and construction methodology

-Experience with residential and/or commercial projects



Working Style & Expectations

-Capable of working independently with minimal supervision

-Detail-oriented, organised, and deadline-driven

-Open to feedback and able to implement design revisions

-Communicates reliably and maintains responsiveness in a remote setup

-Takes accountability for accuracy, coordination, and completeness of assigned work





Portfolios without rendered visuals will not be considered. Please attached a google drive link in the cover letter

title: Medical Virtual Scribe (Remote) – Pain Management / PM&R / Ortho-Spine (eClinicalWorks Preferred)
description:
ROLE SUMMARY

Genesis Pain Clinic is a small, physician-led pain management practice. You will assist the provider by documenting patient encounters accurately and efficiently in structured templates (HPI, ROS, exam, assessment, plan). We see approximately 5–10 patients/day, and when patient volume is lower you will also support key administrative tasks (records and coordination).



PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES (Scribing)

-Document patient encounters using structured templates (HPI, ROS, PMH/PSH, meds/allergies, exam, assessment, plan)

-Capture a complete, accurate history and relevant spine/MSK details

-Document focused exam findings as directed by the provider (do not invent findings)

-Draft an organized assessment and treatment plan that reflects provider decision-making

-Ensure documentation supports medical necessity (failed conservative care, functional limitation, duration, imaging correlation, objective findings)

-Flag documentation gaps that may affect billing/medical necessity



SECONDARY RESPONSIBILITIES (Admin / Coordination)

-Request, organize, and upload medical records (imaging, PT notes, referrals)

-Assist with prior authorizations after training (not required on Day 1)



REQUIREMENTS (Must-Have)

-Excellent English (spoken + written) and professional patient communication

-Strong medical terminology (especially musculoskeletal/spine)

-Reliable high-speed internet and quiet workspace

-Willing to work live during US Central Time clinic hours

-Detail-oriented and able to follow templates consistently



PREFERRED (Big Plus)

Hands-on eClinicalWorks (eCW) experience

Pain management / PM&R / ortho-spine / neuro documentation experience

RN, PT, or other clinical background (preferred but not required)



TIME TRACKING / ACCOUNTABILITY

We use time tracking during work hours for payroll and accountability.



HOW TO APPLY (Simple)

To apply, please send:

-Your resume/CV

-Your typing speed (WPM)

-Which EHRs you’ve used (highlight if you’ve used eClinicalWorks)

-Confirm you can work Mon–Fri, 8am–5pm US Central Time (live)



Shortlisted applicants will complete a brief documentation exercise (no patient identifiers) and a short onboarding call.

title: (Internal/External) – Operations & Client Delivery Manager
description:
(Internal/External) – Operations & Client Delivery Manager

(B2B Lead Generation & Video Operations)



Company: Saleslights

Type: Full-Time

Hours: 38 hours/week

Schedule: 10:00 PM – 6:00 AM Philippines Time (US EST overlap)

Compensation: 40,000 PHP / month

Updated: Jan 30, 2026



Role Overview



Saleslights is a founder-led B2B lead generation and LinkedIn outreach company.

We help B2B companies book qualified meetings through high-touch campaigns combining targeting, content, video, and outbound execution.



We are hiring an Operations & Client Delivery Manager to own execution end-to-end — both internally (operations) and externally (client delivery).



This role replaces fragmented ownership with one accountable operator who ensures:



Internal teams execute cleanly



Client delivery runs smoothly



Nothing slips, breaks, or causes churn



Founder time stays protected



This is a hands-on execution role, not a theoretical manager position.



What This Role Owns (Clear Boundaries)



You ARE responsible for:



Internal execution and workflows



Client delivery and communication



Team coordination and follow-through



Campaign oversight and improvement



Protecting Founder time



You are NOT responsible for:



Selling or closing deals



Sales engineering



GTM strategy design



High-level business strategy



You own execution, delivery, and outcomes.



What You’ll Be Managing (Org Chart Context)



You will coordinate work across internal teams and external specialists, including:



Internal Teams



Lead Generation & Targeting Specialists



Video Editors & Motion Designers



Virtual Assistants



Internal Sales Support (SDR enablement only)



Web & SEO Team (execution routing, not strategy)



 Ads Team (delivery tracking only)



Internal recruiting coordination



External / Fractional Resources



Lead gen vendors



Video production partners



Messaging, content, and LinkedIn consultants



Pay-as-needed specialists



You do not own their strategy — you own alignment, timelines, and delivery.



Core Responsibilities

1. Client Success & Delivery Ownership



Act as the primary delivery owner for assigned clients



Run client communication via:



Video calls



Phone






Slack / Teams / Google Chat



Handle onboarding, timelines, approvals, and expectations



Proactively flag risks, gaps, or improvement opportunities



Ensure clients feel supported, informed, and confident



You are the internal advocate for the client and the external face of delivery.



2. Internal Operations & Workflow Control



Intake requirements from Saleslights (Founder, Sales, Delivery)



Translate requirements into executable tasks



Assign ownership and deadlines across teams



Track deliverables, approvals, and timelines



Act as the internal execution checkpoint



Escalate issues early — never last minute



You are the glue between teams, not the hero doing the work.



3. Campaign Oversight & Optimization



Monitor live LinkedIn outreach campaigns



Review:



Targeting quality



Messaging alignment



Reply patterns



Meeting flow



Identify improvement opportunities and coordinate fixes



Work with specialists to optimize performance



You don’t just check if things launched — you analyze, question, and improve.



4. Video & Content Delivery Management



Manage the full workflow:



Footage received ? edited ? reviewed ? approved ? delivered



Maintain:



Folder structure



Naming conventions



Version control



Ensure consistency across:



LinkedIn videos



Reels



Campaign assets



You do not edit videos.

You own the delivery process.



5. Internal Sales & Recruiting Coordination



Oversee internal SDR execution readiness



Coordinate internal performance reviews and feedback loops



Support meeting delivery and clean handoffs



Critical recruiting responsibility:

Every Saleslights client pod requires:



(1) SDR / Salesperson



(1) Operations & Client Delivery Manager (this role)



(1) Sr. Sales Engineer oversight



You help ensure staffing readiness before scaling clients.



6. Platform, GTM & Data Coordination



Act as project manager between:



GTM & Data Engineering



SaaS / Product Team



Ads and enrichment delivery



Ensure enriched data flows into product and campaigns



Coordinate timelines and dependencies



7. Founder Enablement & Protection



Convert Founder direction into clear, actionable tasks



Maintain trackers, timelines, and checklists



Own follow-through so the Founder does not have to chase



Surface real issues, not noise



Your success = Founder stays out of daily ops.



8. Product & Performance Obsession (Continuous)



Schedule regular working sessions with the Founder



Coordinate with external consultants to improve:



Messaging



Reply rates



Content strategy



LinkedIn execution and knowledge



Drive continuous improvement across campaigns and delivery



Who This Role Is For



You are someone who:



Is extremely organized and detail-oriented



Is confident communicating with clients live



Is comfortable managing creatives, VAs, and specialists



Thinks proactively, not reactively



Can analyze data and spot patterns



Is calm under pressure and persistent with follow-ups



Enjoys bringing order to chaos



You like execution.

You like clarity.

You don’t need praise — you need systems that work.



Backgrounds That Fit Well



Operations & Client Delivery Manager (Agency)



Customer Success Manager (B2B Services)



Agency Operations or Marketing Operations



Project Manager (Agency or B2B)



Senior Virtual Assistant / Team Lead with client ownership



Sales Ops or RevOps exposure is a plus



Required Skills & Experience



3+ years in operations, client delivery, customer success, or project management



Strong spoken and written English



Experience working with creative and technical specialists



Comfortable managing multiple workflows and client accounts



Strong organization, prioritization, and follow-up habits



Confidence handling client conversations independently



Tools You’ll Use



Google Workspace (Drive, Docs, Sheets)



Project management tools (ClickUp, Notion, Asana, etc.)



Slack, Zoom, Loom



LinkedIn (campaign awareness)



Basic automation tools (Zapier / Make preferred)



Important Notes



This is not a passive support role



This role owns execution control, not strategy



High accountability, low ego, high trust



Role grows with performance and ownership

title: Cold Caller / Appointment Setter (SDR) - B2B Services - Unlimited Commissions
description:
B2B Services | Warm Leads Provided | Unlimited Commissions



Type: Full-Time

Hours: 38 hours/week

Schedule: US EST business hours (PH night shift)

Compensation: 40,000 PHP/Monthly Base + Unlimited Commission

Updated: Jan 30, 2026



Role Overview



Saleslights is a founder-led B2B lead generation and outbound services company.

We help B2B companies book qualified sales meetings — and we do it at volume.



We are hiring Cold Callers / SDRs / Appointment Setters whose only job is to:



Call leads and book meetings.



That’s it.



You are NOT:



Finding leads



Researching prospects



Writing scripts from scratch



Convincing people who aren’t interested



You are GIVEN the leads.



Many of these are:



Warm leads



Inbound or hand-raised interest



Previously contacted accounts



Prospects who already want the service



This is high-energy, high-volume, high-reward calling.





How You Make Money



Unlimited commission based on meetings booked



Monthly free warm leads provided automatically



Warm leads already count toward your quota



Easy layups — many calls are simply:



“Let’s get you scheduled.”





If you like:



Talking to people



Moving fast



Booking wins daily



Earning uncapped commissions



This role is built for you.



What You’ll Be Doing

1 Outbound Calling (Warm + Cold)



Call pre-loaded leads provided by Saleslights





Focus on:



Warm leads



Known interested prospects



Accounts already in pipeline



Use proven scripts and talk tracks



Push conversations toward booked meetings



No lead hunting.

No CRM cleanup.

Just call ? book ? repeat.



2 Appointment Setting



Book meetings directly onto calendars



Confirm interest, availability, and fit



Hand off cleanly to the sales team



Hit and exceed booking quotas



This is appointment setting, not closing.





3 Energy, Pace & Consistency



High call volume



High energy



Positive attitude



Short sales cycles



This is a fun, fast-moving role for people who like 
ntum.





Who This Role Is For



You are someone who:



Loves talking on the phone



Has confidence and positive energy



Is competitive and goal-driven



Wants uncapped earnings



Enjoys easy wins and fast feedback



Can handle rejection without slowing down



You don’t overthink.

You dial.





Backgrounds That Fit Well



SDR / BDR



Cold Caller



Appointment Setter

title: Customer Success Manager (Client Delivery & Ops)
description:

Updated: Jan 30, 2026



Role Overview



Saleslights is a founder-led B2B lead generation and LinkedIn outreach company.

We help B2B companies book qualified meetings through high-touch campaigns that combine strategy, content, video, and outbound execution.



We are hiring a Customer Success Manager to own client delivery end-to-end.

Client Delivery Manager

Operations & Delivery Manager



If you enjoy owning outcomes, working directly with clients, coordinating specialists, and proactively improving campaigns, this role is for you.



This is not a passive support role.

This is a high-ownership, high-communication, high-judgment role.



What You’ll Own (Core Responsibilities)

Phone calls

2 Campaign Oversight & Optimization

Review:

Messaging alignment



Reply patterns



Meeting flow



Identify improvement opportunities and coordinate fixes

You analyze, question, and improve.



3 Team & Specialist Coordination



You will manage and coordinate:



Lead generation specialists



LinkedIn targeting experts



Video editors & motion designers



Virtual assistants



Your job is to:

Track progress



Follow up relentlessly

Ensure everything ships on time and to standard



You don’t do the work — you make the work succeed.



4 Video & Content Delivery Management

Footage received ? edited ? reviewed ? approved ? delivered



Maintain:



Clean folder structures



Version control



Naming standards

LinkedIn videos



Reels



Campaign assets



(You do not edit videos — you own the delivery process.)



5 Founder Enablement & Protection



Translate Founder direction into clear, actionable tasks



Maintain trackers, timelines, and delivery checklists



Prevent things from slipping or breaking



Reduce Founder involvement in day-to-day execution



Your success = Founder time stays protected





Who This Role Is For



You are someone who:



Has a background in sales, marketing, or B2B lead generation



Has experience in customer success or client delivery



Is confident speaking with clients live (video & phone)



Is comfortable managing multiple experts and specialties



Thinks proactively, not reactively



Can analyze data and spot patterns



Enjoys ownership, follow-through, and accountability



Is calm under pressure and persistent with follow-ups



You like bringing order to chaos — and you’re good at it.





Ideal Backgrounds

Client Delivery Manager (Marketing / Lead Gen / SaaS Services)



Marketing Operations



Project Manager (Agency or B2B)



Senior VA / Team Lead with client ownership

Strong spoken and written English



Experience working with creatives and technical specialists



Comfortable managing multiple client accounts at once

Tools You’ll Use
