title: Solar Lead-to-Quote Coordinator (AU) - With GoHigh Level expertise
description:
Job description:

We are looking for a detail-oriented Solar Lead-to-Quote Coordinator to manage the end-to-end process of converting solar bird proofing leads into accurate, professional quotes within a 24-hour turnaround. This role follows a defined SOP and requires hands-on work in Go High Level (GHL), aerial measurement tools, and document preparation to ensure every lead is quoted correctly and tracked accurately in the CRM.



Key Responsibilities / Duties

A. Lead Management & CRM Updates

-Monitor and manage new solar bird proofing leads in Go High Level (GHL)

-Review and qualify lead details and create opportunities in the CRM pipeline

-Ensure all leads are worked in the correct order, starting with the oldest

-Update CRM records, notes, job status, and pipeline stages accurately



B. Measurement & Quote Preparation

-Measure solar panel lineal metres using aerial mapping tools (Metromap)

-Capture clear screenshots showing the measured solar panel areas

-Gather all required quote information, including client details, measurements, and approved pricing

-Generate accurate, well-formatted solar bird proofing quotes using ChatGPT and the approved wording and structure



C. Quote Finalisation & Client Communication

-Transfer generated quotes into the approved Word quote template

-Insert aerial measurement screenshots and review formatting, spelling, and pricing

-Save completed quotes as PDFs using the correct file-naming convention

-Send quote PDFs to clients via Outlook within 24 hours of lead receipt



D. Coordination & Process Compliance

-Organise and schedule job dates and times with clients once quotes are approved

-Coordinate and schedule installers for confirmed jobs

-Ensure each service is clearly listed and priced as a separate line item

-Follow all SOP rules to ensure accuracy, consistency, and timely delivery



Key Software & Tools

-Go High Level (GHL) – lead management, opportunities, pipeline updates

-Metromap (or similar aerial measurement tools)

-ChatGPT (for quote generation using approved prompts)

-Microsoft Word (quote templates), Outlook 
)

-Google Drive

-Pricing rate sheets



Required Skills & Attributes

-Experience working in Go High Level (GHL) or a similar CRM environment

-Strong all-round computer literacy and confidence using multiple software platforms

-Ability to follow structured processes and SOPs with high accuracy

-Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new systems and tools

-Fluent written and spoken English

-Professional, clear communication when dealing with clients

-High attention to detail, particularly in measurements, pricing, and documentation

title: Remote Accountant
description:

Reliable internet and ability to work in a virtual team environment

title: Remote F&B Cost Controller
description:
Here's a professional job description for this position:



FOOD & BEVERAGE COST CONTROLLER

Location:  (Remote)

Reports To: Director of Finance / General Manager

Employment Type: Full-time

Industry: Hospitality / Food & Beverage



POSITION OVERVIEW

We are seeking an experienced Food & Beverage Cost Controller with a strong hospitality background to manage all aspects of F&B cost analysis, vendor sourcing, inventory control, and financial reporting. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience in food and beverage operations, preferably from a quality hotel or resort environment such as Hyatt, Raffles, or similar luxury hospitality brands.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Accounts Payable & Invoice Management



Enter and process all food and beverage invoices with accuracy and timeliness

Maintain organized records of all vendor transactions and payment schedules

Reconcile invoices against purchase orders and delivery receipts



Vendor Management & Strategic Sourcing



Research and identify competitive pricing by soliciting quotes from all approved vendors via

Source quality produce from US, Philippines, and other international markets

Negotiate pricing and terms with suppliers to optimize cost savings

Evaluate new vendor opportunities and maintain strong supplier relationships

Monitor market trends and recommend sourcing alternatives



Recipe Costing & Menu Analysis



Manage and maintain recipe costs in Accounting & Micros POS system

Update ingredient costs regularly based on current vendor pricing

Calculate and analyze menu item profitability

Provide recommendations for menu pricing adjustments based on cost analysis



Cost Analysis & Reporting



Produce monthly theoretical versus actual cost comparison reports for food and beverage

Identify and investigate variances between theoretical and actual costs

Analyze food and beverage cost percentages and prepare detailed variance reports

Generate actionable insights to reduce waste and improve profitability



Liquor Inventory & Control



Collaborate on liquor inventory management and control procedures

Analyze weekly bottle weighing data provided by local team

Prepare monthly liquor cost analysis and variance reports

Identify discrepancies and recommend corrective actions for inventory shrinkage



General



Support the finance team with ad hoc cost analysis and special projects

Ensure compliance with all accounting policies and procedures

Maintain confidentiality of all financial and proprietary information





QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIREMENTS

Required:



Education: Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Hospitality Management, or Culinary Arts

Experience: Minimum 3-5 years in food and beverage cost control, preferably in a hotel or resort setting

Industry Background: Experience with quality hospitality organizations (Hyatt, Raffles, Marriott, Four Seasons, or equivalent luxury brands strongly preferred)

Technical Skills:



Proficiency in Micros POS system (recipe costing module)

Advanced Microsoft Excel skills (pivot tables, VLOOKUP, formulas)

Strong accounting and bookkeeping knowledge

Experience with accounts payable systems







Highly Preferred:



Former chef or culinary professional with transition to cost control

Certified Public Accountant (CPA) or pursuing CPA certification

Experience in multi-unit food and beverage operations

Knowledge of international food sourcing and import/export processes



Skills & Competencies:



Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities

Excellent attention to detail and accuracy

Superior written and verbal communication skills in English

Ability to work independently with minimal supervision

Proactive mindset with ability to identify cost-saving opportunities

Strong organizational and time management skills

Proficiency in vendor negotiation and relationship management

Understanding of food and beverage operations, purchasing, and inventory management





WHAT WE OFFER



Competitive salary commensurate with experience

Remote work flexibility

Opportunity to work with an established hospitality operation

Professional growth and development opportunities

Collaborative team environment

title: Appointment Setter (Part-time)
description:
Company Overview



At LevelUp, we believe growth happens when people feel trusted, supported, and challenged. For more than seven years we’ve partnered with agencies, software vendors and website owners to provide world class outsourcing and offshore hiring services in a range of verticals, such as technical, operational, and back-office support. We hire curious problem-solvers, give them room to own outcomes, and back them with systems, support and a culture that make learning part of the job. Join us and help businesses (and your career) level up.



Position Overview



The Part-time Appointment Setter is responsible for high-volume outbound calling to identify and qualify prospects. You will act as the first point of contact, ensuring that every meeting booked is with a verified decision-maker who understands and agrees to a discovery call. This role reports directly to the Founder. The successful candidate will be a key player in expanding our clients' reach, connecting businesses with comprehensive language solutions.



Key Responsibilities



•Outbound Sourcing: Conduct a minimum of 60 dials per day to US-based businesses using provided lead lists and approved scripts.

•Lead Qualification: Speak directly with decision-makers to qualify prospects based on role and relevance before proposing a follow-up.

•Appointment Setting: Book discovery calls and send calendar invitations immediately following live conversations.

•CRM Management: Maintain 100?curate and truthful logging in HubSpot, including specific notes that allow the sales rep to lead the call confidently without guessing.

•Quality Control: Prioritize "quality over volume" by ensuring there are zero "fluff meetings" or unconfirmed bookings.



Qualifications:



•Experience: Proven track record in sales, cold calling, or appointment setting for US-based businesses

•Communication: Native or near-native English fluency with a professional communication style

•Technical Proficiency: Comfortable working with HubSpot (CRM), Quo (manual dialing), and Google Workspace

•Attributes: Detail-oriented, process-driven, and highly responsive

•Seniority: Minimum of a Junior to Mid-level professional.



More Info:



•Schedule: Part-time capacity working during US Eastern Time

•Work Arrangement: Work-from-home / Remote.

•Equipment: BYOD (Bring Your Own Device); candidates must provide their own reliable equipment.

•Tools Provided: The company provides access to the CRM (HubSpot), Leads, and Phone system (Quo).

•Compensation: Monthly basic salary ranging from 13,000 PHP to 20,000 PHP for part-time, plus uncapped commission.

•Target Start Date: End of February.

title: Speed-to-Lead Virtual Assistant / Appointment Setter (Inbound Buyer Leads)
description:
Speed-to-Lead Virtual Assistant / Appointment Setter (Inbound Buyer Leads)



Job Description



We are hiring a performance-driven Speed-to-Lead Virtual Assistant to handle inbound buyer leads and support a mortgage-first qualification pipeline.



This role is built around speed, execution, and immediate follow-through.

This is NOT a generic VA role.



This is NOT cold calling.

This is NOT a sales role.

This is NOT a consulting role.



Your value in this role is how fast you react when real buyer intent appears.



Role Type / Keywords

Speed-to-Lead VA, Appointment Setter, Mortgage Lead Follow-Up, Loan Officer Assistant, Inside Sales Agent (ISA), Buyer Leads VA, Real Estate VA, CRM Dialer, Local Presence Calling.



Lead Type

You will work with inbound buyer leads registering to view homes (MLS access, buyer inquiry forms).



All leads include:

- Name

- Phone number

-



Primary market: Washington State — King County (City of Kent)



These are real buyers actively looking at homes, not cold lists.



Core Responsibility

You must immediately contact new buyer leads and convert them into one of the following outcomes:



- Completed mortgage application

- Showed-up scheduled call with the Loan Officer

- Confirmed cash buyer (live call completed)



You do NOT:

- Quote rates

- Discuss loan terms

- Analyze income or credit

- Provide financial advice



Speed-to-Lead Requirement (CRITICAL)



Every new lead must be contacted within 1–3 minutes of arrival.



- 1–2 minutes = target

- 3 minutes = already late

- Delays = lost opportunity = failed performance



If you cannot consistently react within 1–3 minutes, do not apply.



Speed-to-lead is the #1 KPI in this role.



How Contact Happens (Important – Read Carefully)



- When a new lead arrives, you receive an
 notification

- You must immediately open the CRM

- You must manually initiate the call inside the CRM

- The CRM does NOT auto-dial

- All calls are initiated by you

- Calls must be started within 1–3 minutes of lead arrival



Mandatory Qualification Question

Every lead must be asked:



“Will you be financing the purchase, or paying cash?”



Workflow — Financing Buyers



- Clearly explain the mortgage-first process

- Send the official Apply Now link

- Follow up until the application is fully completed (started applications do NOT count)

- Schedule a call with the Loan Officer

- Ensure the borrower shows up to the scheduled call



Only completed applications qualify for bonuses.



Workflow — Cash Buyers



- Tag the lead as CASH BUYER

- Escalate immediately

- Schedule and confirm a completed live call

- No mortgage application required



Activity-Based Follow-Up (CRITICAL)



You must actively monitor lead activity inside the CRM, including:

-
 opens

- Link clicks

- Replies or engagement



Any detected activity creates another 1–3 minute response window.



When activity is detected, you must:

- React immediately

- Initiate contact within 1–3 minutes

- Attempt to secure the next required step (call or application)



Missed activity windows are treated the same as missed leads.



CRM Requirement



Experience with BoldTrail (KV Core) is strongly preferred.



If you do not have prior BoldTrail experience, you must confirm that you can:

- Learn and operate it independently within 24 hours

- Still meet 1–3 minute response requirements



You must be comfortable:

- Initiating calls from the CRM

- Updating lead statuses

- Logging notes

- Reacting immediately to new lead activity



US Phone Number Requirement (NON-NEGOTIABLE)



- You must have access to a US-based phone number

- International numbers are NOT acceptable

- The Loan Officer must be able to call you directly from the US without international charges



Applications without US phone confirmation will not be considered.



Availability & Time Zone (IMPORTANT)



Inbound buyer leads typically arrive between:



7:00 AM – 9:00 PM Pacific Time (Seattle time)



For reference:

- Pacific Time (Seattle): 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM

- Philippines Time (PHT): approximately 11:00 PM – 1:00 PM (next day)



This means:

- Most lead activity occurs during nighttime and early daytime hours in the Philippines

- You must be comfortable being alert and responsive during these hours



If you are not comfortable covering Pacific Time windows, do not apply.



Coverage is required 7 days per week.



This is an on-call responsiveness role, not hourly time tracking.

CRM and
 notifications must remain ON during coverage windows.



Compensation



Base Pay

$300 per month, paid monthly



- Base pay is for availability and immediate responsiveness

- Base pay is NOT tied to hours worked



Performance Bonuses (Primary Earnings)



- $15 per completed mortgage application

- $15 per showed-up scheduled call

- $25 per confirmed cash buyer (live call completed)



Important:

A single lead can generate multiple bonuses.



Example:

Completed application + showed-up call = $30 from one lead



Bonuses are where strong performers earn the majority of their income.



Performance & Trial Period



This role is strictly KPI-driven.



Performance is reviewed daily during the first week.



Continued engagement depends on:

- Consistent 1–3 minute response time

- Execution quality

- Follow-through



Failure to meet standards may result in immediate replacement.



How to Apply



Submit your application through this platform and include clear answers to all questions below:



1. Do you have access to a US-based phone number?

2. Describe your speed-to-lead or appointment-setting experience.

3. Confirm that you understand this is a performance-based role (not hourly).



Generic or copy-paste applications will be ignored.

Applications without US phone confirmation will not be considered.

This role blends legal research, document preparation, file management, and client communication, requiring strong organisation, attention to detail, and a proactive mindset.



To apply for this job:

2. Submit a video talking about what similar experience you have working in law.





Responsibilities



- Draft and prepare legal documents, including affidavits, court forms, briefs, and correspondence.

- Conduct legal research and summarise findings for supervising solicitors.

- Manage case files, maintain accurate records, and ensure compliance with court deadlines.

- Liaise with clients, courts, counsel, and external stakeholders in a professional manner.

- Assist with discovery, evidence collation, and preparation of briefs to counsel.

- Coordinate appointments, mediations, and court dates.

- Support lawyers during hearings, mediations, and client meetings.

- Perform general administrative duties to support smooth office operations.



Skills required

- Strong written and verbal communication.

- High attention to detail and accuracy.

- Ability to manage competing deadlines and prioritise effectively.

- Sound understanding of legal terminology and court processes.

- Proficiency with legal practice management software (e.g., LEAP, Smokeball, Actionstep).

- Professionalism, discretion, and commitment to confidentiality.

- Problem?solving mindset and willingness to take initiative.

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
Astra Health is a fast-growing Australian HealthTech startup building an AI-powered clinical documentation platform that reduces administrative and cognitive burden for healthcare professionals so they can focus on patient care.

We serve clinicians working in diverse communities, many of whom consult in languages other than English. Astra Health enables them to speak naturally with patients and receive accurate medical documentation in English.



We’re building the future of clinical documentation and we’re moving fast.



The Role:



We’re looking for a Digital Marketing Specialist who can own and execute Astra Health’s digital presence end-to-end.



You will be responsible for planning, creating, publishing, and optimising content and campaigns that build brand awareness, generate leads, and convert clinicians into users.



You’ll work directly with the CEO and founding team, remotely, with occasional virtual collaboration with our Sydney-based team.



This is a hands-on execution role. You won’t just “post content”, you will drive our growth.



What You’ll Do:

Strategy & Execution



-Develop and execute a digital marketing strategy aligned to company growth goals

-Translate business objectives into practical marketing campaigns



Social Media Marketing



-Own Astra Health’s presence across LinkedIn, Meta 
/Instagram), and emerging channels

-Build and manage content calendars

-Publish, schedule, and optimise posts

-Actively engage with clinicians and followers



Content Creation



-Create short-form videos, static posts, carousels, and graphics

-Write compelling captions, blogs, and
 content tailored to clinicians

-Maintain consistent brand voice and visual identity



 Marketing & Automation



-Design, build, and optimise automated
 flows using Zoho Campaigns / Marketing Automation

-Create newsletters, onboarding sequences, and nurture campaigns



Paid Advertising (Meta)



-Plan, launch, and optimise Meta ad campaigns

-Test creatives, audiences, and messaging

-Track conversions and improve ROI



Analytics & Optimisation



-Monitor performance across channels

-Report on key metrics (CTR, CPC, leads, conversions, engagement)

-Continuously iterate based on results



Community & Partnerships



-Foster an engaged clinician community

-Support influencer and partner collaborations



What We’re Looking For:



Must-Have



-2+ years experience in digital marketing or social media marketing

-Strong copywriting and content creation skills

-Experience running Meta 
/Instagram) paid ads

-Familiarity with Zoho Campaigns or similar
 automation tools

-Comfortable with video editing, basic graphic design, and photo editing

-Excellent written and verbal English



Nice-to-Have



-Experience in B2B SaaS or Healthcare marketing

-Understanding of social media algorithms and growth tactics

-Experience building personal or brand pages from early stage



What You’ll Get:



-Remote role working with an Australian startup

-Direct access to founders and decision-makers

-High ownership and autonomy

-Opportunity to shape the brand from early stage





Send:



-Your CV

-Portfolio or examples of social media accounts, campaigns, or ads you’ve worked on

-A short note on why this role interests you



Only candidates with examples of real work will be considered.

title: Executive Assistant to the CEO (Long?Term, Full?Time)
description:
We are looking for a highly proactive, trustworthy, and service?minded Executive Assistant to support our CEO and help run both business and life with excellence.

This is not a typical assistant role. We are searching for someone who thinks ahead, protects time, handles details without reminders, and genuinely cares about doing things well. If you take pride in being dependable, organized, positive, and proactive — this role may be for you.



About the Role

As Executive Assistant to the CEO, you will act as a buffer, organizer, and strategic support partner. Your mission is to make sure nothing falls through the cracks and that the CEO’s time, energy, and focus are protected.

You should be someone who:

• Anticipates needs before being asked

• Handles tasks completely and independently

• Communicates clearly and attentively

• Takes ownership and follows through

• Brings a calm, positive, and service?oriented attitude



You should be so organized that reminders are rarely needed.

Responsibilities

• Executive calendar,
, and task management

• Acting as a buffer and gatekeeper for the CEO

• Tracking tasks, deadlines, and follow?ups without reminders

• Organizing documents, systems, and workflows

• Handling personal and business?related tasks with discretion

• Helping build and manage the CEO’s personal brand on social media

• Assisting with content coordination, scheduling, and posting

• Supporting automation workflows (Zapier or similar tools)

• Communicating with internal and external stakeholders professionally

• Identifying opportunities to improve efficiency and systems



 Required Qualifications

• Proven experience working directly for a CEO or senior executive

• Extremely organized and detail?oriented

• Proactive — you see what needs to be done and do it

• High level of integrity, trustworthiness, and confidentiality

• Strong written and verbal English communication skills

• Tech?savvy and comfortable learning new tools

• Experience with Zapier or other automations (or strong willingness to learn)

• Familiarity with social media platforms (especially for personal and business branding)



Our Values

We are deeply committed to:

• Positivity

• Initiative

• Dependability

• Attentive communication

• Service?mindedness



We are looking for someone who aligns with these values and wants to grow long?term with us.



Benefits

• Salary: USD $1,000 – $1,250 per month (based on experience)

• After 90 days, you become eligible for:

    • Paid HMO

    • 15 days Paid Time Off (PTO)

    • Paid U.S. holidays

    • Monthly rice subsidy



How to Apply

Please provide::

1. A resume 

2. A video recording describing your experience supporting a CEO or executive and examples of systems, automation, or organization improvements you’ve handled

title: Experienced Website Designer / Developer (Remote – Long-Term)
description:
About the role



We are an established Australian digital marketing agency looking for an experienced Website Designer / Developer to join our remote team on a long-term basis.



We are seeking someone who is committed to being part of the team in the long term. 



This is a hands-on role. You will be responsible for designing and building conversion-focused websites for real businesses across lead generation.



We are not looking for beginners or students.

We are looking for someone who has already built professional websites for clients and can show real work.



Core skills required (non-negotiable)



You must have strong experience in:



Figma – website design, wireframes, UI layouts



WordPress – custom themes, page builders, performance optimisation



HubSpot CMS – templates, landing pages, modules. Someone who can demonstrate HubSpot ability. 



Webflow – responsive builds and CMS usage



You must provide an up-to-date portfolio showing real websites you have designed and/or built using the tools above.



Applications without a portfolio will not be considered.



What you’ll be doing



Designing websites and layouts in Figma



Building websites in WordPress, HubSpot CMS, and Webflow



Converting designs into clean, responsive, production-ready websites



Collaborating with our project managers and marketers



Implementing SEO-friendly structure and performance best practices



Testing across devices and browsers



Making updates, improvements, and refinements post-launch



Communicating progress clearly and reliably



Experience we’re looking for



3–5+ years professional website design/development experience



Strong understanding of:



HTML, CSS, basic JavaScript



Responsive design and cross-browser compatibility



Experience working with:



CMS platforms (WordPress, HubSpot, Webflow)



Git or version control (preferred, not mandatory)



Ability to follow briefs, but also think independently



Strong attention to detail and pride in quality work



Bonus (not required, but valued):



Experience with APIs (HubSpot a plus)



Familiarity with page speed optimisation



Basic understanding of conversion-focused design



Working style & expectations



Remote role (Philippines-based candidates welcome)



Reliable internet connection



Strong written English communication



Ability to meet deadlines and provide updates



Comfortable working within systems like ClickUp / Slack



Looking for long-term work, not short freelance gig



What’s in it for you



Stable, ongoing work with an established agency



Competitive pay based on experience and skill



Exposure to a wide range of real client projects



Clear briefs, structured processes, and support



Opportunity to grow with the business



How to apply (important)



To apply, please include ALL of the following:



A short introduction about your experience



A link to your portfolio (live websites preferred)



A brief explanation of your experience with:



Figma



WordPress



HubSpot



Webflow



Your expected hourly or monthly rate



Applications without a portfolio link will not be reviewed.



If you are an experienced designer/developer who enjoys building quality websites and wants long-term, stable remote work we’d love to hear from you.

title: SHORT FORM VIDEO EDITOR | Day Shift
description:
We’re hiring someone who knows how to turn long-form content into sharp, high-retention short videos for platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



This role is for someone who understands pacing, hooks, and visual rhythm in short-form content, and knows how to edit with intention rather than just cutting clips.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just cutting together videos for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you have strong creative instincts and know how to spot 
nts that make people stop scrolling? Are you proactive, adaptable, and detail-oriented? Do you have a sharp sense of pacing, an instinct for hooks, and a clear understanding of how short-form videos need to flow to hold attention? Do you take pride in clean edits and delivering videos that feel intentional and finished? Do our core values sound like a fit for who you are?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Short-Form Editing & Story Selection

- Review long-form videos, transcripts, or raw footage to identify short-form clip opportunities

- Select 
nts that are clear, engaging, and platform-appropriate

- Edit vertical videos optimized for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts

- Create strong hooks, clean cuts, and natural pacing

- Deliver publish-ready videos that meet brand and platform standards



Captions, Visuals & Formatting

- Add on-screen captions (burned-in or SRT as required) with proper timing and readability

- Apply basic motion, zooms, punch-ins, and visual emphasis where appropriate

- Follow platform-specific formatting (aspect ratio, duration, safe margins)



Iteration & Workflow

- Implement feedback efficiently and meet agreed turnaround times

- Maintain clear file naming and folder organization

- Track edits, revisions, and delivery status as required



Requirements:

- A STABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET CONNECTION, REQUIRED (at least 150mbps)

- Experience with Final Cut Pro X (or other editing software, such as Adobe After Effects and Premiere Pro) is required

- Strong preference for MacOS users

- Experience editing short-form vertical content for social platforms, required

- Strong understanding of short-form pacing, hooks, and retention

- Experience working from transcripts or long-form content, required

- Clean file organization and understanding of post-production workflo

- Portfolio of completed short-form video projects, required

- General understanding of brand, content marketing, YouTube, etc, required

- GREAT interpersonal and communication skills, required

- Ability to self-start, work on a tight schedule, and manage multiple project deadlines, required

- Ability to follow directions and a LOVE of completing lots of projects according to consistent specifications, required

- Growth mindset, required



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.


 



STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to participate in two PAID test projects, $10-20 USD for each test project estimated to be 2-3hrs of work for each (a total of $20-40 USD!).



STEP 3:

Candidates who advance through the test project rounds will be invited to an interview.



STEP 4:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 5:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Short Form Video Editor with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your video editing expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

title: Operations Manager for Neurodivergence Coach (ADHD + autism + Mental Health)
description:
>> I'm wanting to work with women only (I want to support women!) 



I'm a neurodivergence coach originally from Korea, now living in LA. I work with creative, multi-passionate adults who want to build fulfilling lives by working with their nervous system.



My business and life are growing very quickly, and I need an exceptional operations manager / executive assistant—someone in the top 5–10%—to help me take things to the next level.



You'll be my operational partner, making decisions on my behalf and keeping both my business and personal life running smoothly.



I'd love for us to become friends, not just employer-employee. I've experienced this with my previous assistants and it's been really fulfilling.



ABOUT THE ROLE



You'll be acting on my behalf—calling banks, vendors, and service providers, making real-time decisions, and managing personal and business logistics independently.



This is a dynamic, fast-paced and constantly evolving role. Things move quickly without step-by-step instructions, and you'll need exceptional judgment and discretion.



If you love taking initiative, solving problems creatively, and owning projects end-to-end, this could be the perfect role for you.





WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING 



- Keep in communication with vendors, service providers—handle situations independently

- Keep track of different dates & deadlines and follow through until completion

- Managing and maintaining multiple projects, tasks and systems 

- Conduct in-depth research and troubleshoot issues 

- Manage bookkeeping for business and personal finances





WHO WILL THRIVE IN THIS ROLE 



- Highly independent and proactive, able to act and d
 on my behalf across personal and business matters

- Exceptional decision-making and sound judgment in a variety of contexts and situations

- Clear, concise, and direct communicator – able to give clear feedback on what is working, what is not, suggestions & improvements

- Adaptable and resourceful, able to navigate new tools, platforms, and situations quickly

- Exceptionally organized and able to prioritize very effectively when many things feel time-sensitive 

- Able to own and execute projects from beginning to end 

- Comfortable managing complex and multiple priorities without dropping anything (daily tasks PLUS multiple side projects—all at once)





HOURS 



- 40 hours/week, Monday–Friday PST (Tuesday–Saturday PH time preferred but weekend time can be adjusted)

- Will meet, do work together, and do dody-doubling (co-working) at 4PM to 9 PM PST (7 or 8 am - 12nn or 1 am)





PAY & BENEFITS



- $1,400–$1,700/month, pay increases as you grow

- Severance pay 

- 30 days off per year (flexible)  





MY COMMITMENT TO YOU

I treat my teammates with respect and love. We're constantly learning and evolving together. I'm interested in you as a human being, beyond just our work—and I'll compensate you fairly and generously for outstanding work. 





DON'T APPLY IF: 



- You're early in your career without proven project / operations managing experience

- You struggle with independent decision-making or need guidance on execution

- You feel overwhelmed in high-responsibility, high-autonomy environments

- You're looking for a short-term role or stepping stone

- You feel uncertain or hesitant about this role

title: Hospitality Procurement Specialist
description:
Hospitality Procurement Specialist



Location: Remote 

Type: Full-Time

Salary: Competitive — Based on Experience



About Hospitality Finishes



Hospitality Finishes is a U.S.-based FF&E and millwork supplier serving major hotel brands nationwide. We partner with hotel owners, developers, designers, and contractors to deliver brand-approved furniture packages for leading flags including Marriott, Hilton, IHG, Hyatt, Choice, and Wyndham.



We are seeking a Hospitality Procurement Specialist with direct U.S. hotel experience. This is not an entry-level role. The ideal candidate understands the full procurement lifecycle within hotel furniture supply, brand compliance processes, documentation standards, and the operational realities of hospitality renovation projects.



This role bridges hotel procurement, brand compliance, interior design specifications, and cross-department coordination — ensuring FF&E, GC, and millwork packages are accurately documented and professionally executed.



Key Responsibilities



Manage FF&E procurement for hotel renovation projects.



Review shop drawings and specifications for: Casegoods, Seating, Millwork, Lighting, Shower doors, Shower surrounds and tubs



Participate in the preparation and submission of documentation for brand approval.



Organize and manage finish and material samples for client and brand review.



Ensure strict compliance with brand standards (Marriott, Hilton, IHG, Hyatt, Choice, Wyndham).



Coordinate with contractors, designers, hotel owners, factories, procurement teams, accounting department, and executive leadership.



Support project schedules and milestone tracking.



Manage budgeting, bidding processes, and client negotiations.



Professionally issue and manage Purchase Orders (POs) and invoices.



Work within QuickBooks for procurement tracking and financial documentation.



Read and interpret blueprints and shop drawings.



Work professionally in Excel for tracking, reporting, and budgeting.



Proactively resolve procurement and production issues.



Required Qualifications



4–8 years of experience in hospitality FF&E procurement, including millwork, shower doors, surrounds, and tubs.



Strong experience in contract negotiations within the hospitality industry.



Strong proficiency in QuickBooks, PO management, and Excel.



Solid understanding of hotel brand compliance and approval processes.



Experience coordinating with domestic and international factories.



Excellent organizational, documentation, and communication skills.



Ability to manage multiple renovation projects in a fast-paced environment.



Exceptional attention to detail and professional PO management experience.



Preferred Qualifications



Experience working directly with major hotel chains.



Background in renovation-heavy hospitality environments focused on furniture packages.



What We Offer



Competitive compensation based on experience.



Exposure to nationwide, brand-level hospitality projects.



Growth opportunities within a scaling hospitality company.



Collaborative, performance-driven culture.



How to Apply



Please submit your resume and portfolio (if applicable) to:

title: Virtual Assistant Recruitment & Client Success Manager
description:
About Us



We are a U.S.-based company that provides long-term Virtual Assistant services to business owners across multiple industries. We handle the full lifecycle of VA support — recruiting, hiring, onboarding, placement, and ongoing management — so our clients can focus on growing their businesses.



We have been employing Virtual Assistants in the Philippines for several years and are committed to stable, long-term working relationships built on clear expectations, strong communication, and structured systems.



Role Overview



We are seeking a highly organized, people-focused Virtual Assistant Recruitment & Client Success Manager to oversee both talent acquisition and client success.



This role is responsible for recruiting and hiring Virtual Assistants, managing their performance, and acting as the primary liaison between business owner clients and their assigned VAs. You will ensure that each client receives consistent, high-quality support and that Virtual Assistants are set up for success with clear expectations and accountability.



A neutral American accent is required, as this role involves regular communication with U.S.-based business owners.



Core Responsibilities



???? Virtual Assistant Recruitment & Hiring



• Source, recruit, and attract qualified Virtual Assistants for a variety of roles

• Review applications and resumes

• Conduct initial and follow-up interviews

• Evaluate communication skills, comprehension, professionalism, and role fit

• Make hiring decisions and oversee onboarding of new VAs

• Maintain hiring standards, documentation, and candidate records



???? VA Management & Performance Oversight



• Serve as the direct manager for assigned Virtual Assistants

• Ensure VAs clearly understand role expectations, systems, and client requirements

• Monitor performance, productivity, attendance, and communication

• Provide ongoing feedback, coaching, and corrective guidance as needed

• Collect and review client feedback regularly

• Proactively assess VA–client fit and performance, and recommend or implement VA reassignments or replacements when service expectations are not being met, ensuring minimal disruption and continued client satisfaction



???? Client Liaison & Account Management



• Act as the primary point of contact for business owner clients

• Translate client goals and requests into clear, actionable instructions for VAs

• Set and manage expectations regarding scope of work, timelines, and capabilities

• Address concerns professionally and resolve issues efficiently

• Maintain strong, long-term client relationships



???? Systems & Process Management



• Help implement and enforce internal systems, SOPs, and workflows

• Ensure documentation, checklists, and processes are consistently followed

• Track staffing needs and anticipate future hiring requirements

• Maintain accurate records in internal systems and CRM tools



Required Skills & Qualifications



• Neutral American accent (required – calls will be evaluated)

• Proven experience in recruiting, hiring, or managing Virtual Assistants or remote staff

• Experience in client-facing roles such as account management, customer success, or operations

• Excellent English comprehension and communication skills

• Strong organizational skills and attention to detail

• Ability to manage multiple clients and tea
mbers simultaneously

• Confident, professional approach to performance management and problem-solving

• Comfortable working Monday–Friday, U.S. business hours

• Reliable internet, headset, and a quiet work environment



Preferred (Nice to Have)



• Background in staffing, BPO, or outsourcing companies

• Experience managing remote or distributed teams

• Familiarity with SOPs, KPIs, and performance tracking

• CRM or project management software experience



Position Details



• Full-time, long-term position

• Monday–Friday, U.S. business hours

• Leadership role with room for growth

• High-impact position directly influencing client retention and service quality

?

???? Virtual Assistant Benefits Package



???? Health Insurance – Medical Stipend Program



Our company provides a Medical Stipend Program to help Virtual Assistants enroll in the health insurance plan of their choice.

• Up to 100,000 PHP per year toward a health insurance policy

• Eligible after 90 days of employment

• Annual premium divided into weekly payments and added to payroll

• Option to include beneficiaries (spouse or children)

• Any amount exceeding the allowance is paid by the employee



????? Internet Allowance

• 1,500 PHP per month



???? Rice Allowance

• 1,000 PHP per month



???? 13th Month Pay

• Equivalent to one month’s base pay

• Paid annually on your work anniversary



???? Paid Time Off (PTO)

• 1 week paid vacation leave

• 1 week paid family/sick leave

• Use-it-or-lose-it policy



???? Tuition Reimbursement

• Up to 50,000 PHP per year for educational expenses for you or your family

title: Sr. Email & Launch Copywriting Specialist
description:
About Us

We’re a fast-growing education company serving experienced software engineers who want real-world Rust skills and real career outcomes. Our flagship offers are mentor-led, cohort-based programs focused on shipping production-grade projects and landing Rust-heavy roles.



 is one of our main revenue channels. We use it to fill cohorts, book sales calls, and reactivate our warm audience. We’re hiring someone to own this function end-to-end.



Role Overview

You will own the strategy, copy, and execution of
 campaigns that drive launches, bookings, reactivations, and long-term revenue from our list. This is a senior, full-time role for someone who wants clear ownership, measurable impact, and a long-term seat on the team.



You are not “writing some
s.” You are building a repeatable
 machine that keeps our calendar full and our cohorts sold out.



What You’ll Own

1. Launch Campaigns (Cohorts & Fast-Cash Promos)

Plan and write complete launch sequences for our cohorts and promo offers (pre-launch, open cart, objections, FAQ, deadline, last call, sold-out, etc.).

Standardize, document, and templatize launches so they’re easy to clone and improve.



2. Evergreen Nurture & Segmentation

Build and maintain evergreen sequences that warm new subscribers and move them toward a call or application.

Segment based on behavior and stage (new leads, engaged, inactive, past applicants, buyers) so people get the right messages at the right time.



3. Show-Up & No-Show Sequences

Write and optimize sequences that increase show-up rates for booked calls.

Create follow-up for no-shows and no-buys to recover missed revenue and keep good leads in motion.



4. Reactivation Campaigns

Run quarterly reactivation campaigns for cold or inactive subscribers to generate “found” revenue from the list.



What Success Looks Like in the First 90 Days

- 3 complete launch sequences live, documented, and reusable.

- 1 evergreen nurture sequence live, for new leads.

- Show-up rate on
-sourced calls improved vs. baseline.

- At least 1 reactivation campaign shipped with clear revenue attribution.

- Clear
 playbook (templates, frameworks, naming) the team can understand and reuse.



Requirements

- 3+ years professional B2C
 copy experience.

- Proven track record owning full launch/email sequences (not just individual
s).

- Strong understanding of offer positioning, sequencing, and deadlines for high-ticket educational or coaching products.

- Ability to write in a clear, human voice that resonates with senior, technical audiences.

- Comfortable with at least 3-hour overlap with US pacific time zone, async with a distributed team, and being accountable to numbers (revenue, bookings, show rates).



Bonus

- Experience with technical or software developer audiences.

- Familiarity with platforms like Kartra, ActiveCampaign, or similar.

- Comfortable pulling basic numbers from dashboards/CRMs to see what’s working.



How to Apply

In your application, include:

- A brief personal intro (2–5 short sentences) in your own words.

- 1–2 examples of launch or promo sequences you’ve written (cohort, course, or high-ticket offers).

- A short note explaining how you approach writing launch
s for a high-ticket cohort program.

- Your monthly salary expectation in USD (full-time) and your official
 address.



Application Question (Required):

1. Which part of the
 lifecycle do you enjoy owning most? (launches, nurture, reactivation, post-purchase, etc.) What
 platforms have you worked in?

2. Briefly describe one launch
 sequence you’ve owned end-to-end.

3. In 5–7 bullet points, outline:

- the audience

- the goal of the sequence

- how you structured the sequence (early ? middle ? final
s)

- one decision you made to avoid audience fatigue



Applications that skip any of the above will not be considered.

title: Cost & Manufacturing Accounting Manager
description:
1. Department / Reporting Line



- Department: Finance Division

- Reports to: VP of Finance



2. Job Summary



The Cost & Manufacturing Accounting Manager is the primary owner of all cost accounting and manufacturing accounting functions across the organization. This role is responsible for establishing accurate standard costs, monitoring production-related variances, analyzing profitability, and maintaining reliable inventory valuation.

The position requires deep technical expertise in cost accounting and manufacturing processes, along with the ability to transform raw operational data into clear insights for upper management. CPA & CMA are strongly recommended.



3. Key Responsibilities



A. Cost Accounting (MAIN AREA #1)

- Build and maintain standard cost structures for materials, labor, and manufacturing overhead.

- Perform actual vs. standard cost variance analysis and present findings to senior leadership.

- Lead annual standard cost review, cost roll-up, and periodic updates.

- Conduct product-level and customer-level profitability analysis.

- Support new product costing and pricing decisions with precise cost models.

- Ensure cost accounting accuracy and compliance across all production-related activities.



B. Manufacturing Accounting (MAIN AREA #2)

- Oversee full manufacturing accounting cycle, including WIP, finished goods, and cost flows.

- Manage production order settlement, overhead allocation logic, and cost absorption.

- Review and analyze production KPIs: efficiency, scrap, rework, yield, downtime, variance root cause.

- Own inventory accounting processes, including cycle counts, physical inventory, and reconciliation.

- Partner closely with production, supply chain, and engineering to improve cost visibility.



C. Supporting Responsibilities (Secondary Focus)

-Systems, Processes & ERP Optimization

 --Enhance and streamline cost & manufacturing accounting processes within SAP (FI/CO preferred).

 --Introduce automation to reduce errors and improve reporting speed.

 --Ensure consistent data flow between production systems and financial systems.

-Leadership & Collaboration

 --Lead and develop the cost accounting and manufacturing accounting team.

 --Provide clear reports, dashboards, and insights for upper management.

 --Work cross-functionally with production, supply chain, and operational teams.



4. Qualifications

- Minimum 7 years of experience specifically in cost accounting and manufacturing accounting.

- Deep expertise in:

  --standard costing

  --BOM/Routing cost structure

  --manufacturing variances

  --inventory valuation

  --cost modeling

-Strong SAP ERP experience (FI/CO modules highly preferred).

- CPA & CMA strongly recommended.

- Excellent analytical and presentation skills for executive audiences.

- Fluent in English for cross-functional and global communication.



5. Preferred Qualifications

- Experience in manufacturing-intensive industries (electronics, pharmaceuticals, food, industrial, etc.).

- Background in multinational corporations or external audit environments.

- Experience in ERP projects, system enhancements, or automation initiatives.



6. Ideal Candidate Profile

- Extremely detail-oriented with strong accuracy and data validation discipline.

- Owns the numbers end-to-end and delivers without excuses.

- Logical, analytical thinker who simplifies complexity into executive-friendly insights.

- Comfortable presenting to upper management with confidence.

- Highly collaborative with operations, engineers, and supply chain personnel.



7. Notes (Interview & Evaluation Guidelines)

- Candidates will complete a Case Study Presentation during the interview process.

- Case study must be prepared as if presenting to upper management, demonstrating:

  --structured cost analysis

  --variance interpretation

  --manufacturing insights

  --clear executive storytelling

-Zero tolerance for exaggeration or misrepresentation.

-If post-hire performance does not match interview claims, contract will be terminated immediately.

-Candidates with poor reporting discipline or excuse-driven behavior will not proceed.

description:

We help independent pharmacies optimize operations, reduce medication waste, and unlock value in surplus inventory through solutions for DSCSA compliance, data analytics, inventory management, and secure trading—all at zero upfront cost.

We are seeking a detail-oriented, highly organized Marketing Coordinator to support the execution and coordination of marketing initiatives across digital channels. This role requires someone who can work independently, manage multiple priorities, and collaborate effectively with a remote team, while maintaining a high level of accuracy and follow-through. 



The ideal candidate has strong marketing fundamentals and excellent written and verbal English communication skills, and is comfortable balancing marketing execution with administrative and project coordination responsibilities. 



Key Responsibilities 

Coordinate and support digital marketing campaigns across multiple platforms 

Assist with social media and digital advertising (Meta, Google, LinkedIn, etc.) 

Help create, schedule, and track marketing content and
 campaigns 

Monitor campaign performance and assist with reporting 

Ensure brand consistency across all marketing materials 

Manage tasks, timelines, and workflows using Asana 

Maintain marketing calendars, documentation, and campaign assets 

Assist with CRM updates, data entry, and general marketing administration 

Work independently while collaborating closely with internal tea
mbers 



Required Qualifications 

Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field 

Excellent written and verbal English communication skills (fluency required) 

Strong attention to detail and organizational skills 

Solid understanding of marketing concepts and terminology 

Experience with digital marketing tools and social advertising platforms 

Experience using Asana or similar project management tools 

Ability to work independently and as part of a remote team 



Preferred Qualifications 

Experience with marketing automation tools (HubSpot, Mailchimp, Klaviyo) 

Basic copywriting or content creation experience 

Experience with analytics tools (Google Analytics, Meta Ads Manager) 

Prior experience supporting U.S.-based companies 



Work Details 

Location: Philippines (Remote) 

Hours: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM Central Time (U.S.) 

Schedule: Full-time 



Application Requirement – Communication Assessment 



As part of the application process, candidates must submit an audio or video recording reading the script below. This assessment helps us evaluate verbal communication skills, clarity, confidence, and attention to detail. 



Sample Script – Pharmacy Association Outreach 



Introduction 

“Hello, this is [Your Name] calling from InStockRx. I hope you’re having a great day.” 



Purpose of the Call 

“I’m reaching out because we work closely with independent pharmacies across the United States, and we’re interested in exploring how InStockRx may be a helpful resource for your member pharmacies.” 



Who We Are 

“InStockRx is a no-cost, no-risk pharmacy-to-pharmacy marketplace designed specifically for independent pharmacies. Our platform allows pharmacies to safely and compliantly trade surplus, non-returnable medications with other licensed pharmacies through a private marketplace.” 



What We Do 

“In addition to facilitating pharmacy-to-pharmacy inventory transfers, InStockRx also provides tools for DSCSA compliance, inventory visibility, and data analytics. Importantly, there are no upfront costs, no subscription fees, and no obligation to transact.” 



Clarity Statement 

“To be clear, InStockRx does not purchase medications directly, does not act as a wholesaler, and does not require pharmacies to change their existing vendors or workflows.” 



Call to Action 

“We’d love the opportunity to briefly introduce InStockRx to your team and discuss whether this could be a valuable, no-cost benefit for your member pharmacies.” 



Closing 

“Thank you for your time. If there’s a better person or department to speak with, I’d appreciate your guidance. I look forward to connecting.” 



How to Apply - Please submit the following: 



Resume 



Audio or video recording of yourself reading the script above using Loom (
), Vocaroo (
), or a similar platform. 

 all materials to 
 the subject line: “At InStockRx We Rock” 



Incomplete applications will not be considered.

title: Pixel Artist (Game Assets, Mobile)
description:
We are looking for a Pixel Artist / Game Artist to create artwork for a mobile browser game. This role is focused on pixel art asset creation only. No coding required.



The style is very specific: gritty, cinematic pixel art with a retro arcade feel and modern polish. You will create low-resolution pixel art for characters, enemies, items, and gameplay elements, as well as higher-detail pixel art for loading screens, splash screens, and promotional images. Matching the visual style shown in our reference assets is extremely important. Here's a folder with example artwork that represents the exact look and quality we are aiming for: 



You must understand how pixel art is used in games. This includes creating characters with multiple frames, sprite sheets, reusable environment pieces, UI elements, icons, and effects. Assets should be delivered in a clean, organized, game-ready format.



This game is designed for mobile in landscape orientation, so artwork must read clearly on smaller screens with strong contrast and clean silhouettes.



Requirements:

• Strong pixel art portfolio

• Experience creating game assets (sprites, UI, environments)

• Familiarity with sprite sheets and animation frames

• Ability to closely match a provided visual style

• Experience with tools like Aseprite or Photoshop



How to apply:

• Send a link to your portfolio or pixel art samples

• Review the reference folder and confirm you are comfortable matching that style

• Include examples of character sprites and environment or UI work if available

• Briefly describe your experience creating art for games or interactive projects

• Confirm which tools you use for pixel art



This is an ongoing role with potential for long-term work. Applications without relevant pixel art samples will not be considered.

title: Funding Advisor
description:
About the Role



We’re looking for a Funding Advisor to serve as one of the primary point of contact for clients throughout the funding process. This role sits at the intersection of client communication, documentation management, and funding execution. You’ll guide clients from initial qualification through funding by collecting required materials, coordinating with funding partners, and tracking deals through the pipeline.



This is a client-facing, detail-oriented role ideal for someone who enjoys helping businesses access capital while keeping operations tight and organized. 



Key Responsibilities



Client Communication & Relationship Management



Act as the primary point of contact for clients during the funding process



Clearly explain funding requirements, timelines, and next steps



Follow up with clients to collect outstanding documents and information



Provide status updates and manage expectations throughout the funding lifecycle



Document Collection & Review



Collect, organize, and verify required documentation, including:



Proof of income / revenue



Business bank statements



Formation documents (EIN, Articles, Operating Agreements, etc.)



Identification and compliance-related documents



Ensure all documents are complete, accurate, and properly formatted before submission



Funding Partner Coordination



Submit completed funding packages to appropriate funding partners



Maintain communication with lenders and capital partners regarding deal status



Address follow-up requests, clarifications, or additional documentation needs



Pipeline & Process Management



Track all deals within the funding pipeline using internal systems or CRM tools



Monitor deal progress from submission through approval and funding



Flag bottlenecks, delays, or issues that may impact funding timelines



Maintain clean records and accurate notes for each client file



Operational Support



Assist in improving internal processes related to funding workflows



Ensure compliance with internal standards and partner requirements



Collaborate with sales, operations, and leadership teams to optimize outcomes



Qualifications & Skills



Experience in business lending, fintech, financial services, or sales operations preferred



Strong organizational skills and attention to detail



Excellent written and verbal communication skills



Comfortable working directly with clients and financial documents



Ability to manage multiple deals simultaneously in a fast-paced environment



Familiarity with CRMs, document management tools, and pipeline tracking systems



Proactive, reliable, and able to work independently



Nice to Have



Prior experience with alternative lending, SBA, MCA, or business credit products



Understanding of underwriting basics and funding requirements



Experience working with funding marketplaces or lender networks



Why This Role Matters



Funding Advisors play a critical role in turning opportunities into funded deals. You’ll directly impact client success by keeping deals moving, reducing friction, and ensuring a smooth funding experience from start to finish.

title: Social Media Manager
description:
Company Overview



At LevelUp, we believe growth happens when people feel trusted, supported, and challenged. For more than seven years we’ve partnered with agencies, software vendors and website owners to provide world class outsourcing and offshore hiring services in a range of verticals, such as technical, operational, and back-office support. We hire curious problem-solvers, give them room to own outcomes, and back them with systems, support and a culture that makes learning part of the job. Join us and help businesses (and your career) level up.



Position Overview



The Social Media Manager is responsible for developing and executing social media strategies to increase brand awareness, drive traffic to the website, and generate leads. This role involves overseeing and managing multiple social media accounts across various platforms for different brands. The ideal candidate will possess a strong understanding of social media trends, content creation, and audience engagement, delivering tailored strategies for each specific brand. You will be responsible for creating engaging content, managing both organic and paid accounts, and measuring results to ensure success.



Key Responsibilities



•Strategy & Implementation: Develop, implement, and manage comprehensive social media strategies across multiple client accounts.

•Content Creation: Create, curate, and schedule engaging content—including images, videos, and copy—tailored specifically to platforms such as TikTok,
, Instagram, X (formerly
), LinkedIn, and YouTube.

•Account Management: Oversee organic and paid social media accounts, ensuring consistent brand voice and aesthetics.

•Community Engagement: Engage with other social media users on behalf of clients to build relationships and foster community.

•Trend Monitoring: Constantly monitor social media channels for emerging trends and audience insights to optimize content performance.

•Paid Advertising: Manage social media advertising campaigns, which includes overseeing budgets and tracking performance.

•Analytics & Reporting: Analyze performance metrics (tracking website traffic, engagement, and lead generation) and prepare detailed reports with actionable insights to translate data into effective strategies.

•Professional Development: Stay updated on the latest social media tools, emerging trends, and industry best practices.



Qualifications



•To be successful in this role, you should meet the following requirements:

•Experience: A minimum of 4 years of experience in a similar role.

•Proven Track Record: Demonstrated experience as a Social Media Manager or in a similar role managing multiple accounts simultaneously

•Portfolio: A professional portfolio of work demonstrating your previous successes.

•Platform Expertise: A deep understanding of social media platforms (TikTok,
, Instagram, X, LinkedIn, and YouTube) and their respective best practices.

•Technical Skills: * Proficiency in social media management tools, specifically Hootsuite.

•Experience with paid social advertising strategies and campaign management.

•Communication & Creativity: * Excellent writing, editing, and visual storytelling skills.

•High level of creativity with a keen eye for aesthetics and the ability to produce compelling copy.

•Soft Skills: * Strong organizational skills with the ability to multitask and meet strict deadlines.

•Ability to work independently and collaboratively as part of a team.

•Analytical mindset with the ability to translate data into strategy.



More Information



•Job Type: Full-time 

•Schedule: Monday to Friday, 4pm-1am

•Location: Remote 

•Benefits: HMO + 13th month pay



APPLICATION LINK:

title: Supplier and Product Management
description:
Hello,



Company Introduction:

We are a growing company headquartered in Hong Kong, specializing in niche products in the toys and games category. Our products are sold across multiple overseas markets. Due to business expansion, we are seeking someone for a Supplier and Product Management role.



Job Responsibilities:

- Maintain good communication and cooperative relationships with existing suppliers; handle routine reorders.

- Work with suppliers on product improvements and quality enhancements.

- Arrange product quality inspections (QC) and follow up on results.

- Coordinate supplier shipments, including pickups and liaising with freight forwarders.

- Prepare purchase orders (POs) and verify pro forma invoices (PIs) and commercial invoices (CIs) for accuracy.

- Professionally and efficiently resolve issues with suppliers.

- Identify opportunities to reduce costs and provide optimization suggestions.

- Source and develop new suppliers as needed.



Bonus Skills (not required)

- Inventory management experience; able to reorder or allocate stock based on inventory levels.



Other Requirements

- You are Detail Oriented: You notice listing inconsistencies, errors, or missed information and fix them.

- Good written English ability

- Strong communication skills, professional attitude, reliable, responsible

- A good team player.

- Responsible, reliable and has a strong sense of ownership. 

- High achiever



Work Arrangement

Approximately 20 hours per week, with the potential to grow into a full time, long term position.



Compensation

Competitive hourly rate or monthly retainer (negotiable)



Application Method

Please send the following:



- Resume (including relevant work experience, current location in China, and language proficiency)

s and customer support

title: Graphic & Multimedia Designer – E-commerce (Amazon)
description:
Join Our Growing Design Team at Roots & Branches



Hi there! We're looking for our second creative powerhouse, a digital graphic designer, but not just any designer. We're looking for someone who understands the e-commerce game, especially when it comes to Amazon. Someone who knows that great design doesn't just look good, but actually sells.



We already have a strong designer in our team, leading brandbooks and full-scale creative direction. What we're missing now is a versatile, hands-on designer who can turn ideas into assets that convert across platforms like Amazon, social media, and our own webshops. If you can switch effortlessly between digital, print, and motion — this is for you.



What You'll Be Doing

- You'll be part of a small but ambitious team that creates all content for our brands, ranging from:

- E-commerce Visuals to different marketplaces

- Brand Ecommerce Page, Storefronts

- Cross-platform creatives for campaigns

- Concept development and execution for digital visuals

- Short-form videos, product explainers, infographic-style edits

- Work closely with our Lead Designer on campaigns, product launches, and creative refreshes

- Collaborate with our lead designer to execute full campaigns, new product launches, and content refreshes.





What We're Looking For:



Tech Skills

- Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects & Premiere Pro)

- Proficiency in Figma (Figma Design & FigJam)

- Experience with graphic design for e-commerce, especially Amazon listings & A+ Content

- Video editing skills are a must (focus on short iinfographic videos & video ads)

- Basic understanding of UI/UX and bonus points for HTML & CSS

- Open to working with AI tools (for creativity & efficiency)



Soft Skills

- Creativity paired with commercial thinking — you don’t just design, you design to sell.

- Strong communication & collaboration skills.

- Ability to juggle multiple projects — digital, video — without losing quality.

- Eye for composition, layout, typography and product photography.

- Flexible and fast — e-commerce waits for no one.



Non-Negotiable

- Strong portfolio showcasing e-commerce & other digital graphic design work

(We won’t move forward without seeing past Amazon and/or online retail-related work.)

- Experience working with EU or US brands

- Experience with A/B testing of creatives

- Worked for an e-commerce aggregator, agency, or brand-focused environment



What We Offer

- Competitive freelancer salary from 800 to 1300 USD depending on experience + 13th month performance-based bonus.

- Full-time, fully remote role (Philippines-based applicants preferred)

- Creative freedom, personal responsibility, and a role where you can actually make an impact

- 40-hour work week

- Health insurance & pension funds (5000 PHP extra per month)

- A fun, young international team that’s passionate about health, design, and growing online brands

- Direct collaboration with owners, marketers, and senior designers

- 25 holidays per year



About Roots & Branches

Roots & Branches is a European brand group focused on health & wellness products. We create & sell products under several brands through Amazon, our own webshops, and other platforms across Europe. We believe in making products that genuinely improve well-being - and you’ll help us make them look great and sell even better.



How to Apply

Please fill out this form:



Attention to detail test:

In question 7 of the form, mention the word Pineapple so we know you actually read this post. Applications without it will not be considered. All applicants should make a short introduction video where you tell a bit about yourself and why you would fit in our company based on your experience. No video is no submission.

This is not a call center script-reading role. You must be confident, persuasive, and comfortable discussing pricing ranges and financing options.

Implant-supported dentures



Snap-in dentures



Dental implants



Emergency and extraction-related leads



Key Responsibilities

Respond quickly to new leads from ads and campaigns



Prequalify patients based on needs, readiness, and budget



Confidently discuss implant-supported denture procedures at a high level



Handle common objections such as price, timing, fear, and comparison shopping



Explain third-party financing options clearly and accurately



Schedule consultation appointments directly into the practice schedule



Maintain accurate notes and statuses inside the CRM



Follow structured follow-up workflows until a clear outcome is reached



Required Experience



Strong sales and negotiation skills



Previous dental telemarketing or dental sales experience



Familiarity with implant-supported dentures and dental implants



Experience discussing pricing ranges and payment options



Hands-on experience with U.S. dental financing companies, including:



CareCredit



Cherry



Alphaeon



Other third-party financing platforms



Comfortable working inside a CRM and follow-up system



Clear spoken English with a professional, confident phone presence



Preferred but Not Required



Open Dental experience



Experience scheduling high-value dental consultations



Knowledge of U.S. dental workflows and terminology



Performance Expectations



Same-day lead follow-up



Consistent call volume and documented outreach



High show-rate for scheduled consultations



Accurate prequalification to reduce no-shows and unqualified bookings



Professional, patient-focused communication



Who This Role Is Not For



Script-only callers



Appointment setters with no sales ability



Anyone uncomfortable discussing money or financing



Candidates without dental experience



Anyone who avoids outbound calling



Why Work With Us

Performance-driven environment

title: Content Creator / Video Editor for Car Organization TikTok Series
description:
We are looking for a creative and organized freelancer to help produce engaging TikTok content focused on car trunk transformations!



**Project Overview:**  

Create short, satisfying "before-and-after" videos showing messy car trunks being organized using storage products. The goal is to post high-quality, viral-style videos on TikTok to promote car organization tips and products.



**Main Responsibilities (in priority order):**

1. Research and recommend organization products from Amazon or similar retailers, with separate suggestions tailored to different vehicle types (sedans, SUVs, hatchbacks, vans).

2. Take clear, well-lit "before" photos of unorganized car trunks (various vehicles if possible).

3. Organize the trunks using recommended products.

4. Take matching "after" photos of the now-organized trunks.

5. Edit the before-and-after photos into smooth, engaging short videos (15–60 seconds), including transitions, text overlays (e.g., "Before" / "After"), background music, and simple effects using mobile-friendly tools like CapCut.

6. Upload the finished videos to our TikTok account with optimized captions, hashtags (#CarOrganization #BeforeAfter #TrunkMakeover #CarHacks etc.), and product mentions.



**This is a freelance / project-based or part-time remote role.** You can work from home at your own schedule. We can start with 1–2 test videos, then scale to ongoing content if results are good.



**Requirements / Skills Needed:**

- Experience creating and editing short-form videos (TikTok, Reels, or YouTube Shorts preferred)

- Proficient with video editing apps (CapCut, InShot, VN, or similar – no need for advanced PC software)

- Good smartphone photography skills (clear shots, consistent angles, good lighting)

- Access to at least one car/hatchback/SUV (bonus if you have access to multiple vehicle types or friends/family who can help)

- Basic research skills (able to search Amazon for car organizers and summarize recommendations) - save the links.

- Creative eye for "satisfying" organization transformations

- Fluent in English (for captions and communication)

- Reliable, detail-oriented, and able to follow instructions precisely

- Bonus: Experience with TikTok trends, hashtags, and algorithm-friendly editing



**What We Provide:**

- Clear guidelines and examples of desired video style

- Budget for purchasing a few organizer products (reimbursed or provided)

- Potential for long-term collaboration if performance is strong



**Compensation:**

- Per video: PHP800 – PHP1,500 (depending on quality, length, and complexity)

- Or fixed monthly rate for ongoing content (negotiable based on output volume)

- Bonuses for videos that perform well (high views/engagement)



**How to Apply:**

Please send your application with the subject line: **TIKTOK CAR ORGANIZE – [Your Name]**



Include in your message:

1. A short introduction about yourself

2. Links to your previous TikTok/Instagram/Reels work (especially any before-after, organization, or product showcase videos)

3. Your estimated availability per week

4. Your expected rate per video or per month

5. Confirmation that you have access to a car for shooting



Applications without video samples or the correct subject line will not be considered.



We are excited to work with a talented creator who loves clean, satisfying transformations!



Looking forward to your applications!  

(We review applications on a rolling basis and aim to start within 1–2 weeks.)



Apply via:
