title: On-Camera Presenter / Actor (Male) for Calm, Professional Online Course (Remote)
description:
Overview

We are producing a premium instructional video course for adult men navigating serious, high-stakes life decisions. This is not entertainment, hype, coaching, or influencer content.



We are seeking a male on-camera presenter with a neutral, minimal accent who can deliver structured material calmly, clearly, and credibly — similar in tone and pacing to the reference below:



Reference style (tone, pacing, professionalism):





This is a paid project with potential for additional work if the fit is strong.



What You’ll Be Doing

Recording scripted course modules (scripts provided)

Delivering content with calm authority and emotional neutrality

Avoiding hype, dramatization, or motivational speaking

Recording in a professional-quality studio setup

Delivering finished video files (clean audio, stable framing, neutral background)

This role requires the ability to produce the video end-to-end, not just appear on camera.



Requirements (Read Carefully)

*Voice & Communication

Minimal / neutral accent (American, Canadian, UK, or equivalent neutral)

Clear pronunciation and steady pacing

Comfortable delivering serious subject matter

Able to sound grounded, trustworthy, and composed

*Production Capability

Quiet recording environment

High-quality camera (DSLR or equivalent preferred)

Professional lighting

Clean, broadcast-quality audio (lav mic or condenser)

Ability to maintain consistent quality across all modules

*Professional Standards

Able to follow scripts precisely

Reliable turnaround times

Discretion and confidentiality required



NOT a Fit If You…

Have a strong regional or foreign accent

Use AI avatars or synthetic voices

Prefer influencer, sales, or coaching energy

Cannot handle full video production independently

Are uncomfortable with sensitive life topics



Required Audition Script (READ ALOUD ON VIDEO)

All applicants must submit a short video reading the script below.

This is used to assess clarity, accent neutrality, pacing, and tone.

“When everything feels uncertain, the most important thing is not to react — it’s to get clear.

This guide is designed to help you slow things down, understand what’s actually happening, and make decisions that protect your time, your finances, and your relationship with your children.

There is no pressure here, no promises, and no shortcuts.

Just practical information, delivered calmly, so you can move forward with intention instead of fear.”



Guidelines for the audition video:

60–90 seconds total

Neutral background

Natural speaking pace

No background music

No acting, no dramatization



Deliverables

Full course module recordings (details shared after selection)

Clean, edited video files ready for upload

Consistent audio and visual quality



Compensation

Paid per project or per module (discussed after review)

Competitive pay for qualified professionals

Potential for future recordings if collaboration is successful



How to Apply (Required)

All applications must be submitted through this form:





You will be asked to provide:

A short written introduction

A link to your audition video (reading the script above)

Examples of prior on-camera work (if available)

A brief description of your recording setup

Applications submitted outside this form will not be reviewed.



Final Note

This project prioritizes trust, clarity, and composure.

If you can deliver serious content with calm authority and professional production quality, we’d like to hear from you.

title: Coder
description:
IMPORTANT: To apply for this role, we need you to create a short 1 minute video detailing how you would set this project up for success. Applications that don't include this will not be considered. Please don't apply at all if you can't meet this requirement. 



We need a coder who can take QPOD’s sustainable foundation system and transform the current manual layout process into a smart, automated design tool. You’ll help us push the industry forward, save hours of design work, and connect directly into sales.



We’ve outlined the must-haves above, but we’re also looking for your technical guidance:



Best stack for handling PDF/DWG in-browser



Smart approach to boundary recognition



Future-proof architecture for evolving QPOD rules and products



We’re QPOD, an earth-friendly foundation system designed and manufactured in New Zealand. Our foundations replace traditional polystyrene pods with pods made from recycled plastic, delivering both sustainability and performance.



Right now, we manually create slab layouts by placing QPOD components (pods, ribs, and beams) onto a plan and adjusting for structural rules. It’s effective but time-consuming. We want to automate this process into a web-based application that:



Saves designers and builders time



Reduces errors



Generates professional outputs (PDF/DWG)



Integrates directly into our quoting and sales process



Core Functions

1. File Import



Accept PDF (vector preferred) and ideally DWG/DXF files. Allows the customer to select the page of the PDF they've uploaded for import. 



Detect slab boundaries and internal walls/columns.



Recognize perimeter conditions (edge beams, rib types, thickenings).



2. Automated Layout Generation



Populate slab with QPOD pods according to system type (Raft or Continuous) and chosen perimeter.



Apply rules for spacing, coverage, and slab depth.



For the Continuous system: automatically insert 300mm breaks under load-bearing walls.



3. Advanced Editing



Add thickenings, recesses (e.g. for showers), cantilevers, or irregular slab shapes.



Manual override: drag-and-drop pods or input numeric dimensions.



Self-check: system highlights conflicts, gaps, or breaches of rules when overrides are made.



4. Outputs



Export PDF (for builders) and DWG (for architects/engineers).



Generate quantity take-off (pods, ribs, concrete, steel, etc.) for quoting.



Integrate with WooCommerce quoting system (open to alternative e-commerce or quoting tools).



5. User Features



Login system with saved projects.



Access levels: architect/designer, builder, QPOD internal.



Optional collaboration tools (share link with team for comments/revisions).



6. Scalability



Future integrations with HubSpot, ERP, or CPD tracking.



Modular design so we can expand to other use cases (rainwater tank slabs, driveways, pile footings).



Next steps. If this role is of interest please do take a look at the  examples we have set out on this page - 



IMPORTANT: To apply for this role, we need you to create a short 1 minute video detailing how you would set this project up for success. Applications that don't include this will not be considered. Please don't apply at all if you can't meet this requirement.

title: Electrical Engineer- Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS) experience needed.
description:
We are a premium Australian BPO seeking a Senior Electrical Engineer for our client, a global renewable energy company specializing in Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS). This company leads the market in large-scale, industrial and commercial BESS with expanding capabilities across solar power and EV charging infrastructure.



We are seeking an experienced Offshore Electrical Engineer to support the electrical design, integration, and documentation of BESS projects.



This full-time (FT) role offers the flexibility of working-from-home (WFH) a market leading salary package including paid leave + bonuses. Be a key player on a dynamic team and supportive working closely with onshore Australian engineers.



Fast-track your career with personal and professional growth and development in the Australian market. Contribute to the delivery of technically robust, standards-compliant designs for manufacturing, installation, and commissioning.



This position is well suited to an engineer who is highly detail-oriented, comfortable working to established standards, and experienced in supporting complex industrial energy systems.



****The Role Requires****



Degree qualification in Electrical Engineering.

5+ years’ experience in:

Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS), or

Utility-scale Solar PV systems

Experience with industrial electrical systems, including:

Low Voltage (LV) power systems

Control systems

Auxiliary electrical systems

Exposure to one or more of the following:

BESS and PCS systems

UPS systems

Switchboards

Industrial or power equipment

Strong proficiency in AutoCAD

Advanced Excel skills

Strong proficiency in English both written and verbal communication skills

Key Responsibilities



Prepare and update:

Electrical schematics

Single Line Diagrams (SLDs)

Wiring diagrams

Develop and maintain:

Bills of Materials (BOMs)

Cable schedules

Termination lists

Review vendor and supplier datasheets against defined technical and project requirements

Support electrical integration of:

Battery systems

Power Conversion Systems (PCS)

UPS systems

HVAC interfaces

Fire system interfaces

Assist with electrical documentation to support:- Manufacturing, Site installation and Commissioning activities.

Standards & Approvals



Work to defined engineering standards, templates, and design frameworks including

IEC and AS-based designs

No statutory sign-off or certification responsibilities. (Final engineering approvals are retained by the onshore Australian team).

Tools & Working Style



High level of proficiency in AutoCAD

Strong Excel capability for schedules, BOMs, and data management

Able to work effectively under direction and within defined processes

Comfortable collaborating with international teams across time zones AUS and US.

Detail-focused, organised, and deadline-driven in a remote environment

This WFH role requires candidates have a complete WFH set-up in place including.



· Laptop.



· Monitor if needed.



· Fast and reliable Internet.



· Back-up internet options.



· Back-up power options.



Please link your CV and Portfolio of your relevant CAD works, to be considered for this role.



Please provide your contact information for WhatsApp.



Thank You!

title: Credit Repair Specialist (Disputes & Letter Writing)
description:
We are hiring an experienced Credit Repair Specialist to assist with preparing and managing credit disputes for clients. This role is focused on analyzing credit reports, identifying negative or inaccurate items, and creating effective dispute letters to help improve client credit profiles.



The ideal candidate understands the credit repair process, knows how to structure dispute rounds, and can work independently while maintaining accuracy and confidentiality.





Responsibilities include:

• Reviewing client credit reports from all three bureaus (Experian, Equifax, TransUnion)

 • Identifying negative, inaccurate, or unverifiable items

 • Creating and organizing dispute letters for multiple rounds (bureaus & creditors)

 • Tracking progress and updating dispute status for each client

 • Following credit repair guidelines and best practices

 • Maintaining strict confidentiality with all client information





Skill Requirements (Top 3):

    1    Credit Repair Experience – Must understand how to read credit reports and identify accounts, collections, charge-offs, late payments, and public records

    2    Dispute Letter Writing – Ability to create strong, professional dispute letters and structure multiple rounds effectively

    3    Attention to Detail & Organization – Able to manage multiple client files, track disputes, and ensure accuracy in all documents

title: Credit Dispute Specialist – Late Payment Removal (Immediate Project)
description:
Position Overview



We are currently seeking an experienced Credit Dispute Specialist with a proven track record of removing late payments from open accounts, specifically credit cards. Our internal team successfully handles collections, charge offs, and other negative items, however we are looking to partner with a specialist who focuses specifically on late payment removals, including late payments reported within the past 12 to 24 months or even later. 



Immediate Need

We currently have active clients who require late payment removals on open revolving accounts, and we are looking for a dispute professional who can begin working these files immediately. In addition, have a client with two open credit cards with a 60 day late payment from two years ago. Client was severely sick and trying to help.



ONLY APPLY IF:

• You have verifiable experience removing late payments from open accounts

• You understand creditor goodwill strategies, compliance based disputes, and furnisher reporting standards

• You can provide examples of past results or case experience

• You are able to start immediately



Responsibilities

• Review client credit reports and identify late payment reporting opportunities

• Execute dispute and goodwill strategies appropriate for open revolving accounts

• Track dispute timelines and provide reporting updates



To Apply, Submit:

• Summary of your late payment removal experience

• Compensation expectations

• Availability to begin



*Pay is negotiable*

HR Manager Responsibilities (50%)

- Maxicare enrollment, payments, and administration

- Ensure compliance with PH labor rules and best practices

mbers

Required Experience

title: Admin Agent
description:
We’re looking for an Administrative Agent to help support our sales and recruiting teams. This is an entry-level position that is eligible for promotion after 12 months of tenure.



***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********



You will fail the application process if you don't read the entire job description.



***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********





About Us



Started in 2017, and we're growing like crazy.

We expect to hire at least 4 salespeople, 3 admins, and 3 marketers in 2026.

Growing FAST - We sold 2663 lessons in 2025 and we're on pace to sell 3328 lessons in 2026

A small team of 1 American and 10 Filipinos.

We sell manual transmission driving lessons in the United States. Yes, really.

100% inbound leads from Organic Search (SEO). We don’t do cold calling.

No competition - in 90% of the markets we serve, we have no competitors. Because of this, our sale is pretty easy to make.





Compensation and Benefits

Competitive commission package - $3.50 per hour

Paid 5 Sick Days - Effective on day 1

Paid 10 days vacation - Prorated

Paid 14 Bank holidays - (Legal and religious Holidays are country-specific)

Paid Birthday Off - you pick a day off

Business Continuity Plan - In cases of calamity $40 hotel accommodations are permitted to ensure work will continue



Type of Employment

Full Time

40 hours per week

Schedule - 9 AM to 5 PM EST



Benefits to be provided after completion of 3 months:

Health Insurance

Office equipment, home office furniture, and anything else you need for work

Learning books, courses, training, or coaching that you want



Benefits to be provided after completion of one year:

Paid two weeks off for the Christmas Season



Entry Level Details

Note that this is an entry-level job.

We do NOT expect you to have any prior sales experience.

If you’re looking to switch careers and get your foot in the door, this could be great for you.

This is a great opportunity for anyone with a background in any of the following areas: Customer Service, VA Admin, Admin Data Processing, Clerk,
 Communications, General VA, Admin Support, Sales and Admin Specialist, Administrative Support, Operations Admin, Executive Admin Assistant, Sales Assistant.





Duties and Responsibilities

New Orders - Processing Product Order (Gift Certificate)

New Orders - Initial Order Confirmation (Level 3)

Instructor Onboarding, Offboarding and Reonboarding

Reactivate Unavailable Instructor

Secret Message: When you apply, under the section that says "Is there anything else you'd like to write or include?", write the word PINK ELEPHANT. This will show us that you read the entire job description.

Duplicate Record Check

Updating the "Daily Tracking" Process

CTM Prospect Staging





Qualifications

At least 2-3 years of minimum work experience in a relevant or equivalent role

Comprehensive background in Customer and Administrative support

High level of accuracy and attention to detail

Excellent English communication and comprehension

Proficiency in using and managing Google applications - Gmail, Calendar, Documents, Drive

Preferably with knowledge in using cloud-based CRM

Organized and has careful attention to detail

Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively

Strong Problem-Solving skills

Customer Service Oriented and the ability to adapt/respond properly to different types of scenarios

Equipped with good skills in office/admin management, and can suggest process improvements

Must have your own computer, reliable high-speed internet, and a good quality headset and microphone.





What's Hard About This Job

Working Remotely - We're a remote-first company, and we never want to have an office. This is great if you like working by yourself in the quiet, but it can be terribly painful if you need the energy of coworkers nearby.

Our Cultural Values - We're an American company with an incredibly unusual culture. Even by American standards, our 7 cultural values are highly unusual. Our culture is challenging for people accustomed to corporate culture and especially difficult for people who grew up in Confucian cultures. It's a great culture for people who speak directly and have a great deal of self-confidence and ownership. If you identify as a misfit, you'll do well.

Multiple Software Systems - You're going to need to learn how to use 12 different software systems. This is great if you want to get exposed to and experience lots of technology, but it can be tough if you have a hard time learning technology. Secret Message - When you apply, you'll see a box that asks if you want to add anything else. Type in PINK ELEPHANT in all capital letters exactly as we've shown it here.





Cheat Code for getting a job with us:

1) Our application comprises the majority of our recruiting process. Because of that, we suggest that you give us thoughtful responses and rich stories. We typically only interview applicants who give rich and detailed answers to our questions. If you write short responses so that you can hurry up and finish the application, you will not get interviewed.

2) Tell us stories about how your actions match your beliefs and values. For example, if I say I value health and fitness, you don't know if I'm telling you the truth or if I'm just telling you what sounds good. But, if I tell you things I've done, I can illustrate my values of health and fitness with proof. For example, I go to the gym 4 days per week, I've done 6 triathlons, including an Ironman, and I can swim 3000 meters in one hour. My examples of things I've done prove that my actions match my values system.

3) Be vulnerable and honest. We take very detailed notes during the interview process, and we conduct extensive background checks. If the stories you tell about yourself don't match what your references say, we will not hire you. We'd rather hire a C student who is honest about being a C student than someone who is a C student but tries to pass themselves off as an A student. Remember, this is an entry-level job. We're not looking for perfect. We're looking for an excellent cultural fit.





How to apply: Please click on the link: 
/work-opportunities/administration-agent

title: Sales-Focused Virtual Assistant – B2B Services
description:
We are a growing U.S.-based company that provides reliable, long-term Virtual Assistant support to business owners across multiple industries. Our goal is to help businesses scale by offloading administrative, operational, and support tasks to highly trained VAs. We value professionalism, clear communication, and long-term working relationships.



Role Overview



We are looking for a confident, articulate, and results-driven Virtual Assistant to sell Virtual Assistant services to business owners. This role is focused on outbound and inbound sales conversations, qualifying prospects, explaining our services clearly, and booking calls or closing deals depending on experience.



This is not a script-reading role. You must be able to understand business needs, communicate value, and build trust with U.S.-based business owners.



A neutral American accent is required for this position.



Key Responsibilities



• Conduct outbound calls to U.S.-based business owners to introduce our Virtual Assistant services

• Handle inbound inquiries from interested prospects



Clearly explain:

• What Virtual Assistants do

• How our services help business owners save time and money

• The types of roles and tasks our VAs can support



• Ask discovery questions to understand prospect pain points

• Qualify leads and determine fit

• Book discovery or strategy calls for management or close deals directly (based on experience)

• Accurately update CRM notes and call outcomes

• Follow up with prospects via
 and phone

• Maintain a professional, confident, and consultative tone at all times



Required Skills & Qualifications



• Neutral American accent (required – calls will be evaluated)

• Proven experience in B2B sales, cold calling, appointment setting, or consultative selling

• Excellent English comprehension and communication skills

• Strong listening skills and objection handling

• Comfortable working U.S. business hours

• Reliable internet, headset, and quiet work environment



Preferred (Nice to Have)



• Experience selling Virtual Assistants, staffing, or outsourced services

• CRM experience

• Understanding of small business operations



Position Details

• Full-time, long-term position

• Monday–Friday, U.S. business hours

• Performance-based growth opportunities

• Stable role with consistent work and long-term potential

?

 Virtual Assistant Benefits Package



???? Health Insurance – Medical Stipend Program

Our company provides a Medical Stipend Program to help our Virtual Assistants enroll in the health insurance plan of their choice. This approach gives you flexibility instead of a one-size-fits-all HMO.

Program details:

• Up to 100,000 PHP per year toward your chosen health insurance policy

• Eligible after 90 days of employment

• Annual premium is divided into weekly payments and added to your paycheck

• You may include beneficiaries (spouse, children) as long as the total stays within the allowance

• If your plan exceeds the allowance, you simply cover the difference



????? Internet Allowance

• 1,500 PHP per month



???? Rice Allowance

• 1,000 PHP per month



???? 13th Month Pay

• Equivalent to one month’s base pay

• Paid annually on your work anniversary



???? Paid Time Off (PTO)

• 1 week paid vacation leave

• 1 week paid family/sick leave

• Use-it-or-lose-it policy

???? Tuition Reimbursement

• Up to 50,000 PHP per year for education expenses for you or your family

title: Senior Affiliate & Influencer Marketing Manager 5 years experience
description:
About Legend Sports & Razzaque 

At Legend Sports, we’re building a powerhouse in the sports and active lifestyle market. We believe in the power of creators, affiliates, and influencers to connect with audiences authentically—and we’re looking for a top-tier performer to take our affiliate and UGC marketing systems to the next level.

At Razzaque Paradise Properties we are developing High End Residences in Kuta Lombok where we looking for UGC and affiliates.



The Role

We’re seeking a Senior Affiliate & Influencer Marketing Manager who thrives in fast-moving e-commerce and sports/lifestyle industries en Real Estate. The ideal candidate will design and manage scalable systems for affiliate partnerships, influencer collaborations, and UGC campaigns, with a laser focus on traction, conversions, and ROI. You shouldn have at least 4 years experience in this job role, if you dont do not respond!



This is not a “plug-and-play” role—we’re looking for a strategic builder who can identify gaps, implement solutions, and execute campaigns that directly drive sales growth and brand presence.



Key Responsibilities

• Develop and scale affiliate & UGC pipelines that are sustainable and performance-driven

• Manage outreach to hundreds of potential creators weekly, securing high-quality partnerships

• Onboard and nurture affiliates to ensure ongoing alignment and results

• Oversee content creation, approvals, and feedback loops to maintain brand quality and consistency

• Troubleshoot common pain points, such as:

• Ghosted or inactive creators

• Delayed product delivery and fulfillment issues

• Low-performing or misaligned content



Tools & Platforms You’ll Work With

• Affiliate management platforms (e.g., Levanta, Social Snowball, etc.)

• Creator marketplaces and influencer platforms (e.g., TikTok Creator Marketplace, Amazon Affiliates)

• E-commerce platforms (e.g., Shopify)

• Performance tracking and analytics tools



What We’re Looking For

• Proven experience running affiliate, influencer, and UGC campaigns in e-commerce (sports or lifestyle industry a plus)

• Ability to manage 100+ creator relationships while maintaining brand quality

• Strong operational mindset—able to systemize processes and scale campaigns efficiently

• Self-starter with excellent communication and relationship-building skills

• Results-oriented, with a track record of delivering measurable growth



What Success Looks Like

• Building a high-converting affiliate & UGC system that delivers consistent traction

• Driving weekly onboarding of new affiliates and creators

• Successfully scaling campaigns without sacrificing quality

• Directly contributing to sales growth, visibility, and brand presence



Why Join Legend Sports?

At Legend Sports, you’ll have the opportunity to lead influencer and affiliate marketing at scale, working with a brand that’s ready for growth. We’re looking for someone who’s not just managing campaigns—but building systems that last.



If you’re ready to deliver traction, systems, and conversions through creators and affiliates, we’d love to hear from you. Leave a response with BloodyUGC

title: Artificial Inteligence Tech
description:
Position Summary

We are seeking an Artificial Intelligence Specialist to support and optimize AI use across clinical and operational workflows focused in the ambulatory surgery center environment. This role focuses on practical deployment of AI tools to improve compliance, documentation, reporting, training, and operational efficiency. The specialist will work closely with clinical leadership, compliance teams, and administrative staff to translate real world needs into effective AI driven solutions.



Key Responsibilities



Configure, manage, and optimize use of AI platforms such as Claude, ChatGPT, and Microsoft Copilot for clinical and operational tasks.

Develop prompts, templates, and workflows that support compliance, credentialing, QAPI, infection control, and regulatory readiness.

Collaborate with clinical and administrative teams to identify high value AI use cases and automate repetitive processes.

Create governance standards for responsible AI use, including data privacy, HIPAA considerations, and output validation.

Train staff on appropriate and effective use of AI tools for documentation, reporting, and communication.

Monitor AI outputs for accuracy, bias, and regulatory alignment and refine workflows accordingly.

Support integration of AI into existing systems such as Microsoft 365, SharePoint, and operational databases.

Maintain documentation, SOPs, and best practices related to AI usage in clinical operations.



Qualifications

Experience working with large language models such as ChatGPT, Claude, or Microsoft Copilot in a professional setting.

Strong understanding of healthcare or clinical operations, preferably in ambulatory surgery centers or outpatient settings.

Familiarity with healthcare compliance concepts and data privacy requirements.

Ability to translate operational needs into structured AI prompts and workflows.

Strong analytical and problem solving skills.

Excellent communication and training skills.

Experience with Microsoft 365 ecosystem and workflow tools is preferred.

Background in healthcare administration, nursing, informatics, data science, or a related field is a plus.

title: Amazon Specialist
description:
Amazon Seller Central Specialist (Listings, Catalog, Inventory & Account Support)



Overview:

We are hiring experienced Amazon Seller Central specialists to support our growing e-commerce agency. This role is focused on the operational side of managing Amazon accounts, not just listing SEO. You will work directly with our internal team to maintain listings, manage catalog data, support launches, monitor account health, and assist with day-to-day Seller Central tasks across multiple brands.



We are looking for detail-oriented, reliable operators who have hands-on experience inside Seller Central and understand how to execute quickly and accurately.



Key Responsibilities:

 • Build and launch new product listings (parent/child variations, flat files, and manual creation)

 • Update and maintain existing listings (titles, bullets, images, backend data, attributes)

 • Perform catalog management tasks including merges, splits, and error resolution

 • Support product launches and listing optimization updates

 • Monitor and assist with account health issues (suppressed listings, policy warnings, compliance flags)

 • Manage inventory in Seller Central (FBA shipments, stranded inventory, stock level updates)

 • Troubleshoot listing issues and work through Seller Central cases when needed

 • Help maintain organized product data across multiple brands and accounts



Ideal Candidate:

 • 2+ years of hands-on experience working inside Amazon Seller Central

 • Strong understanding of catalog structure (ASINs, variations, flat files, attributes)

 • Experience with listing launches and updates at scale

 • Familiar with account health, policy compliance, and issue resolution workflows

 • Comfortable managing FBA inventory and shipment creation

 • Extremely detail-oriented and organized

 • Strong communicator and able to follow SOPs



Nice to Have:

 • Experience working with agencies or managing multiple Seller Central accounts

 • Basic understanding of listing SEO and conversion optimization

 • Familiarity with tools like Helium 10, Sellerboard, or similar platforms



About Us:

We are a fast-growing Amazon agency supporting multiple brands across various categories. Our team is focused on operational excellence, speed, and accuracy. This role has the potential to grow into a long-term position for the right candidate who can become a core part of our execution team.

title: Visual redesign of website
description:
As part of launching new services, we need to redesign our current website with a refreshed visual identity and a more modern, professional look and feel.



Our existing site is outdated, and we plan to rebuild it entirely. We are therefore looking for someone to review and redesign the site. The existing text content should largely be retained, but the site must be structured so that my business partner and I can easily update the text ourselves after deployment, without external support.



The website is hosted on one.com and built using their native tools. No advanced functionality is required (e.g., webshop, system integrations, or databases).



We expect you to propose several design concepts or mockups to showcase different directions. Based on these, we will select the version to implement.



SEO is not part of this assignment.



Expected hours per week is 10-15 with a total hours for the full task is 40 over 2-3 weeks.

title: Collector Specialist & Admin Support
description:
Job Opening: Collector Specialist / Admin Support



We are seeking a dedicated Collector Specialist who is willing to work the graveyard shift.



Role Overview:

A Collector Specialist is responsible for resolving overdue bills and collecting payments from those who owe. They must ensure that they keep their employer’s assets safe while also making sure those responsible for unpaid bills are contacted immediately.  Monitoring accounts to identify overdue payment , finding and contacting debtors to arrange debt payoffs and keeping accurate records and reporting on collection activity.



What We Offer:

Competitive monthly payout of $550-$650 via PayPal.

Opportunities for growth and advancement within the company.

2 days off and observance of US holidays.



Qualifications:

1-2 years  of relevant experience.

A working PC with an Intel i5 processor or higher.

Must not have any other job during our shift: 11 PM to 8 AM PH time (no gaslighting).

No attendance issues; must have a reliable PC and a backup internet plan.

A working PayPal account for payout.

Amenable to a monthly payout.

Ability to meet call, talk time, and appointment targets.

Willingness to start ASAP.

Preferably knows how to speak and understands Spanish



If you meet the above qualifications and are ready to take on a challenging and rewarding role, please apply with your resume and a brief cover letter explaining your relevant experience and why you would be a great fit for this position.



Please include the following in your application:

A link to your 2–3 minute audio introduction

A link to your resume



To confirm you’ve read the full post, add the name of your favorite anime character in the subject line of your application.



We’re excited to meet you—join our team and start making an impact today!

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Talent Aqusition Recruiter & HR Operations Specialist (Contract Role)
description:
Location: Fully Remote (Global Team)

Rate: $4–$7 USD/hour (depending on experience)



TopFoxx is a fast-growing, women-owned fashion startup reinventing the sunglasses industry with solution-oriented designs and unapologetically bold branding. Since 2016, we’ve grown from a bootstrapped e-commerce brand to a global business serving hundreds of thousands of customers in over 40+ countries.



We’re not here to follow trends — we create them. Our sunglasses are tangle-free, floatable, foldable, and sustainably made. And we’re just getting started.



We are currently hiring a contract Recruiter & HR Operations Specialist for an initial 6-month contract, with the possibility of long-term extension based on performance. This role is part recruiting, part HR, part onboarding, and part operations/project management — supporting the growth of a high-performance global team.



Key Responsibilities

Recruitment (Full-Cycle, A-Player Hiring)



• Lead end-to-end recruiting for multiple roles at once using TopFoxx’s high-performance, multi-step hiring systems.

• Follow A-Player recruiting strategies, including structured scorecards, multi-round evaluations, deep alignment screening, red-flag analysis, and performance-based interviewing.

• Write compelling, brand-aligned job descriptions.

• Post and manage job ads across global job boards (LinkedIn, Indeed, OnlineJobs.ph, etc.).

• Conduct sourcing outreach to top candidates in the industry, persuade them to apply, and confidently negotiate compensation or job terms.

• Build role-specific application forms, assessments, and skill tests.

• Review applications and score candidates using structured hiring frameworks.

• Maintain clean, accurate candidate pipelines and reporting systems.

• Work directly with the HR Manager and department heads to move candidates through the funnel quickly and accurately.



HR Assistance & People Operations



• Assist in creating structured onboarding plans for each role.

• Coordinate and run onboarding sessions, initial training, and role-specific integrations.

• Maintain employee and contractor records with accuracy and confidentiality.

• Create and update SOPs, training materials, checklists, and role guides.

• Help ensure accountability for new hires during early performance periods (first 30–90 days).

• Partner with department leads to ensure clarity, alignment, and timely feedback cycles.

• Support compliance, documentation, and communication processes company-wide.



Operations & Project Coordination



• Assist with cross-functional tasks and projects related to HR, recruiting, performance, onboarding, scheduling, or internal communication.

• Coordinate between HR, leadership, and department heads on priorities and follow-ups.

• Track deadlines, hiring milestones, and onboarding deliverables.

• Support ongoing improvement of recruiting, training, and HR processes.

• Help ensure new hires stay aligned with TopFoxx standards for productivity and excellence.



What We’re Looking For



• 2+ years of full-cycle recruiting experience, ideally in e-commerce, digital, fashion, or startup environments.

• Experience hiring both U.S.-based and international talent (Philippines, LATAM, India, EU, etc.).

• Strong persuasion and negotiation ability — able to sell roles, close talent, and attract top candidates.

• Experience with structured interview flows, assessments, and scorecards.

• 1 year of administrative assistant or people operations experience preferred.

• Experience supporting onboarding or training is a plus.

• Excellent written and spoken English communication.

• Highly organized with strong follow-through and a proactive mindset.

• Eager to work in a high-speed startup environment with intense hiring cycles, tight deadlines, and evolving priorities.

• Tech-savvy (Google Suite, Asana, TimeDoctor, job boards, HR tools).

• Passionate about people, culture, and building strong, long-term teams.



What You’ll Get



• Competitive hourly rate ($4–$7 USD/hour depending on experience).

• Potential long-term contractor opportunity based on performance.

• A role where you take full ownership — you are expected to figure things out, research solutions, and operate independently without constant guidance.

• A self-directed environment where resourcefulness, speed, and problem solving are required daily.

• A fast-paced team that values accountability, clarity, and high performance.

• Free sunglasses + product perks.



Apply Now



This isn’t a resume screener role. This is for someone who loves building teams, developing talent, and supporting operations at a high level. Apply now and help us find the next wave of innovators, creators, and A-players at TopFoxx. 
  can
.

title: Operations Specialist
description:
About TopFoxx



TopFoxx is a rapidly-growing, women-owned start-up founded in New York City that develops unique, innovative eyewear and accessories centered around a mission of innovation and sustainability.



We are seeking a Vendor & Operations Specialist who can take ownership of a wide range of operational tasks across the company. This is a full operations support role that also includes virtual assistant–style tasks, ad hoc tasks, research tasks, and anything the business needs to run smoothly.



You do NOT need previous experience in every area.

You DO need to be able to figure things out quickly, work fast, solve problems, and execute independently.



Working at TopFoxx means operating with urgency, taking ownership, and staying highly organized in a fast-paced environment. You will work directly with leadership and support the backend operations that keep the company moving.



Key Responsibilities

Vendor & Supply Chain Support



• Communicate with factories to receive production updates and confirm materials/timelines.

• Source new suppliers (Alibaba, global platforms), request samples, compare pricing, and evaluate new options — no experience required, but you must learn fast.

• Negotiate pricing and ensure strong cost efficiency.

• Track shipments, create ASNs, and coordinate with fulfillment centers.

• Resolve vendor issues quickly and prevent the same mistakes from repeating.



Operations & Backend Support (Full Ops Role)



This role touches multiple areas of the business, including:

• Shopify website updates, product pages, SEO basics, backend organization

• Inventory syncing across Shopify, TikTok Shop, Amazon, Faire, and other platforms

• Creating barcodes, SKUs, invoices, and updating spreadsheets

• Uploading assets, organizing files, and keeping systems clean

• Assisting with logistics, restock projections, and shipment issues

• Supporting marketing or customer service teams with operational needs

• Taking virtual assistant–style tasks: ad hoc requests, research tasks, admin tasks, follow-ups, and small projects that need fast completion



Research, Admin & Problem Solving



• Perform research on suppliers, factories, materials, pricing, and industry trends.

• Research new 3PLs, tools, and solutions to improve efficiency.

• Handle any VA-style research or admin task assigned (organizing data, documenting processes, comparing vendors, etc.)

• Solve problems with minimal guidance.

• Provide updates with accuracy and urgency.

• Help brainstorm better systems for operations and backend organization.



Experience & Skills (to have or learn quickly)



• 2+ years in operations, admin, logistics, VA work, or a similar role.

• Strong ability to figure things out without needing step-by-step instructions.

• Excellent English communication (written and verbal).

• Fast learner with strong follow-through.

• Highly organized, detail-oriented, and dependable.

• Proficient in Google Sheets/Excel.

• Thrives in a fast-paced startup environment.



Job Type



Full-time

Monday–Friday, 9:00AM–6:00PM EST (flexible schedule)

Fully remote



Compensation & Benefits



• Salary is exprience based

• PTO for holiday, vacation, sick, personal, and mental health

• Free TopFoxx products and partner perks

• Growth opportunities as the company expands



Apply

title: Influencer Marketing Tiktok Shop (Fast-Paced Growth Role)
description:
About TopFoxx



TopFoxx is a fast-growing, women-owned DTC startup specializing in innovative eyewear designed to solve real problems. Our slogan, “sunglasses with a solution,” reflects our creative approach with products like tangle-free aviators, floating sunglasses, foldable pocket sunnies, shatter-resistant lenses, and eco-friendly castor-bean frames. We are a lean, high-performing, founder-led operation where every tea
mber moves with urgency, ownership, and a growth mindset.



We are looking for someone ambitious and sharp who wants to scale influencer marketing to the next level. This is not a slow or passive role. You will move fast, execute daily, and help build the engine that drives revenue through influencer partnerships, TikTok Shop affiliates, and strategic community engagement.



Job Overview



We’re hiring a full-time Influencer Marketing Specialist who understands U.S. culture, social media trends, and conversion-driven influencer strategy. Your main mission is to grow revenue through influencers, especially on TikTok Shop, while also helping across marketing areas when needed.



This role requires someone who is analytical, strategic, and able to work at a high pace. You must be strong at setting KPIs, measuring results in real time, and adjusting your approach based on performance. You must be scrappy, proactive, and resourceful with zero budget or gifting-only situations.



This is a role for someone who wants responsibility, ownership, and the opportunity to grow into a leadership position as we scale.



Key Responsibilities

Influencer & Affiliate Growth



• Build and scale TikTok Shop affiliate partnerships with creators who can drive conversions.

• Recruit influencers across Instagram and TikTok who participate in affiliate programs like LTK, Amazon, and TikTok Shop.

• Identify and target new niches of creators who convert well and can grow with us long-term.

• Maintain daily engagement with creators to stay top-of-mind.

• Move creators from gifting to repeat posting and affiliate commissions.



Campaign Execution & Management



• Plan and run influencer campaigns tied to launches, sales, and seasonal events.

• Track KPIs such as revenue per creator, posting frequency, CPM, conversion rate, and ROI.

• Optimize strategies weekly based on data and creator performance.

• Work cross-functionally with marketing, creative, and product teams to align efforts and drive growth.



Performance Tracking & Analytics



• Create, track, and manage KPIs for influencer outreach, revenue, and conversion performance.

• Build weekly reports analyzing TikTok Shop performance and affiliate sales.

• Identify top performers and scale them; identify low performers and replace quickly.

• Maintain accurate data with no padded numbers or inflated reporting.



Daily Execution & Community Presence



• Spend 25%–30% of your time engaging with creators and followers through comments, replies, and outreach.

• Monitor conversation trends, emerging creators, and new affiliate opportunities.

• Support in managing gifting logistics, content follow-ups, affiliate approvals, and communication touchpoints.



Cross-Functional Support



This is a lean startup. You may support:

• basic social media tasks

• helping with creative requests

• coordinating timelines with the marketing team

• assisting with community engagement or product feedback

• helping on urgent projects during launches



Required Experience & Skills



• 2+ years in Influencer or Affiliate Marketing for e-commerce or fashion brands.

• Strong knowledge of TikTok Shop affiliates and platfor
chanics.

• Experience running gifting-only or low-budget influencer strategies that still generated sales.

• Confident writing and communicating in English (verbal and written).

• Highly organized, detail-oriented, and comfortable managing many moving pieces.

• Ability to work fast, pivot quickly, and handle pressure during high-volume seasons.

• Comfortable setting KPIs, measuring performance, and making decisions based on data.

• Experience identifying creators who convert, not just creators who post.



Salary & Benefits



• Competitve Salary is based on experience and performance - 

• PTO plan including vacation, sick, personal, mental health, and holidays.

• Fully remote.

• Free TopFoxx products and partner perks.

• High-growth environment with room to step into leadership roles.



Hours



• Monday through Friday, 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM

• Overtime during peak seasons (BFCM, summer, launches)



Apply



Please only apply and reach out directly through here or you can send your resume to 
 a team where your work directly impacts growth and revenue.



**As a note: this is a freelance job, we are looking for someone for a few months of helping us here.

title: Web Project Coordinator & Quality Control
description:
ABOUT US



AEK Media is a fast-growing digital marketing and web agency working with e-commerce brands and enterprise clients. We build and manage high-quality websites across WordPress, Shopify, and other platforms.



We are looking for a highly organised Virtual Assistant to support our Lead Project Manager in coordinating projects and maintaining quality standards across our web builds.



This is a long-term role with growth opportunities for the right person.



ROLE OVERVIEW



You will work directly under our Lead Project Manager and act as a key support person across active web projects. Your role is to help keep projects running smoothly and ensure every website we deliver meets our quality standards.



This is not a purely administrative role. We are looking for someone detail-oriented, proactive, and comfortable reviewing websites and spotting issues before they reach clients.



You will report to the Lead Project Manager and assist with coordination, tracking, and quality control across multiple projects.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

 • Support the Lead Project Manager in coordinating web projects across WordPress, Shopify, and other platforms

 • Track tasks, timelines, and deliverables using project management tools

 • Perform detailed quality assurance checks on websites before launch

 • Review pages for layout issues, responsiveness, broken links, and functionality

 • Test websites across devices and browsers

 • Document bugs and feedback clearly for developers

 • Follow up with tea
mbers to keep projects on schedule

 • Prepare simple reports and status updates for the Lead Project Manager

 • Maintain organised documentation and checklists



WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR

 • Strong organisational and project coordination skills

 • Excellent attention to detail

 • Experience working with WordPress and/or Shopify (basic familiarity required)

 • Ability to test websites and identify issues independently

 • Clear written English communication

 • Comfortable using tools such as Asana, Slack, Google Workspace, Notion, and MS Office

 • Reliable internet connection and consistent availability

 • Proactive attitude and willingness to learn



BONUS (NOT REQUIRED BUT HELPFUL)

 • Previous experience in a digital agency

 • Basic understanding of web design principles

 • Familiarity with SEO or website optimisation

 • Experience with QA testing processes



WORKING HOURS



Full-time preferred. Some overlap with Australian business hours is required.



WHY JOIN US

 • Long-term stable role with a growing agency

 • Opportunity to develop project management and QA skills

 • Work with an experienced and supportive team

 • Clear reporting structure and mentorship from a Lead Project Manager

 • Performance-based growth opportunities



HOW TO APPLY



Please include the following in your application:

 • A short introduction about yourself

 • Your experience with WordPress and Shopify

 • Examples of projects you have coordinated or tested

 • Your availability and expected salary

 • The word “Precision” in your application subject line (to confirm attention to detail)



We are looking forward to meeting someone who takes pride in delivering high-quality work.

title: HighLevel (GoHighLevel) Support VA – Part-Time (Experienced Only)
description:
We’re Hiring: Detail-Oriented HighLevel Expert (Part-Time, Remote)

Flexible hours • Supportive team • Learn + grow with us



Are you an experienced HighLevel specialist who takes pride in attention to detail and loves learning new tools and features?



We’re especially looking to welcome a woman into this role to help balance our team and bring a fresh perspective to our internal systems. If you enjoy everything about HighLevel and love organizing, optimizing, and staying ahead of the curve, we’d love to speak with you.



This is a part-time, long-term opportunity (5–20 hours/week) with flexibility and room to grow. You’ll help us stay on top of HighLevel and AI advancements, implement them into our internal setup, and guide us on best practices.



About the Role

We’re looking for someone who can take ownership of our GoHighLevel workspace—not just follow SOPs. You’ll help us streamline, structure, and innovate how we use the platform for both internal operations and client-facing systems.



You’ll help us:

- Organize and maintain our internal HighLevel setup

- Set up and optimize calendars, funnels, automations, pipelines, etc.

- Implement and experiment with AI Agents and new HighLevel features

- Build systems that help us and our clients work more efficiently

- Keep us updated weekly on new GHL features and opportunities

- Troubleshoot and resolve issues with clarity and care

- Attend our weekly team call (Mondays at 10am ET)



You’re a Great Fit If You:

- Have 2+ years of hands-on HighLevel experience

- Understand funnels, automations, DNS/subdomains, calendars, pipelines, A2P, etc.

- Are highly organized, detail-oriented, and love making systems run better

- Enjoy learning and teaching new tools (especially AI inside GHL!)

- Communicate well in English (written + spoken)

- Are independent, responsible, and proactive

- Have stable internet and a backup option

- Can commit 5–20 hours/week, consistently

- Are happy starting at $6/hour (USD)



Compensation:

$6-10/hour, paid twice a month

(We review performance regularly and reward reliability and excellence.)



How to Apply (Follow These Instructions Exactly):

- Introduce yourself! Tell us a bit about who you are.

- Share your biggest HighLevel troubleshooting win.

- Show us 2–3 examples or screenshots of GHL work you’ve done.

- Let us know the types of clients or industries you’ve supported.

- Tell us your weekly availability (days/hours).

- Include a screenshot of your internet speed test.

- Only applicants who meet the requirements and follow instructions will be considered.



If you're someone who loves technology, structure, learning, and helping others succeed, we look forward to meeting you.

title: Senior SEO Specialist
description:
Make sure you read this in full before applying:



Let me guess... You're the sharpest SEO mind in the room. But you're suffocating.



You're tired of presenting killer audit findings that get buried in a developer's "backlog." You’re tired of keyword-stuffed nonsense, begging for tool budgets, and explaining a 301 redirect to your boss for the tenth time.



This isn't just another job post. This is your exit strategy.



We’re not offering you a new title. We’re offering you a war room, an arsenal, and the targets to prove how good you really are.



Who Are We?

My name is Jim Ng. I built this agency on one principle: get clients tangible results, or get out of the way. 

In just a year, we've delivered for over 50 businesses. Now, we have a clear, audacious mission: to 10x our revenue in the next 12 months.



This isn’t a "hope and pray" strategy. It’s a battle plan. We need elite "Digital Warriors" who don't just "do SEO"—they command the search results.



The Stakes: We Put Our Skin in the Game

We don’t hide behind "SEO takes time" excuses. We offer our clients iron-clad guarantees:



- 10% of targeted keywords on Page 1 in 3 months.

- 30% of targeted keywords on Page 1 in 6 months.

- 60% of targeted keywords on Page 1 in 12 months.



Does this scare you, or does it excite you? If your first thought is "That's impossible," keep scrolling. If your first thought is "With my strategy and AI-driven efficiency, I can crush those numbers," then you’re the sniper we want.



What You’ll Actually Be Doing (The Blueprint)

- Architect of Success: You won't just advise on site structure; you’ll build the SEO Bible for our clients. You have the authority to see changes implemented.

- AI Command & Control: You use AI models not as a crutch, but as an exoskeleton. You engineer complex prompts to automate audits, generate schema at scale, and dismantle competitor strategies piece by piece.

- The Sherlock Holmes of Search: You conduct deep-dive technical, content, and backlink audits. You find the opportunities that Screaming Frog and Ahrefs miss because you know how to look beneath the data.

- Translate Data into Dollars: You live in GA4 and Search Console. You ignore vanity metrics. Your focus is singular: qualified organic traffic that drives business growth.



The Specialist’s Code (Is This You?)

- Growth & Mastery: You have 3+ years in the trenches. You see a Google Update as an opportunity to leapfrog the competition, not a crisis.

- Technical Dominance: You speak "developer." You understand CMS limitations, cloud hosting, and how to work with technical teams to get it right the first time.

- AI Power User: You are well-adept in prompt engineering. You know how to use AI to 10x your own output and accuracy.

- Future Leader: You want to be in a commanding position. You aren't looking for a job to hide in; you're looking for a platform to lead and eventually run your own pod.



The Real Pay-Off

- Unleashed Autonomy: You get the freedom to test, experiment, and implement. This is your domain to master.

- Remote Warfare: This is a 100% remote role. We care about the traffic graph moving up and to the right, not what chair you sit in.

- No Nightmare Clients: We protect our warriors. If a client won't implement your expert recommendations, we fire them.

- Empire Building: You are part of the core team. Your successes will be highly visible and critical to our 10x mission.



Ready to Enlist? Here’s where you can apply:





Nothing else will be entertained.

title: Virtual Receptionist / Call Agent (Remote)
description:
We are hiring friendly, reliable Virtual Receptionists / Call Center Agents with legal experience to support U.S. and Canadian law firms through high-quality, professional phone intake and client screening.



This is a fully remote role where you will act as the firm’s front line — professionally handling new client inquiries, gathering critical case details, and following strict legal intake and call-handling procedures.



You will represent law firms directly, follow firm-specific scripts and workflows, and ensure every caller feels heard, respected, and supported.



?



What You’ll Do

 • Answer inbound calls for law firms and legal offices

 • Conduct structured new-client intake and screening using firm-approved scripts

 • Ask and accurately document key case details (i
 type, dates, injuries, parties, locations, insurance, etc.)

 • Identify the correct legal matter and route or escalate calls when required

 • Follow each client’s SOPs, intake rules, escalation policies, and transfer workflows

 • Coordinate warm transfers and message delivery based on attorney and staff availability

 • Maintain a calm, empathetic, and professional tone — especially with distressed or emotional callers

 • Build rapport with callers and law firm teams — you will be known by name by your assigned clients

 • Use scripts while maintaining a natural, conversational tone

 • Accurately log call notes, dispositions, and outcomes in real time

 • Stay current on client-specific scripts, updates, and workflow changes

 • Work across multiple law firm clients and switch between different intake workflows



?



What We’re Looking For

 • Fluent English speaker with excellent verbal communication and active listening skills

 • Warm, confident, and professional phone presence

 • Strong empathy and comfort speaking with callers dealing with injuries, legal disputes, or stressful situations

 • Extremely detail-oriented and able to follow legal intake scripts precisely

 • Comfortable working directly with law firm clients and adapting to firm-specific expectations

 • Experience using Five9 and Google Drive (required)

 • Tech-savvy and willing to learn new tools and legal CRMs (such as Clio, SmartAdvocate, or similar systems)

 • Prior experience in at least one of the following: legal intake, law firm reception, or phone-based call center / customer service roles.



?



Requirements

 • Fluent English and comfortable speaking with North American clients

 • High-speed internet, reliable computer, and noise-canceling headset

 • Quiet and private home workspace suitable for confidential legal calls

 • Ability to work scheduled shifts (day, evening, and weekend availability)

 • Strong reliability, time management, and professional communication skills

 • Comfortable handling sensitive and confidential legal information



?



Why Join Us

 • 100% remote — work from anywhere

 • Paid training and legal-intake onboarding

 • Supportive, quality-driven, team-based environment

 • Long-term work and advancement opportunities

 • Competitive hourly pay with performance-based incentives



?



To Apply



Please submit the following:

 • Your resume and a short note describing your experience with:

 • legal intake or phone-based customer service,

 • spoken English communication, and

 • tools such as Five9, Dialpad, or Google Drive

 • A short voice recording introducing yourself and summarizing your background and relevant experience

 • Type AGENT on the first line of your response



We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Remote Digital Support Assistant (Non-Voice)
description:
At Starlight Marketing, a lot of important work happens quietly in the background. This role exists to support those daily operations by keeping information organized, tasks updated, and systems running smoothly—without phone calls or voice work.



As a Digital Support Assistant, your day is structured but not overwhelming. You’ll work through written tasks at a steady pace, follow clear instructions, and make sure nothing important is overlooked. The role is designed for focus and consistency rather than multitasking or decision-making.



Your responsibilities will include:

-Reviewing assigned tasks or inboxes at the start of each shift

-Updating internal tools, trackers, or records based on instructions

-Sorting or tagging information so it’s easy for the team to access

-Flagging anything unclear, incomplete, or missing for review



Most of the work is system-based and repetitive in a good way. Templates, checklists, and step-by-step processes are always provided, so you’ll never be guessing what to do next. Communication is done internally through chat or task tools only.



This role is ideal for someone who prefers non-voice work, enjoys structured routines, and is comfortable working independently. Attention to detail and reliability matter more than speed or experience.



This is a fully remote, long-term position with stable responsibilities and opportunities to grow into coordination or administrative roles as Starlight Marketing continues to expand.

title: Online English/World History Teachers (Near-Native Accent)
description:
About Pomelo Academy

Pomelo Academy is an innovative online international school dedicated to delivering high-quality education to students worldwide. We provide a dynamic and engaging learning environment, offering individualized instruction that transcends geographical boundaries.



Job Description

We are seeking passionate and experienced near-native English-speaking online teachers with strong backgrounds in English and/or World History. Candidates may specialize in one subject (English or History) or be able to teach both. The ideal teachers will have experience working with young learners and be committed to creating a supportive and engaging online classroom.



Responsibilities

• Provide instruction in English and/or World History to individuals and small groups of 2–6 students aged 5–18.

• Utilize international-standard curricula.

• Create and deliver engaging lesson plans tailored to each student’s needs.

• Monitor and assess student progress, providing regular feedback to students and parents.

• Foster a positive and encouraging learning environment.



Qualifications

• Professional teacher with at least 2 years of teaching experience (Kindergarten–Grade 12) and verifiable teaching certifications such as TESOL, TEFL, etc.

• Near-native English accent.

• Strong academic background in English and/or World History (additional experience in Science/Economics is a plus).

• Ability to work between 17:00–22:00 (Weekdays) and 09:00–22:00 (Weekends) GMT+8.

• Experience teaching in public/international schools.

• Skilled at working with young learners aged 5–18

• Familiarity with ClassIn and digital literacy (Microsoft Suite and other educational platforms).

• Must have a stable and fast internet connection and a PC/laptop with at least Windows 10/Mac OS Catalina.



Benefits

• Flexible working hours.

• Opportunity to teach using internationally recognized curricula.

• Work with an international team of educators.

• Professional development and training opportunities.

• Regular enrollment system (not booking-based), ensuring a stable and consistent teaching schedule.

title: Online Math/Science Teacher(Near-Native Accent)
description:
About Pomelo Academy

Pomelo Academy is an innovative online international school dedicated to delivering high-quality education to students worldwide. We provide a dynamic and engaging learning environment, catering to individualized instruction that transcends geographical boundaries.



Job Description

We are seeking passionate and experienced Near-Native English-speaking Online K-12 Math and/or Science Teachers with verifiable teaching certifications. The ideal candidates will have strong academic backgrounds in Mathematics and/or Science, experience teaching young learners (ages 5–18), and a commitment to creating a supportive, inquiry-based, and engaging online learning environment.



Responsibilities



Deliver interactive and engaging Math and/or Science lessons to individuals and small groups of 2–6 students aged 5–18.

Teach using internationally recognized curricula such as A Closer Look, Glencoe Science, Pearson Interactive Science, NGSS-aligned resources, Singapore Math, or IB/AP/A Level Math programs.

Create age-appropriate lesson plans focused on conceptual understanding, inquiry, problem-solving, and real-world applications.

Incorporate visuals, multimedia, and hands-on virtual activities to make abstract concepts accessible and engaging.

Monitor student progress and provide timely feedback to students and parents.

Foster curiosity, discussion, and active learning in a safe and supportive space.



Qualifications



Professional teacher with at least 2 years of teaching experience (Kindergarten–Grade 12).

Must hold a valid teaching license/certification (e.g., Teaching License, State Certification). TESOL/TEFL is a plus.

Near-native English accent with excellent spoken and written communication skills.

Strong academic background in Mathematics and/or Science (Biology, Physics, Chemistry, General Science).

Experience teaching in public/international schools or reputable online platforms.

Familiarity with inquiry-based and/or interdisciplinary approaches (e.g., STEM/STEAM).

Comfortable working between 07:00–22:00 (Weekdays) and 9:00–22:00 (Weekends), GMT+8.

Proficiency with digital platforms such as ClassIn, Microsoft Office, and other educational technologies.

Must have a stable and fast internet connection and a PC/laptop with at least Windows 10 or Mac OS Catalina.



Benefits



Flexible working hours.

Opportunity to teach using globally respected Math and Science curricula.

Be part of an international, passionate team of educators.

Access to training and professional development.

Regular enrollment model (not a booking system), ensuring schedule stability and consistency

title: Graphic Designers Wanted: Build High-Impact Social & Ad Creative for Fast-Growing Brands
description:
Job Overview

We are looking for multiple, talented and detail-oriented Graphic Designers to join our fast-growing creative team. In this role, you will craft stunning social media graphics, ad creatives, and branding materials across a diverse portfolio of brands. You will work closely with our creative and marketing teams to produce engaging visuals that attract attention and drive results. If you are a designer who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is eager to grow alongside a scaling company, this is the perfect role for you. 



Job Description

As a Graphic Designer at Hickman Enterprises, you will be responsible for the end-to-end creation of visual assets. Your work will range from daily high-volume social media content to high-impact marketing campaigns and brand identity projects. You will play a key role in maintaining design consistency across multiple industries while ensuring all digital assets are technically optimized for web and mobile platforms.



Responsibilities

Design social media graphics, ad creatives, blog images, and branding materials.

Create infographics, landing page visuals, and high-impact marketing collateral.

Manage and create vector-based designs to ensure scalability across all platforms.

Support digital projects by working with assets for UI/UX designs and web implementation.

Maintain brand identity systems and ensure visual consistency across various internal and external brands.

Optimize graphics for web, mobile, and social platforms 
,
/X, Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube).

Stay up to date with design trends and best practices to keep our visuals fresh and modern.



Required Skills & Experience

2+ years of professional experience in graphic design.

Mastery of Canva: Expert at utilizing the platform to build scalable templates and produce quality graphics at a rapid pace.

Mastery of Adobe Photoshop or Affinity Designer: Professional-level skills in raster-based design, photo manipulation, and composition.

Essential Knowledge of Figma and Adobe Illustrator: Proficiency in these tools is crucial for our workflow, specifically for managing vector files and working with assets for UI/UX designs.

Understanding of social media ad design and digital marketing principles.

Strong portfolio: Must showcase a diverse range of high-quality work, demonstrating technical skill, creative versatility, and professional execution.



Soft Skills

Team Player: You enjoy collaborating with others and are open to feedback and brainstorming sessions.

Self-motivated & Proactive: You take initiative and can manage projects without constant supervision.

Attention to Detail: You produce polished, high-quality work and have a "technical" eye for design precision.

Growth Mindset: You have a genuine interest in upskilling, mastering new software, and staying ahead of industry shifts.

Innovation: A positive and curious attitude toward leveraging AI as a tool to enhance the creative process and streamline workflows.

Time Management: Ability to meet deadlines efficiently in a fast-paced environment with shifting priorities.



Desired (But Not Required) Skills

Experience with motion graphics.

Basic video editing skills or familiarity with video production.

Knowledge of web design principles or experience with website builders.

title: Virtual Assistant for Temporary Accommodation Business (Work from Home)
description:
Are you highly organised, detail-oriented, and a natural problem-solver? Do you want to be part of a fast-growing property business that provides vital housing for those who need it most?



We’re looking for a reliable Virtual Assistant to join our team and support the daily operations of our Temporary Accommodation (TA) business in the UK. This is a remote role and perfect for someone with strong communication skills and solid admin experience — ideally within property, lettings, or housing.





About Us:



We provide safe, fully furnished, and well-managed accommodation to councils, housing associations, and vulnerable individuals across the UK. With multiple properties under management and a growing network of housing partnerships, we’re scaling fast — and we need a strong right hand to help run the backend operations.





Role: Virtual Assistant



Location: Remote (UK-based preferred)

Hours: Part-time (20–25 hours per week to start)

Rate: Competitive hourly rate based on experience

Start Date: Immediate





Responsibilities:



Tenant Management & Support

 • Respond to tenant messages, maintenance issues, and complaints

 • Coordinate emergency repairs and follow up with contractors

 • Check tenant wellbeing by
 or WhatsApp as needed

 • Update tenant records and ensure compliance with contracts



Bookings & Move-ins

 • Schedule and manage tenant check-ins and check-outs

 • Create welcome packs and send move-in instructions

 • Chase missing documents (IDs, proof of benefit, etc.)

 • Liaise with local housing officers to coordinate placements



Admin & Compliance

 • Upload property certificates and documents to internal systems

 • Ensure EPCs, gas safety, EICRs, and HMO licenses are up to date

 • Track key dates (rent due dates, inspections, renewals)

 • Maintain Excel trackers and Google Sheets



Landlord & Council Liaison

 • Send rent statements to landlords

 • Update councils on room availability

 • Assist in preparing invoices and chasing overdue payments



General Operations

 • Set up systems and automations where needed

 • Support with CRM updates and task lists

 • Order furniture, bedding, and essentials when needed

 • Carry out basic internet research for new partnerships or suppliers





What We’re Looking For:

 • Proven experience in property, lettings, social housing, or admin

 • Strong written and spoken English

 • Excellent organisation and time management skills

 • Ability to stay calm under pressure and juggle multiple tasks

 • Familiarity with Google Workspace, Zoom, WhatsApp, and task managers (e.g. Trello or Asana)

 • Proactive and solution-focused attitude — you don’t wait to be told what to do





Bonus If You Have:

 • Experience working with local authorities or social housing tenants

 • Understanding of compliance requirements in property management

 • Knowledge of CRM systems like Podio, 
, or Notion





Why Join Us?

 • Flexible remote working

 • Purpose-driven work — we help vulnerable people find homes

 • Room to grow with a scaling business

 • Direct mentorship and training provided





How to Apply:

Send your CV and a short cover letter explaining why you’re the perfect fit for this role to 

Please include “VA Application – Temporary Accommodation” in the subject line.

title: Business Research, Proposals, Marketing & Operations Virtual Assistant (VA)
description:
Job Type: Full-time (40 hours/week)

Location: Remote

Contract Type: Long-Term, Performance-Based



About NovaTeck LLC



NovaTeck LLC is a U.S.-based start-up in construction, project management, and procurement company operating across federal government contracting, private-sector infrastructure, commercial construction, and oil & gas support services. We are building scalable internal systems to support rapid growth, brand visibility, and contract acquisition.



Role Overview



We are seeking a highly organized, detail-oriented, and versatile Virtual Assistant to support business research, proposal development, marketing execution, and operational documentation.

This role works closely with the Business Development Officer (BDO) and company leadership to support contract pursuits, funding research, branding, and digital presence.

This is not a basic administrative role. The ideal candidate has strong research, writing, and basic digital marketing skills.



Key Responsibilities:



1. Business, Funding & Market Research

• Research funding opportunities (grants, loans, incentives, government programs)

• Support federal, state, and local government contracting opportunities

• Research and support private-sector contract opportunities

• Conduct competitor and market research in construction, renewable energy, and oil & gas

• Track eligibility criteria, deadlines, and application requirements

• Maintain structured research databases and spreadsheets



2. Proposal & Business Documentation Support

Draft and support preparation of:

• Business plans

• Business reports

• Technical proposals

• Capability statements

• Pricing and cost templates

• Format proposals to comply with RFP/RFQ requirements

• Support compliance reviews and document organization

• Maintain proposal templates and document libraries



3. Marketing, Branding & Digital Presence Support

• Manage and schedule social media content (LinkedIn, Instagram,
 as applicable)

• Support website updates and basic web design (content updates, layout edits)

• Assist with logo design coordination and brand asset management

• Support creation and execution of
 marketing campaigns

• Maintain mailing lists and track basic campaign performance

• Ensure brand consistency across digital platforms

• (Note: This role supports execution and coordination; advanced design or coding is not required.)



4. Collaboration & Operations

• Work hand-in-hand with the Business Development Officer to support active bids and outreach

• Organize digital files, folders, templates, proposal libraries, and reports

• Prepare weekly written summaries of completed tasks, findings, and recommendations

• Track deadlines, deliverables, and follow-ups



Required Skills & Qualifications

• Strong English writing, editing, and comprehension skills

• Proven experience in business or academic research

• Ability to draft structured business and proposal documents

• High attention to detail and strong organizational skills

• Proficiency with Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive)

• Basic familiarity with:

• Social media platforms

• Website content management (e.g., WordPress, Wix, or similar)

•
 marketing tools (e.g., Mailchimp or similar)

• Ability to follow instructions, meet deadlines, and work independently



Educational Background

Minimum: Bachelor’s degree in one of the following or related fields:

• Business Administration

• Management

• Marketing

• Communications

• Economics

• Engineering, Construction Management, or related technical fields

Equivalent (3-5 years) professional experience may be considered in place of formal education







Preferred Experience (Required)

• Experience with government contracting or proposal writing

• Familiarity with construction, engineering, oil & gas, or infrastructure sectors

• Experience supporting business development or executive teams

• Basic design experience (Canva, PowerPoint, Google Slides)



Compensation

Performance-based increase after successful review



Performance Expectations

• Organized documentation and clean digital file management

• On-time delivery of assigned tasks

• Proactive identification of opportunities and improvements
