Strategic Note (Important)

This VA role is designed to:

• Support the BDO (not replace them)

• Strengthen proposal quality, research depth, and brand presence

• Free leadership time for strategy and decision-making

title: ManyChat DM Chatter

This role is the first touchpoint between our leads and our coaching programs, so you’ll play a critical role in building trust, creating authentic connections, and guiding people toward booking their first call with us.



This is a fixed-salary position starting at $400/month with clear room for growth as you develop your skills and demonstrate consistent results. We provide training, ongoing support, and access to resources to help you thrive in this role.





What You’ll Do

-Manage and respond to inbound Instagram DMs using our proven script frameworks

mbers via WhatsApp for coordination and reporting

 with the phrase "happyjoy" in the subject line to

title: Real Estate VA
description:
We’re seeking a highly detail-oriented and tech-savvy Virtual Assistant to support a fast-growing real estate investment operation focused on Subject-To deals, motivated seller outreach, and zoning-based opportunities in Atlanta, GA & Houston, Tx.



You will play a critical role in building our seller database, managing lead pipelines, and conducting skip tracing using specialized tools. If you have experience in real estate lead generation, data mining, and CRM upkeep — and love turning raw data into high-value leads — we want to work with you.



????? What You’ll Do:



???? Skip Tracing & Data Enrichment

Locate and verify homeowner/seller contact details (phone,
, address)

Use tools like Lead Sherpa, Skip Genie, BatchSkipTracing, or REsimpli, etc.

Deliver organized Excel/Google Sheets with fully cleaned and deduplicated lead data

Tag and categorize leads by pain point (e.g., preforeclosure, probate, tired landlord)



???? Lead Generation & Prospect Research

Pull high-intent seller lists via public records, Google, county assessor data, and list services

Research property ownership, mortgage data, and recent transactions

Identify zoning overlays or development potential (training provided)



????? CRM & Admin Support

Enter, update, and maintain leads in CRM (e.g., Notion, REsimpli, or Google Sheets)

Track follow-up cycles and flag hot/warm/cold leads

Manage shared inbox and alert investor to key seller responses

Weekly reporting of outreach stats, new leads, and pipeline health



? You’re a Great Fit If You:

Fluent English Speaker

Have experience with real estate lead generation or skip tracing

Know how to use tools like Lead Sherpa, REsimpli, BatchLeads, Skip Genie, or Propstream etc.

Can think critically and independently verify or cross-reference data

Are fluent in Google Sheets/Excel (formulas, filters, conditional formatting)

Have excellent written English for note-taking and communication

Work with speed and accuracy — but don’t sacrifice quality

Are reliable, consistent, and comfortable working under minimal supervision



???? Preferred Tools/Experience (Not Required, but a Plus):

REsimpli, Lead Sherpa, or Podio CRM

Propstream, BatchLeads, or county-level GIS data

Familiarity with creative finance or Subject-To investing

Zapier or automation tools (for streamlining lead flows)



???? Work Details:

???? 100% Remote

? Part-time (10–20 hours/week to start, with potential for growth)

???? Long-term preferred

???? Must be able to deliver results on consistent weekly timelines

???? Immediate start preferred



???? To Apply please send:



A brief introduction and experience summary (voice or written)

Links to past skip tracing or lead generation projects (if available)

Your weekly availability + hourly rate

Let’s build a smart, scalable deal machine — one quality lead at a tim

title: Meta Ads Video Editor (E-commerce) — Ad-Hoc / On-Call
description:
Role: Meta Ads Video Editor (E-commerce) — Ad-Hoc / On-Call

Type: Part-time, flexible hours

Start: ASAP



We’re an e-commerce brand running paid ads on
 & Instagram, and we’re looking for a Meta ads video editor who can both execute clean edits and come up with winning ad concepts.



This role is not just editing from briefs.

You must be comfortable:



Working from clear briefs when provided



Independently creating ad concepts using our existing content library (UGC, product clips, lifestyle footage)



What you’ll do

Editing & execution



Edit short-form Meta ads (6–45 seconds)



Strong 1–3 second hooks



Fast pacing, pattern interrupts, clean structure



On-screen captions (mobile-first, readable, Meta-safe)



Export ads in correct formats (9:16, 4:5, 1:1)



Creative & concepting



Come up with original ad concepts using our content database



Turn one idea into multiple testable variations



Propose hooks, angles, and structures for cold traffic



Improve or iterate ads based on feedback or performance



Must-have skills



Proven experience editing Meta ads for e-commerce



Strong understanding of direct-response editing (not cinematic reels)



Comfortable creating ad concepts from scratch



Can also follow briefs exactly when required



Fast turnaround and open to iteration



Bonus skills (nice to have)



UGC-style ad experience



CRO or performance mindset



Familiar with Meta ad policies



Experience with health, wellness, or physical products



Can explain why an ad might perform well



Performance bonus (important)



We offer a $25 USD bonus for winning ad concepts / creations.



This applies only to ads that:



Are your original concept (not from our brief)



Are created using our existing content library



Are launched and tested on Meta



Demonstrate strong performance relative to our benchmarks



Ads edited strictly from provided briefs are paid at the standard rate and are not eligible for the bonus.



This incentive is designed to reward creative thinking, ownership, and effort, not just execution.

title: Creatieve Digital Illustrator & Designer (Freelance / Parttime)
description:
Ink & Blink is growing fast. We’re building an international children’s brand full of imagination, education, and creativity. That’s why we’re looking for a digital illustrator + creative designer who can bring our colorful world to life.



THE ROLE

You will be responsible for illustrating and designing our children’s books and visual content. You will also support the brand with creative marketing designs when needed.



Main Responsibilities

• Redraw and develop our mascot Raffie the chameleon in different poses and styles

• Fully illustrate and visualize our children’s books (in Canva or a similar creative app), including:

– educational reading books

– activity and mission books

– coloring books

• Create marketing and promotional designs such as:

– posters, banners, flyers

– social media visuals

– product designs (welcome boxes, stickers, cards, certificates)

• (Bonus) Create simple animations for illustrations or marketing content

• Assist in maintaining consistent branding, visual style, and storytelling

• Work proactively with our team despite time zone differences (CEST)



Required Skills (Non-Negotiable)

• Strong experience in digital illustration (Procreate, tablet, Adobe, etc.)

• Very confident using Canva or a similar creative program

• Fluent English (reading, speaking, understanding)

• Proactive, reliable, and able to take initiative

• Comfortable working independently and meeting deadlines

• Flexible schedule due to time zone differences



Big Pluses (Not required, but highly valued)

• Basic understanding of branding or willingness to learn

• Experience with visual storytelling for children

• Animation skills

• Experience creating visuals for marketing or ads



What We Offer

• A warm, creative, and positive long-term collaboration

• A chance to work with a growing international brand with big ambitions

• Opportunities to grow into creative leadership roles over time

• Flexible working hours and fully remote work

• Freedom to bring your own ideas and creative input

• Long-term partnership if we’re a good match



Who You Are

• You love color, fantasy, characters, and children’s books

• You’re the type of person who takes action and enjoys creating

• You’re excited to join a brand that is just starting to take off – with a very bright future ahead



Interested?

Send us your portfolio + a short introduction.

We’d love to meet you!

title: Team Leader - Remote Call Center Operations
description:
Location: Remote

Type: Contractor / Full-Time



About Us

GoGoGrandparent helps older adults and people with disabilities live more independently by connecting them to rides, groceries, prescriptions, and home services with a simple phone call. Our mission is to make everyday life easier, safer, and more accessible.



About the Role

We’re looking for a hands-on Team Leader to manage and coach a remote team of customer service operators. This role is both people-focused and performance-driven. You’ll be coaching calls, reviewing metrics, driving registrations, and maintaining high service quality while building a strong, engaged team.



What You’ll Do

--Lead and support a remote team of 20 to 25 operators

--Conduct regular 1:1s, call reviews, and coaching sessions

--Provide clear, actionable feedback focused on call quality, registrations, and customer experience

--Support underperforming operators through structured coaching plans

--Monitor and manage KPIs including registrations, QA scores, attendance, and adherence

--Identify trends and proactively address service or performance issues

--Ensure consistent service standards align with company values

--Communicate clearly and consistently via Slack and other tools

--Partner with Operations and Training on escalations, calibrations, and improvements

--Hold operators accountable to schedules, policies, and expectations

--Foster a respectful, engaged, and high-performing team culture



What We’re Looking For

REQUIRED:

--Experience as a Team Leader, Supervisor, or Manager in a call center or customer support setting

--Strong understanding of call coaching, QA, and performance metrics

--Excellent written and verbal communication skills

--At least 2 years of sales experience

--Comfortable giving direct, constructive feedback

--Highly organized and effective in a fully remote, fast-paced environment



What We Offer

--Fully remote work

--Opportunity to grow into senior leadership roles

--Meaningful work that directly impacts older adults’ lives

--Supportive, collaborative leadership team

--Team bonuses



How to Apply

Please submit:

--A 1 to 2 minute video recording introducing yourself and explaining why you’re a great fit for this role

--An updated resume



Please note: The use of AI-generated responses in your application will result in an automatic disqualification.

Professional / educational / personal-brand style videos



Clean, modern YouTube editing (not flashy or meme-style)



Responsibilities



Edit long-form YouTube videos from raw footage



Remove mistakes, pauses, filler words, and dead space



Improve pacing and flow for viewer retention



Add subtle zooms or movement when appropriate



Add clean, minimal text overlays when needed



Light background music when appropriate



Basic color correction and audio cleanup



Deliver final videos fully optimized for YouTube



Required Experience (Experienced Editors Only)

Have proven experience editing long-form YouTube videos



Understand pacing, flow, and retention



Be efficient and organized with your editing workflow



Be comfortable working as part of a long-term content team

Be reliable and deadline-driven

Clean, professional, and polished

Clear audio and balanced sound levels



Long-Term Expectations

Consistent weekly work

To grow with a YouTube channel long-term

Per video, paid weekly, or

title: Inside Sales - Team Member
description:
Evolve Egress & Exteriors is expanding our inside sales team! We’re looking for a motivated individual who thrives on the phone, enjoys connecting with people, and wants to be part of a company that rewards results. If you’re ready to jump in and start dialing by Day 2, this is your chance to make an immediate impact.



Why Evolve?



High-Earning Potential – Earn a competitive base plus 1% commission on every closed deal from the appointments you set.



Proven Success Formula – Our sales reps close at a high rate, giving you real potential to earn from day one.



Supportive Team Culture – Be part of a growing, 20-year-old company with a strong reputation in home services.



Clear Career Path – Learn, grow, and take on bigger opportunities within the company.



What You’ll Be Doing



Dial out to potential customers starting on Day 2–3 of training.



Engage homeowners by phone, text, and
 to set qualified appointments for our outside sales reps.



Manage and update lead data to ensure accuracy and follow-through.



Contribute directly to the growth of our sales pipeline.



What We’re Looking For



Experience in phone-based sales, appointment setting, or customer outreach.



Confidence and professionalism on the phone.



Ability to stay organized and handle multiple conversations daily.



A self-starter mentality — you bring the energy, we provide the system.



Compensation & Hours



Base pay + 1% commission on all sales from your appointments.



Hours: Wednesday–Sunday, 12 PM – 9 PM EST.



How to Apply



Record a quick 1–2 minute voice note telling us about your experience with phone sales and why you’d be a strong fit for our team.



Join Evolve Egress & Exteriors and help us connect with homeowners while building your own long-term earning potential.

title: Experienced Land Acquisitions & Dispo Manager
description:
We are a US-based real estate investment company looking for a long-term, full-time tea
mber to manage our land flipping operations in the state of Florida. 



We focus on high-volume deal flow and building relationships with home builders. We need someone who is detail-oriented, tech-savvy, and looking for a stable long-term career.



Required Tech Stack (Must Have Experience):



• 
 (Daily management of SMS campaigns)

• BuyerBridge.ai (Finding builders and managing buyer lists)

• 
 (For property data and due diligence)

• PropStream & Zillow (Market research)



Key Responsibilities:



• Lead Management: Respond to incoming seller leads on SmarterContact immediately. Filter motivation and negotiate price based on our buy-box formula.

• Builder Relations: Use BuyerBridge.ai to find builders pulling permits. Call/email them to get their specific buying criteria (Buy Box).

• Due Diligence: Perform rapid property checks using 
 and GIS maps. You must identify wetlands, flood zones, check utilities, and road access issues before we make an offer. Must know how to run comps and determine values quickly.

• Deal Matching: Connect our contracted properties directly to the builders who want them.

• Value Add: Identify properties with potential for subdividing, lot splits, or entitlement improvements.

Requirements:

• Experience: Minimum 2 years of proven experience in Land Acquisitions/Wholesaling.

• Market Knowledge: Familiarity with Florida markets is highly preferred. Experience with RV Parks or Manufactured Homes is a plus.

• Communication: Fluent English (Speaking and Writing). You will be on the phone with American builders and sellers.

• Reliability: We are looking for loyalty and consistency.

• Bonus: if you have experience with Notes/Seller Financing and negotiating these types of deals, we may incentivize you to create these opportunities.



How to Apply: Do not send a cover letter. Simply reply to this job post with the following:



1. How many years of experience do you have in Land acquisitions and dispositions?

2. Do you have experience with Smarter Contact or Launch Control?

3. List one specific Florida county or city you have worked in previously.

4. Are you comfortable calling Builders and building rapport on the phone? 

5. Can you quickly determine property values and run comps? 



Do not apply if you do not have a minimum of 2 years experience in the Land niche. 



Thank you and we look forward to reviewing your inquiries!

title: Full-Time Ecommerce Graphic Designer (with Growth Potential)
description:
We are a fast-growing 7-figure ecommerce brand seeking a top-tier Full-Time Graphic Designer to join our creative team. This role is perfect for someone who doesn't just "design graphics," but knows how to craft eye-catching, conversion-focused visuals that stop the scroll and drive sales.



If you're looking for a role where you can grow into full-time, earn bonuses, and have a long-term seat on a winning team — keep reading.



Responsibilities:



- Design high-performing static ads and creatives tailored for ecommerce 
, Instagram, TikTok, Pinterest, Google Display, etc.).



- Create compelling brand assets for our website including hero banners, product pages, landing pages, and promotional graphics.



- Develop engaging static ad creatives with attention-grabbing headlines, benefit-driven copy layouts, and scroll-stopping visuals.



- Source and incorporate imagery from platforms like Unsplash, Pexels, and across the internet — not just basic stock libraries.



- Constantly analyze ad libraries and tools like Atria/Foreplay to spot winning design formats and bring fresh concepts to the team for testing.



- Design cohesive brand systems including typography, color palettes, and visual guidelines that align with our brand identity.



- Analyze why certain ad designs work (or don't) and apply learnings to improve iterations and future creatives.



- Collaborate with the marketing team to test, iterate, and improve creative performance based on data and feedback.



- Stay up to date with trends in direct-to-consumer (DTC) design and social-first visual styles. Must be prepared to bring ideas to the table in terms of ad formats that resonate organically on target audiences' feeds, discovered through ad libraries and tools like Atria/Foreplay.



- Deliver clean, polished, professional work that drives results.



Requirements:



- 3–5 years of graphic design experience in ecommerce/DTC content (portfolio required).



- Advanced proficiency in major design tools, including:



Adobe Photoshop



Adobe Illustrator



Figma



Canva Pro



Adobe InDesign (or other top industry tools)



- Skilled in layout design, typography, color theory, and visual hierarchy.



- Proven ability to find and source unique imagery and design assets across the internet.



- Must have a strong foundation with AI tools to generate supporting imagery, backgrounds, and creative elements as needed on platforms such as Midjourney, DALL-E, Leonardo AI, Ideogram, Flux, etc.



- 100% fluent in English (a call with the founder will assess grammar and fluency; accents are fine).



- Strong sense of visual storytelling, brand consistency, and conversion-focused design principles.



- Excellent communication, responsiveness, and a true team player.



- Bonus: Copywriting experience or comfort working with ad copy and messaging hierarchy.



What We're Looking For:



- We are not looking for someone who just wants a paycheck. In the age of AI and quick shortcuts, it's easy to see when someone cuts corners. We want someone who takes pride in their craft, who is ambitious, and who wants to help us win at a high level.



- This role has the potential to transition into full-time with increased pay, bonuses, and long-term growth opportunities for the right candidate.



How to Apply:



If this sounds like you, apply with:



- Your portfolio of ecommerce design work (static ads, website designs, brand assets, product creatives).



- A brief explanation of why you're the right fit.



- Include the phrase "Long-Term Player" at the top of your application so we know you read this entire post.



Note: A paid trial task may be required for consideration for this role.

title: Chef's Assistant
description:
Job Title



Chef’s Assistant (Remote) – Culinary Background Required



About the Role



I run a growing personal chef and culinary services company in the U.S. This is not a generic VA role.



I’m looking for a chef or culinary professional who wants to step out of the kitchen heat and into the backend of a real food business — learning how menus, logistics, clients, and systems actually work.



You will work directly with me and support the day-to-day thinking of a working chef. If you want to grow, learn, and humble yourself to mastery, this role can evolve into something very valuable long-term.



If you want to “run things” or skip learning — this is not for you.



Who This Is For



? Culinary school graduate, line cook, prep cook, or kitchen manager

? Strong English (written + spoken)

? Highly organized and detail-oriented

? Comfortable taking direction and feedback

? Wants to learn food business systems, not just complete tasks

? Calm under pressure, not easily offended

? Long-term mindset



???? Not for ego-driven chefs

???? Not for generic virtual assistants

???? Not for people who “kind of like food”



Responsibilities



Build and organize grocery lists fro
nus



Review menus for duplicate ingredients or conflicts



Draft and organize client
s with food awareness



Assist with scheduling, task organization, and follow-ups



Make calls and send
s professionally



Organize recipes, menus, SOPs, and documents



Support day-to-day admin tasks with culinary context



Learn how a real chef business operates behind the scenes



Over time, you may help pre-draft menus, prep client communications, and assist with higher-level organization.



Requirements



Culinary background (school or professional kitchen experience)



Excellent written English



Comfortable using Google Docs, Sheets,
, and basic tools



Reliable internet and quiet workspace



Willing to learn and grow



Able to follow instructions precisely



Schedule & Pay



Part-time to start (20–30 hours/week)



Fully remote



Pay based on experience (discussed during interview)



Long-term opportunity for the right person



How to Apply (IMPORTANT)



To apply, include all three of the following:



A short introduction about your culinary background



Why this role interests you outside of money



The word “MIREPOIX” somewhere in your message (so I know you read this)



Applications that don’t follow instructions will be ignored.



Final Note



This role is for someone who wants to learn, grow, and earn trust over time.

If you’re looking for a shortcut, this isn’t it.



If you want proximity to real experience — welcome.

title: Property Operaitons Coordinator
description:
Remote Property Operations Coordinator (AU Short-Term Rentals)

Philippines-based | Full-time | AEST-aligned



Join One of Australia’s Largest Short-Term Rental Businesses



This is a rare long-term opportunity to work directly with one of Australia’s most established short-term rental operators — supporting a growing portfolio of up to 800 properties across NSW.



Staff Connect Australia is building a high-performing offshore team, and we’re looking for a proactive, detail-driven Property Operations Coordinator to become one of our foundational hires. If you’re sharp, confident on calls, and love problem-solving in a fast-paced environment, this role has serious growth potential.



You’ll be right at the heart of daily operations — handling bookings, guest and owner communications, issue resolution, and admin support — with exposure to every part of Australian short-term rental management.



What You’ll Be Doing



This is a hands-on, dynamic role. Your responsibilities will include:

- Guest & Owner Support

- Handle inbound and outbound calls with guests and property owners via Aircall

- Respond to enquiries and issues via Airbnb, 
, direct bookings

- Resolve problems efficiently and follow through to completion





Operations & Coordination

- Monitor bookings, availability, and calendars using Homhero, RMS, and other systems

- Coordinate cleaning schedules and ensure properties are guest-ready

- Assign and follow up maintenance tasks with trades or contractors

- Track cleans, maintenance, guest issues, and owner communications



Admin, Reporting & Growth

- Manage booking calendars, pricing, and blackout dates

- Assist with onboarding new properties and system setup

- Support compliance documentation (smoke alarms, council registration, etc.)

- Prepare weekly/monthly reports using spreadsheets or dashboards

- Help draft and improve SOPs, internal docs, and guest manuals

- Identify workflow gaps and suggest smarter processes or automations



As the business grows, your role will grow with it — including pricing, owner reporting, SOP ownership, and broader operational oversight.



Who We’re Looking For



You’re someone who:

- Is confident on the phone and professional with both guests and property owners

- Thrives in fast-paced, customer-facing environments

- Is organised, proactive, and solutions-focused

- Can juggle multiple tools and tasks without being micromanaged

- Takes ownership and actually cares about doing things properly



Skills & Experience



Required:

- Excellent spoken & written English

- Stable internet connection

- Confident handling phone calls

- Experience (or fast learning ability) with Aircall, Homhero

- Familiarity with Airbnb, 
, and direct booking sites

- Strong organisational & multitasking skills

- Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook)



Preferred (but not mandatory)



- 2+ years in short-term rentals, property management, or admin support

- Experience working with Australian clients

- Exposure to cleaning teams or remote contractors



We’re open to candidates with less experience if you show initiative, strong communication skills, and the right mindset.



Tools You’ll Use

Core Systems:

- Homhero, RMS, Breezeway, Orana

- Comms & Support:

- Aircall, Slack, Zoom, MS Teams, Google Meet, WhatsApp

- Automation & Docs:

- ChatGPT, Zapier, Google Docs, Canva, Microsoft Office, WordPress



Bonus Tools:

- PriceLabs or other pricing platforms





What You’ll Get:



- Full-time role – 40 hrs/week (AEST-aligned)

- Structured roster – 7-day operation with rotating shifts

- You’ll work one or both weekend days

- Always two consecutive days off each week

- Paid training & onboarding

- Direct mentorship from leadership

- Long-term career growth in a scaling business

- Exposure to end-to-end Australian STR operations



A role where initiative, ownership, and ideas are genuinely valued

title: Photoshop Graphic Artist-Vehicle Wrap
description:

Project Type: One-time project (with potential future work)

Industry: Automotive / Vehicle Wrap / Large-Format Print

Location: Remote

I’m looking for a skilled graphic artist with strong Photoshop and large-format print experience to help refine and prepare a high-detail dragon illustration for a Jeep vehicle wrap / decal.

The concept artwork already exists (AI-generated dragon placed on a Jeep mockup). The goal is not to vectorize or simplify it, but to enhance, refine, and prepare a wrap-ready, ultra-high-resolution raster file suitable for professional vinyl printing.

Prepare artwork specifically for vehicle wrap printing

Designed for 150–300 DPI at final print size

Smooth gradients, no posterization

NO auto-vectoring, NO Illustrator image trace

Illustrator may only be used for optional cut paths (if needed)

? Ideal Experience

Vehicle wrap or large-format print design

Advanced Adobe Photoshop

Understanding of vinyl wrap constraints (scale, seams, viewing distance)

Experience delivering print-ready files to wrap or sign shops

Your estimated cost and timeline

Any questions you have before starting

This project may lead to additional wrap, branding, or illustration work.

title: Marketing Manager
description:
This Marketing Manager Job Description (JD) template is designed to be comprehensive and modern (updated for 2025/2026 trends). It includes standard responsibilities as well as modern requirements like data fluency and AI tool proficiency.



You can copy and paste this directly, filling in the [bracketed sections] with your specific company details.

Job Description: Marketing Manager



Location: [e.g., Remote, Hybrid, New York, NY] Job Type: [e.g., Full-time, Contract] Reports To: [e.g., VP of Marketing, CMO] Salary Range: [e.g., $90,000 - $120,000 / year]

About [Company Name]



[Insert a 2-3 sentence "hook" about your company. Mention your mission, culture, and why people love working there. Example: "At [Company Name], we are revolutionizing the [Industry] space by building tools that help small businesses scale. We are a fast-paced, data-driven team that values creativity, autonomy, and genuine collaboration."]

The Role



We are looking for an experienced and strategic Marketing Manager to lead our marketing efforts and drive measurable growth. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and executing multi-channel marketing strategies that increase brand awareness, generate qualified leads, and support revenue goals.



You are a "T-shaped" marketer—capable of seeing the big strategic picture while also being comfortable diving into the data, managing campaigns, and optimizing performance. You are tech-savvy, familiar with modern marketing automation, and excited to leverage new tools (including AI) to multiply your impact.

Key Responsibilities



    Strategy & Planning: Develop and execute comprehensive marketing plans (quarterly and annual) that align with company business objectives and revenue targets.



    Campaign Management: Oversee end-to-end execution of marketing campaigns across multiple channels, including
, social media, SEO/SEM, content marketing, and events.



    Lead Generation (Growth): Partner with Sales to define lead quality and drive demand generation strategies that feed the sales pipeline.



    Content & Brand: Ensure all messaging and creative assets align with brand guidelines. Oversee the content calendar (blogs, whitepapers, case studies) to ensure a steady stream of high-quality material.



    Data & Analytics: Monitor and report on Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) such as CAC (Customer Acquisition Cost), ROI, and conversion rates. Use data to pivot strategies and optimize budgets.



    Team & Vendor Management: [Optional: Manage a team of X associates] and coordinate with external agencies, freelancers, and vendors to ensure timely delivery of projects.



    Market Research: Stay ahead of industry trends and competitor activities to identify new opportunities for growth.



Qualifications & Skills



    Experience: 4+ years of proven experience in marketing, preferably in the [Your Industry, e.g., SaaS, Retail, B2B] sector.



    Education: Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, or relevant practical experience.



    Digital Fluency: Strong working knowledge of digital marketing tools. Experience with CRMs (e.g., HubSpot, Salesforce), Analytics (GA4), and Ad platforms (Google Ads, LinkedIn, Meta) is essential.



    Data-Driven: Ability to interpret data and translate it into actionable insights. You don't just report numbers; you explain why they matter.



    Communication: Exceptional written and verbal communication skills. You can write compelling copy and present clear strategies to leadership.



    Project Management: Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously under tight deadlines.



    Tech-Forward: Familiarity with AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Jasper, Midjourney) for content ideation and productivity is a plus.

title: Amazon FBA OA VA - Tactical Arbitrage Expert
description:
We are hiring an A-player Amazon FBA Online Arbitrage Virtual Assistant.

This role is for someone who is already strong in Tactical Arbitrage and can also keep our sourcing organized in a clean Google Sheets tracker. This is long term work. We do not want a beginner or someone still learning TA.

Primary responsibilities

1. Tactical Arbitrage sourcing (core)

• Run Tactical Arbitrage searches (Product Search, Reverse Search, Bulk as needed)

• Build and maintain strong search setups and store lists

• Pull leads and validate properly using Keepa (required) and SellerAmp (preferred)

• Provide decision-ready notes, not just ASIN links

2. Sourcing tracking and operations (core)

• Update a Google Sheets sourcing tracker daily

• Track leads and buys end to end: Found, Approved, Ordered, Received, Prep, Sent to Amazon, Hold, Pass

• Keep the sheet clean so approvals and reorders are fast and simple

Rules and expectations

• OA focused, mostly FBA

• Minimum ROI 25% and minimum net profit $3 per unit

• Strong demand items preferred

• Hard no: hazmat and batteries

• Accurate notes and consistent tracking are required

Tools required

• Tactical Arbitrage (expert level)

• Keepa

• Google Sheets

Preferred

• SellerAmp

• Amazon Seller Central familiarity

Requirements

• Proven experience doing OA product research for US Amazon sellers

• Strong Keepa analysis skills (real process, not surface level)

• Organized, consistent, and dependable

• Stable internet connection

Schedule and pay

• Flexible schedule, output matters more than clock time

• Bi-weekly payment

• Part time to start, potential to increase hours for the right person

To apply, include the following in your response

1. Your Tactical Arbitrage experience (how long, what modules you use most, and your workflow)

2. Your Keepa validation checklist (6 to 10 bullets)

3. A sample of how you format leads in Google Sheets (you can describe columns, or share a screenshot with sensitive info blurred)

4. Your hourly rate and weekly availability

5. Your favorite category to source and why

6. Personal question (to confirm you read this): What is the second word in the job title you are applying for?

title: Virtual Assistant (Accounting & Admin Focus)
description:
About the Role



We are looking for a detail-oriented Virtual Assistant who loves working with numbers, is confident in Excel, and has a background in accounting. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys structured work, accuracy, and supporting a business through both financial and administrative tasks.



You will also handle general virtual assistant responsibilities such as calendar and
 management, making this a well-rounded support role.

- Accounting & Numbers (Primary Focus):

- Creating and maintaining Excel spreadsheets

- Tracking expenses, invoices, and payments

- Generating simple financial reports as required



General VA Tasks

- Calendar management and scheduling

-
 management and inbox organisation

- Data entry and document management

- Online research and basic reporting

- Admin tasks to support daily operations



Required Skills & Experience

- Background in Accounting, Bookkeeping, or Finance

- Strong Excel skills (formulas, spreadsheets, data tracking)

- Comfortable working with numbers and calculations

- High attention to detail and accuracy

- Strong written and verbal English communication skills

- Reliable internet connection and quiet workspace



What We’re Looking For

- Someone who genuinely enjoys math and working with numbers

- Organised, proactive, and able to work independently

- Trustworthy and confidential with financial information

- Willing to learn and adapt to new systems and processes



What We Offer

- Long-term opportunity with stable hours

- Supportive management and clear processes

- Ongoing training and guidance

- Opportunity to grow within the role



Rate

- AUD $5.00 per hour (starting rate)

- AUD $6.00 per hour after 1 month, based on performance and consistency



How to Apply

Please send your resume and a brief video introduction highlighting:

- Your accounting or bookkeeping background

- Your experience with Excel

- Your availability and preferred working hours

title: Commercial Roofing Estimator / Estimate Writer
description:
About the Role



We are hiring an experienced Commercial Roofing Estimator / Estimate Writer with 2+ years of commercial roofing estimating experience (more is preferred).

This is a critical role that supports our Sales and Project Management teams by preparing accurate, detailed, and professional estimates for commercial roofing projects.



You must have hands-on experience estimating commercial roof systems, not just residential. Applicants without commercial roofing estimating experience will not be considered.



Key Responsibilities



* Prepare accurate commercial roofing estimates based on inspection notes, videos, takeoffs, and project details

* Identify appropriate materials, labor requirements, and system components for each project

* Produce professional, client-ready proposals using our templates

* Break down scopes clearly (materials, labor, warranties, options)

* Conduct roof takeoff reviews and verify quantities

* Track estimate versions and revisions

* Communicate with the team when information is missing or unclear

* Deliver estimates within required timelines

* Maintain accuracy, clarity, and consistency on all bids



Required Qualifications



? 2+ years (or more) of commercial roofing estimating experience

? Ability to provide real samples of past estimates you created

? Strong knowledge of commercial roofing systems:

?• TPO / PVC

?• EPDM

?• Torch down

?• Coatings

?• Metal systems

? Understanding of U.S. roofing materials and terminology

? Excellent written and spoken English

? High accuracy with measurements, takeoffs, and pricing breakdowns

? Ability to follow detailed scope templates and brand standards

? Strong attention to detail and consistency



Preferred (Not Required)



* Experience with JobNimbus

* Experience with other roofing CRMs or estimating tools

* Experience with EagleView, CompanyCam, RoofSnap, or similar platforms

* Residential roofing estimating experience

* Familiarity with Washington State roofing practices (training provided)



What We’re Looking For



* Someone reliable, detail-oriented, and accurate

* Someone who communicates clearly and professionally

* Someone who meets deadlines and works efficiently

* Someone who wants a long-term role with growth opportunities

* Someone who can work U.S. daytime or mid-shift hours



Applicants without commercial roofing estimating experience will not be considered.

title: Administrative assistant
description:
We are a U.S.-based neuropsychology private practice seeking a reliable virtual administrative assistant to support our office. This role involves direct communication with patients who may be experiencing mental health concerns; however, we are NOT a crisis center. Professionalism, kindness, patience, and respect are essential at ALL times.



Key Responsibilities:

 • Answer incoming phone calls professionally and compassionately

 • Schedule and manage patient appointments

 • Enter and update patient information accurately

 • Provide clear, respectful, and patient-centered communication

 • Follow all privacy and confidentiality requirements (HIPAA)



Requirements:

 • Fluent spoken and written English (required)

 • Professional phone presence and strong communication skills

 • Calm, patient, and empathetic demeanor

 • Strong attention to detail and organizational skills. Strong computer skills are very important. 

 • Ability to handle sensitive information confidentially

The office is not very busy so approximately answering at most 3 brief calls a day.

title: Virtual Executive Assistant
description:
Part-Time Virtual Executive Assistant



About the Company:

?We are a boutique consultancy supporting Venture Capital and Growth Equity firms with high-touch, thoughtfully executed events and programming. Our team partners closely with investors and operators, bringing structure, discretion, and excellence to everything we do.



Role Overview?:

We are seeking a highly organized, proactive Virtual Executive Assistant to provide part-time scheduling and calendar management support. This role is ideal for someone who thrives on keeping leaders organized, anticipates needs, and enjoys working behind the scenes to keep things running smoothly. Over time, this role has the potential to grow into broader administrative and operational responsibilities.



Key Responsibilities:

- Manage calendars and scheduling across multiple stakeholders, including coordinating internal and external meetings

- Handle meeting logistics (confirmations, reschedules, time zone coordination, Zoom links, etc.)

- Maintain accurate, up-to-date calendars and ensure priorities are clearly reflected

- Flag conflicts, tight turnarounds, or potential issues proactively

- Support ad hoc administrative tasks as needed, with opportunity to take on additional responsibilities over time



Qualifications:

- Prior experience as an Executive Assistant, Administrative Assistant, or similar role

- Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail

- Strong written communication and professional judgment

- Comfortable working with senior executives and external partners

- Proficient with Google Calendar, Gmail, and video conferencing tools

- Ability to manage shifting priorities in a fast-paced environment

- Honesty, discretion, reliability, and a high degree of professionalism



Role Details:

- Part-time, virtual/remote

- Flexible hours with some responsiveness during standard Eastern Time Zone (ET) business hours

- Opportunity for increased responsibility and scope as the role evolves



Why This Role:

?This is a great opportunity for someone looking for a flexible, part-time role with a growing consultancy, exposure to the venture and growth equity ecosystem, and the chance to expand responsibilities over time.

title: Client Coach (Giving Feedback): $1,100 USD START RATE
description:
Start rate: $935 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,100 a month)



Paid twice per month via Wise.



ABOUT US







Young Publisher is an international digital marketing company working with content creators and online brands.



BENEFITS



- Full-time position: 8 hours daily, Monday-Friday; 40 hours a week

- Flexible schedule: Choose your own hours, as long as you show up for the daily meeting (MANDATORY)

- Stable income: Long-term role with regular, on-time payments

- Supportive team: Collaborative environment without micromanagement

- Growth path: Opportunities to increase responsibilities and earnings

- 100% remote: Work-from-home setup



TASKS



Client Support (maintaining 40-50 total clients):



- Run kickoff calls with new clients using our proven script

- Review client content and give actionable feedback

- Answer client messages within 24 hours

- Host weekly group calls and 1-on-1 coaching sessions

- Help clients overcome content blocks and limiting beliefs



Progress Tracking:



- Update daily/weekly reports

- Track client progress and next steps

- Join daily team check-ins

- Ensure clients follow strategies consistently



REQUIREMENTS (MUST-HAVE)



- C1+ English (written and spoken) with no accent

- Strong communication skills

- Organized and detail-oriented

- Reliable internet and a quiet workspace

- Accountability mindset and deadline commitment



IMPORTANT



When recording a Loom video as part of your application:



- Camera must show your FACE & SCREEN

- Treat it as a LIVE interview with the Hiring Manager

- Have a professional background

- Have clear audio

- Wear business-casual attire



BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED)



- Content creation and social media experience

- Knowledge of Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts

- Regular usage of AI tools (ChatGPT, CapCut)



WHY JOIN US?



- Start rate: $935 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,100 a month)

- Client retention rates

- Task completion metrics

- Quality of feedback

- Team collaboration

#5: Your portfolio.



Note: Messages that do not follow this format will NOT be reviewed.

Young Publisher is an international digital marketing company working with content creators and online brands.

title: VSL VIDEO EDITOR: PHP 100,000/MONTH + bonuses
description:
THE OPPORTUNITY YOU'VE BEEN WAITING FOR



Work Hours: Full-time, 7.5 hours/day | Monday to Friday | 8 AM - 5:00 PM (Filipino Time)



This is NOT your average video editing job.



We're looking for a Video Editing SPECIALIST who can transform ordinary content into money-making machines. If you can create videos that make viewers stop scrolling, click, and ultimately BUY – we want YOU on our team.



WHAT YOU'LL CREATE:



- High-converting Video Sales Letters (VSLs) that turn viewers into customers

- Scroll-stopping social media ads that outperform the competition

- Attention-grabbing hooks that keep viewers watching until the very end

- Storytelling masterpieces that connect emotionally and drive action



IS THIS YOU?



- You have a portfolio that showcases your video editing expertise

- You understand that great editing isn't just about technical skills—it's about PSYCHOLOGY

- You're obsessed with creating videos that not only look good but actually CONVERT

- You can take feedback and continuously refine your work until it's perfect

- You're reliable, motivated, and ready to join a fast-growing international team

title: Senior Affiliate & Influencer Marketing Manager 5 years experience
description:
About Legend Sports & Razzaque

At Legend Sports, we’re building a powerhouse in the sports and active lifestyle market. We believe in the power of creators, affiliates, and influencers to connect with audiences authentically—and we’re looking for a top-tier performer to take our affiliate and UGC marketing systems to the next level.

At Razzaque Paradise Properties we are developing High End Residences in Kuta Lombok where we looking for UGC and affiliates.



The Role

We’re seeking a Senior Affiliate & Influencer Marketing Manager who thrives in fast-moving e-commerce and sports/lifestyle industries en Real Estate. The ideal candidate will design and manage scalable systems for affiliate partnerships, influencer collaborations, and UGC campaigns, with a laser focus on traction, conversions, and ROI. You shouldn have at least 4 years experience in this job role, if you dont do not respond!



This is not a “plug-and-play” role—we’re looking for a strategic builder who can identify gaps, implement solutions, and execute campaigns that directly drive sales growth and brand presence.



Key Responsibilities

• Develop and scale affiliate & UGC pipelines that are sustainable and performance-driven

• Manage outreach to hundreds of potential creators weekly, securing high-quality partnerships

• Onboard and nurture affiliates to ensure ongoing alignment and results

• Oversee content creation, approvals, and feedback loops to maintain brand quality and consistency

• Troubleshoot common pain points, such as:

• Ghosted or inactive creators

• Delayed product delivery and fulfillment issues

• Low-performing or misaligned content



Tools & Platforms You’ll Work With

• Affiliate management platforms (e.g., Levanta, Social Snowball, etc.)

• Creator marketplaces and influencer platforms (e.g., TikTok Creator Marketplace, Amazon Affiliates)

• E-commerce platforms (e.g., Shopify)

• Performance tracking and analytics tools



What We’re Looking For

• Proven experience running affiliate, influencer, and UGC campaigns in e-commerce (sports or lifestyle industry a plus)

• Ability to manage 100+ creator relationships while maintaining brand quality

• Strong operational mindset—able to systemize processes and scale campaigns efficiently

• Self-starter with excellent communication and relationship-building skills

• Results-oriented, with a track record of delivering measurable growth



What Success Looks Like

• Building a high-converting affiliate & UGC system that delivers consistent traction

• Driving weekly onboarding of new affiliates and creators

• Successfully scaling campaigns without sacrificing quality

• Directly contributing to sales growth, visibility, and brand presence



Why Join Legend Sports?

At Legend Sports, you’ll have the opportunity to lead influencer and affiliate marketing at scale, working with a brand that’s ready for growth. We’re looking for someone who’s not just managing campaigns—but building systems that last.



If you’re ready to deliver traction, systems, and conversions through creators and affiliates, we’d love to hear from you. Leave a response with BloodyUGC

title: Social Media Manager -  B2B Executive - IG + LinkedIn
description:
Social Media Manager (SMM) - Social Graph & Executive Support VA



Instagram + LinkedIn (Business Use Only)

Remote | Philippines | Full-Time (38 hrs/ per week)



---

ROLE PURPOSE



You will support an American B2B tech founder living abroad by:



Building a clean, professional social graph on Instagram



Supporting founder visibility and authority (business only)



Quietly removing friction from the founder’s personal life through light executive assistant tasks





This role exists to:



Protect reputation, create continuity, and reduce mental load.



This is not an influencer role.

This is not a dating role.

This is not a creative role.

----

CONTEXT YOU MUST UNDERSTAND



You will manage a personal Instagram account used strictly for business positioning.



Target audiences include:



Founders & entrepreneurs



Tech / startup professionals



US & EU expats in Asia



Fitness & wellness communities



High-end coworking spaces & cafés



Regions of focus:



Manila (BGC, Makati, Ortigas)



Bangkok



Singapore



Cebu



Vietnam expat hubs



Everything must feel:



Normal



Classy



Professional



Non-desperate



Non-creepy



----



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES — SOCIAL GRAPH MANAGEMENT

Daily (Monday–Saturday)



Discover 20 relevant profiles/day



Log profile link, category, region



Engage conservatively:



Max 10 likes/day



Max 3 professional comments/day



0 DMs (unless replying to inbound)



Follow max 5 profiles/day



Log all actions in Google Sheets or Notion



Weekly



Audit follower quality (not quantity)



Remove bots or low-quality accounts



Identify aspirational professional accounts



Track local events, gyms, coworking spaces



Collect content ideas and environmental assets (no posting)



-----

NON-NEGOTIABLE RULES (VIOLATION = TERMINATION)



NEVER DM women proactively



NEVER comment on women’s photos



NEVER like women’s photos



NO flirting or dating behavior



NO private account following first



NO mass follow/unfollow behavior



NO emoji spam



NO automation tools



BLOCK immediately any fake, spam, TS, or explicit accounts



Everything must be logged



This role requires mature boundaries.



------

ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITY — FOUNDER / EXECUTIVE PERSONAL ASSISTANT (CONVENIENCE ONLY)



In addition to social graph work, you will provide light executive personal assistant support focused purely on convenience, continuity, and operational cleanliness.



This is not emotional support.

This is not decision-making.

This is not companionship.



Objective



Remove friction from the founder’s personal life so focus stays on:



Business execution



Fitness



Consistency



Examples of Allowed Tasks



Scheduling or rescheduling:



Appointments



Fitness sessions



Coworking visits



Calendar hygiene and reminders



Research gyms, Muay Thai gyms, CrossFit boxes



Research coworking spaces, cafés, quiet work locations



Identify relevant events or professional communities



Organize personal documents, links, and folders



Maintain personal trackers and reminders



Light travel research (no booking unless instructed)



Track preferences to avoid repeating context



--

Strict Boundaries



You must never:



Give life advice



Offer opinions on relationships



Engage emotionally



Ask personal questions without instruction



Act as a friend or conversational partner



Make decisions independently



This is operational support only.



-----



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS



You must have:



Experience managing Instagram or LinkedIn professionally



Strong understanding of Western business culture



Excellent written English



High attention to detail



Comfort following strict rules without improvising



Strong judgment and discretion



Bonus (Not Required)



B2B, tech, or startup exposure



Experience supporting founders or executives



----

READ THIS LASTLY (IMPORTANT)



This is NOT a typical social media VA job.



There is:



? No posting



? No DM outreach



? No flirting



? No influencer behavior



? No automation tools



? No “growth hacks”



This role requires discipline, judgment, restraint, and professionalism.



If you prefer:



Clear rules



Structured work



High standards



Quiet execution



You may be a strong fit.





----



WHO SHOULD NOT APPLY



Do not apply if you:



Want creative freedom



Enjoy chatting or DM-ing



Prefer loose instructions



Like influencer culture



Are uncomfortable with boundaries



Want fast “growth hacks”



This role values precision over personality.

---



COMPENSATION



Competitive PH-based monthly rate



Full-time, long-term role



Stable, low-drama environment



Clear expectations, no micromanagement

----



HOW TO APPLY (IMPORTANT)



When applying, include:



Short introduction



Your experience managing IG or LinkedIn (professional use only)

title: Senior Growth & Revenue Expert – Scaling Payments & Conversions
description:
I am looking for a senior growth and revenue expert who can significantly increase the number of successful payments and overall revenue of my business. The objective of this role is very clear: more conversions, more completed payments, and scalable growth.



This is not a general marketing role and not a position for juniors. I am only interested in working with experts who have already operated at a high level and who have experience with large or well-established companies. If you have not worked with serious businesses or high-volume environments, this role is not a fit.



The person I am looking for fully understands the complete flow of an online business: from traffic and first impression, to website structure, messaging, user behavior, checkout flow, and payment completion. You must be able to analyze my website and funnels in detail and clearly explain what needs to change to increase conversion rates and reduce drop-offs during the payment process.



I expect you to be able to look at my business objectively and say exactly where money is being lost, why users are not converting at maximum potential, and what concrete steps are required to fix this. This includes improvements in UX, CRO, funnels, and payment optimization. The focus is not theory, but real, measurable impact on revenue.



I want to work with someone who thinks strategically, communicates directly, and is focused on results. Someone who understands how scaling works at a professional level and who can contribute insights that actually move the business forward.



This role is intended for experts only. I am not interested in experiments, generic advice, or surface-level marketing tactics. I am looking for proven experience and clear value.



Social proof is required.

When applying, you must clearly show:

Companies or brands you have worked with (preferably well-known or high-revenue businesses)

Concrete results you have achieved (growth, conversion increases, revenue impact)

Any relevant case studies, portfolios, or references



Compensation will be aligned with expertise and results, and a long-term collaboration is possible for the right person.

If you are an experienced growth professional who knows how to increase payments, optimize conversion flows, and scale online businesses, you are invited to apply.

title: Researcher & Content Creator — “Relocate to Dubai”
description:
Summary:

We’re launching a practical “Relocate to Dubai” resource hub and need a self-starter to research, organise, and turn insights into clear blog posts (with AI tools) and curated video embeds.



What you’ll do

 • Research end-to-end relocation topics for employment and self-employment routes: visas, work permits, business setup/licensing (free zones vs mainland), banking, taxes, insurance, housing areas, cost of living, schools, healthcare, transport, driving licences, SIM/banking setup, cultural norms, and settling-in checklists.

 • Produce concise, accurate write-ups using AI (we’ll guide tone) and structure them into SEO-friendly blog posts for our new site.

 • Curate helpful YouTube videos for each topic and provide embed links + short annotations.

 • Create simple comparison tables, step-by-step checklists, and resource lists (official links, fees, timelines).

 • Track sources and changes (basic fact-checking; date all guidance).



What you’ll need

 • Proven research chops and ability to work independently to deadlines.

 • Strong writing/editing skills; comfortable prompting AI to draft and then refining for accuracy and clarity.

 • Basic SEO hygiene (keywords, headings, internal links, meta).

 • Excellent organisation: spreadsheets/Notion/Docs to manage topics, sources, and status.

 • Bonus: experience with UAE/Dubai relocation, company formation, or immigration content.



Contract

 • Initial term: 1 month (project-based milestones).

 • Extension: Ongoing for the right candidate.

 • Location: Remote

title: Executive Assistant (Operations & Technical Support)
description:
We’re looking for a highly capable Executive Assistant who thrives at the intersection of leadership, support, and technology. This role goes beyond traditional admin work. You’ll be a trusted right hand to the executive team while also supporting technical operations, particularly within Shopify and related tools.



Company Description:

RPM Pickleball was founded by a team of athletes, engineers, and relentless competitors obsessed with pushing the limits of performance. Frustrated by gear that couldn’t keep up, we built what we wished existed: pro-level paddles forged from cutting-edge materials, shaped by science, and tested by the best. Our founders aren’t just product designers—they’re innovators on a mission to give players everywhere the edge they deserve. At RPM, we sell pickleball paddles and a limited line of apparel. We seek to expand both departments as we grow bigger.



Key Responsibilities 

- Executive & Administrative Support

- Manage calendars, scheduling, inboxes, and meeting coordination

- Prepare agendas, notes, reports, and follow-ups

- Handle confidential information with discretion and professionalism

- Act as a key point of contact between executives and clients



Technical & Operational Support

- Manage and maintain Shopify backend (products, collections, pages, basic theme edits)

- Coordinate with developers, designers, and contractors as needed

- Troubleshoot basic Shopify issues and platform integrations

- Support workflows, documentation, and process improvements

- Assist with data tracking, reporting, and tool setup



Light Coding & Systems Work (Flexible)

- Make minor HTML/CSS edits (Shopify themes, landing pages,
s, etc.)

- Understand basic JavaScript or Liquid enough to communicate effectively with developers

- Work comfortably with no-code/low-code tools, automations, and integrations



Qualifications

- Proven experience as an Executive Assistant or similar role supporting senior leadership

- Strong working knowledge of Shopify (hands-on experience required)

- Light coding experience 

- Highly organized with excellent time management skills

- Tech-savvy, curious, and quick to learn new tools

- Strong written and verbal communication skills

- Should have a flexible schedule able to accommodate differing time zones



Nice to Have

- Experience in e-commerce, startups, or fast-paced environments

- Familiarity with tools like Notion, Slack, Google Workspace, or similar

- Experience documenting processes or improving operational systems



Why You’ll Love This Role

- High level of trust and autonomy

- Direct impact on business operations and leadership efficiency

- Opportunity to blend executive support with technical and operational work

- Collaborative, forward-thinking environment



How to Apply



Please submit your resume and a brief note explaining your experience with Shopify and any technical or coding work you’ve done.

title: Home Support Worker Manager
description:
Position: Home Support Worker Manager (Domestic Assistance – Aged Care)

Location: Work From Home (Australia)

Hours: Full-time, Monday–Friday, 9:00am–5:00pm (AEST)





 - Why This Role Matters -

At Maid My Day, we believe that how we care for our workers determines how well they care for our clients.



Our Home Support Workers are the heart of our business. They support older Australians to live independently, with dignity, safety, and pride in their homes. Your role is to ensure those workers feel supported, guided, valued, and held to clear standards from day one — and every day after.

This is not a reactive HR role.

It’s a relationship-driven leadership role.



If you love helping people succeed, enjoy setting clear expectations, and take pride in building reliable, long-term teams — keep reading.



 - About Maid My Day - 

Maid My Day is a trusted provider of Domestic Assistance services within the Australian Aged Care sector, operating across Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Canberra, and South Australia.

With over 20 years of experience and a growing workforce of 200+ Home Support Workers, our mission is simple:



Deliver consistent, high-quality care for older Australians

Create meaningful, stable employment pathways for our workers

Build partnerships that last





 - About the Role - 

As the Home Support Worker Manager, you are responsible for what happens after recruitment.



Your focus is to:

Support Home Support Workers as they transition into real-world work

Guide them through training milestones and expectations

Build trust early, address issues quickly, and reinforce what “great” looks like

Help our best people grow into long-term careers - including opportunities with our Aged Care partners



You’ll work closely with:

Our internal leadership team

A team of Virtual Assistants based in the Philippines

Employment consultants and external partners

This role requires empathy with backbone -  you care deeply, communicate clearly, and follow through consistently.



What You’ll Be Responsible For

Supporting Home Support Workers through their early weeks and ongoing employment journey

Ensuring every worker understands expectations, standards, and training milestones

Monitoring performance and addressing issues early, calmly, and professionally

Coaching workers toward “Ideal Employee” status through feedback and encouragement

Preparing high-performing workers for opportunities with our Aged Care partners

Collaborating with employment consultants to ensure progress, compliance, and accountability

Helping refine systems and processes that improve worker retention and performance over time



- What We’re Looking For -

You’ll thrive in this role if you:

Have 3+ years’ experience managing field-based or remote teams

Are naturally supportive but comfortable having firm, respectful conversations

Believe consistency builds trust

Are organised, proactive, and follow through on commitments

Take ownership of outcomes and KPIs

Enjoy being part of a close-knit, values-driven team



Highly regarded experience:

Aged Care, Domestic Assistance, or service-based environments

Google Workspace, Microsoft Outlook, or similar cloud tools





- What We Offer -

A stable, values-led organisation with clear expectations

Full-time, work-from-home role with fixed hours

A supportive leadership team that cares about doing things well

Opportunities to grow with the business and shape how we support our workforce



- How to Apply -

If you’re excited by the idea of supporting people properly, setting clear standards, and building a workforce you’re proud of, we’d love to hear from you.

Please
 Chelle at 
 with:

 - Subject line: Application for HSW Manager

 - Your resume

 - A short note on why this role resonates with you

title: Graphic Designer Assistant
description:
Urgent Hiring: Graphic Designer Assistant



We're looking for a Graphic Designer Assistant to support our creative team in building polished, visually engaging pitch decks and presentations.



Location: Alabang, Muntinlupa

Work Setup: Hybrid (3 days onsite, 2 days remote)



What you’ll do:

- Support the Lead Graphic Designer on pitch and new business presentations

- Design and format slides using brand guidelines

- Create icons, infographics, charts, and visual assets

- Adapt templates for different clients and industries

- Assist with last-minute edits and presentation-ready decks



What we’re looking for:

- 1–3 years of experience in graphic/visual design (agency experience is a plus)

- Strong PowerPoint and/or Keynote skills (essential)

- Working knowledge of Adobe Illustrator, InDesign, and Photoshop

- Strong eye for layout, typography, and visual storytelling

- Detail-oriented and comfortable working under tight deadlines



To apply, send your CV to 
 with the subject heading "Graphic Designer Assistant: Manila (NAME)". Don't forget to tell us why you're the perfect fit for this role!

title: Day trader
description:
I am currently seeking an experienced and disciplined trader to manage prop firm accounts. The ideal candidate should have a proven track record, strong risk management skills, and consistency in execution.



This is a profit-sharing opportunity where the trader will receive a percentage of the profits generated from the account. All trading must follow the prop firm’s rules and risk parameters.



If you are a serious trader with a professional approach and are interested in a long-term collaboration, please reach out with details about your experience and trading strategy.

title: AI Image Generation VA – Luxury Jewelry Brand Images

This is not a beginner role — experience with AI image tools is required.



Example of our current style and quality:





Key Responsibilities



Generate AI model images for jewelry products



Ensure images match our existing branding and luxury look



Place jewelry naturally and realistically on models



Follow SOPs, prompts, and visual guidelines strictly

Required Skills & Experience (Important)



Strong experience with AI image generation tools (required)



Examples: Higgsfield, Nano Banana Pro, Midjourney, Stable Diffusion, etc.



Experience creating AI models for fashion or jewelry



Good eye for aesthetics, realism, and consistency



Ability to follow detailed instructions and workflows



Reliable internet connection and availability



?? Please do not apply if you do not have prior AI image generation experience.

How to Apply



Please include:



Your experience with AI image generation



AI tools you have worked with

title: LEAD EXECUTIVE ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT / PROJECT MANAGER
description:
POSITION 1: LEAD EXECUTIVE ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT / PROJECT MANAGER



(Full-Time | Remote | UK Time)



Company: Virtue Architecture and Design Ltd

Location: London, United Kingdom (Remote – Philippines-based)

Hours: 40 hours/week | UK Time: 8:30 AM – 5:30 PM

Salary: USD 650/month



About Us



Virtue Architecture and Design Ltd is a growing London-based architectural practice specialising in residential extensions, loft conversions, and selected new-build and interior projects.



We are known for our strong organisation, professionalism, and excellent client relationships. As we continue to expand, we are looking for a highly capable Lead Executive Admin / Project Manager who will work directly with the Executive and oversee daily operations, client communication, and project coordination.



The Role



This is a lead role at the core of the business. You will act as the Executive’s right hand—managing clients, coordinating projects, reviewing outputs, and guiding the Support Admin and drafting team.



An architecture or construction background is strongly preferred, but we will consider candidates with exceptional organisational and project coordination experience who can quickly learn architectural workflows.



Key Requirements

-Full-time availability (40 hours/week)

-Able to work UK (London) hours consistently

-Architecture or construction background preferred

-Strong leadership, coordination, and decision-making skills

-Excellent written and spoken English

-Confident on client calls, video meetings, and presentations

-Highly organised and detail-oriented

-Comfortable reviewing drawings and technical information

-Willing to step into CAD or technical tasks when required (strong advantage)

-Familiarity with UK Planning or Building Control is a plus (training provided)



Key Responsibilities



Executive & Business Support

-Work directly with the Executive and follow instructions accurately

-Manage calendars, meetings, priorities, and daily workflows

-Prepare invoices, company documents, and internal records

-Compile monthly project and progress reports

-Improve systems, workflows, and internal organisation



Client & Team Management

-Handle client
s, calls, and follow-ups professionally

-Lead client communication and ensure clarity at all stages

-Distribute instructions to the Support Admin and team

-Monitor progress, deadlines, and quality of work

-Review team outputs and respond to queries clearly



Project & Technical Oversight

-Review architectural drawings, layouts, and documentation

-Interpret client revision requests and mark up instructions

-Coordinate planning applications and building control submissions

-Communicate with UK planning officers and external consultants

-Confidently present proposals in meetings and pre-application discussions



Personal Attributes

-Proactive and confident

-Calm, patient, and professional

-Strong leadership mindset

-Reliable and self-motivated

-Comfortable working in a small but fast-growing company



Benefits

-Paid training

-Salary increase (aubject to Executive Arrangements)

-10 additional paid leave days per year

-Fixed paid holidays:

     -New Year’s Day

     -Birthday Leave

     -Good Friday

     -All Souls’ / All Saints’ Day

     -Christmas Day



Why Join Virtue Architecture and Design Ltd?

-Work directly with the Executive, not buried under layers of management

-Be a key decision-maker, not just an assistant

-Gain real exposure to UK architecture, planning, and client management

-Join a well-reviewed, professional London practice

-Enjoy long-term stability with clear growth into senior operations or management

-Be trusted, respected, and valued for your contribution

-This role is ideal for someone who wants ownership, responsibility, and long-term growth, not just routine admin work.

title: Full-Time Online Class Assistant
description:
Company: Higher Results Education Inc.

Location: Remote (Philippines / Anywhere with stable internet)

Work Schedule: Classes depends on students schedule, Vancouver Time

Compensation: USD $250/month (paid via Wise)



About Us



Higher Results Education Inc. provides academic support to students in Canada. We are seeking reliable, proactive, and detail-oriented Online Class Assistants to attend live online classes on behalf of students, ensuring that all important information, instructions, and assignments are accurately captured and reported.



This is a great opportunity for someone self-motivated, tech-savvy, and comfortable in a virtual learning environment. High-performing assistants may be considered for team leader positions.



Responsibilities



Attend live online academic classes on behalf of assigned students (using the student’s account/email).



Actively engage in classes, monitor discussions, and follow instructions.



Complete student tasks, activities, assignments, quizzes, and exams as assigned.



Record class sessions for monitoring and reference purposes.



Take detailed notes and summarize key points from each class.



Submit daily class reports including:



Date and time (Vancouver time)



Student name



Subject/course title



Topics covered



Key instructions, deadlines, and announcements



Assignments, quizzes, and exams mentioned by the instructor



Communicate with professors and/or admin as needed for clarification or updates.



Ensure all assigned students’ classes are covered, and any conflicts or issues are promptly reported.



Requirements



Fluent in English (spoken and written)



Reliable, punctual, and proactive



Comfortable using Zoom, Google Meet, or similar platforms



Stable internet connection with a backup power source



Laptop, headset, and microphone for clear communication



Strong attention to detail and ability to follow instructions



Preferred Qualifications:



Experience in virtual assistance or online learning support



Strong multitasking and time management skills



Schedule



Depends on the students schedule



Flexible depending on student schedule, but attendance must be logged from 1:00 PM Vancouver time to ensure punctuality



Eligibility



Open to all genders



No age restrictions



How to Apply



Please send your resume and a short note explaining why you would be a great fit for this role to:
